event_name: Dark Underbelly of FinTech
event_summary: Join Cindy Gallop and Noah Landow for an informal discussion on the hidden complexities of FinTech, exploring its surprising influence on funding, art, and business creation. This event unveils the secretive world of financial services and advocates for greater equity and reform within the industry. Ideal for those interested in FinTech, entrepreneurship, and social impact.
event_description:
​Join Cindy Gallop (Founder and CEO of MakeLoveNotPorn) and Noah Landow (Founder and CEO at Macktez) for an informal conversation about the surprisingly complex, conservative, and convoluted financial services companies that together to form the secretive layers underpinning the electronic financial systems we take advantage of every day. Underneath the shiny Stripe, Apple Pay, Square and well-heeled Visa, MasterCard, and Amex, lies a sprawling world of companies and services that connect the world’s financial institutions to each other and you. 

​Cindy is an unabashed voice, advocating for more women founders, and embodying the principles for which she argues, for reform of this ever-more powerful industry. During this engaging conversation, we will explore how the poorly understood world of financial services controls what art is created, what companies are founded and funded, and what businesses are able to get the money they need to build exciting tools. Strange and surprisingly limitations and conventions abound in this space, hidden largely from view, and wrapped in euphemism and innuendo. It dictates who has access to resources, and gatekeeps access to reaching financial success across a spectrum of people and companies.

​Join us at the Macktez office, after work, over light snacks and sips, for a thought-provoking discussion on how a broader, deeper understanding of FinTech could enable positive change to create greater opportunities for equity in the decades ahead. 

Event Structure
We ask that guests arrive between 7-7:30 pm to minimize disruption during the talk.

7 pm - Doors open, opportunity to mingle over snacks and sips with other attendees
7:30 pm - Guests take their seats for the talk
8:15 pm - Informal mixer resumes

On Attendance
We have a limited capacity (and often have a long waitlist!). If your plans change, please update your registration so someone else can join.

A bit about Macktez, and why we host this series
Macktez is a technology consultancy collaborating with organizations going through dynamic change. 

​​Our goal is to form a lasting partnership between our team and our clients, so we can anticipate their technology challenges and help them navigate growth, disruption, and other evolving conditions.

​​Each event in our Tête-à-Tech series is an opportunity to explore a specific cultural, scientific, historical, and personal issue. We fire at the synapses that connect each topic to other fields of interest and to our individual lives. And we do so in a comfortable environment to facilitate conversation that can be casual, surprising, and illuminating.

To learn more, visit us at macktez.com.

event_name: Creative Practices and Percussion
event_summary: Composer/percussionist Lisa Schonberg and Macktez CEO Noah Landow discuss the creative intersection of drums, percussion, rhythm, and ecological sound art, exploring diverse applications from bioacoustics to electronic music. The event includes a relaxed networking opportunity with light refreshments at Macktez's office. Ideal for musicians, sound artists, and anyone interested in creative technology and interdisciplinary collaboration.
event_description:
​Join Lisa Schonberg (composer, percussionist, and ecological sound artist) and Noah Landow (Founder and CEO at Macktez) for deep dive into the world of drums, percussion, and rhythm. 

​In her work Lisa documents soundscapes, insects, and habitat through music composition, writing, and multimedia collaboration. This conversation will draw on Lisa’s work, which has included the design of music composition systems, research on ant bioacoustics with entomologists in the Brazilian Amazon, sound studies with landscape architects in Oregon,,and music composition concerning Pacific Northwest old-growth forests, Hawaiian endangered bees, fungi, and plastics. She has also taught drums for most of her life and is the author of “The DIY Guide to Drums,” a non-intimidating and playful illustrated instruction book for the drum kit.

​Join us at the Macktez office, after work, over light snacks and sips, for a thought-provoking discussion on essentials of drums and percussion in music, concepts and applications of rhythm, and examination of the recent evolution of electronic recording, sampling, and sequencing.

Event Structure
We ask that guests arrive between 7-7:30 pm to minimize disruption during the talk.

7 pm - Doors open, opportunity to mingle over snacks and sips with other attendees
7:30 pm - Guests take their seats for the talk
8:15 pm - Informal mixer resumes

On Attendance
We have a limited capacity (and often have a long waitlist!). If your plans change, please update your registration so someone else can join.

Macktez is a technology consultancy collaborating with organizations going through dynamic change.

event_name: Mission-Critical Feedback: What Fighter Pilots Teach Us About Learning
event_summary: Learn how fighter pilot debriefing techniques can revolutionize education. This dynamic simulation explores high-stakes feedback systems and their application to schools, benefiting educators and leaders seeking improved learning outcomes. Discover actionable strategies for fostering a culture of rapid, precise feedback in educational settings.
full_address: The Squadron NYC, 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich St 10th floor, New York, NY 10007, USA
event_description:
​Join FOHE and Squadron for a dynamic simultation exploring the systems, culture, and discipline of feedback in the armed forces.

Fighter pilots rely on rapid, precise feedback to improve in real time. What if schools did the same? Join us to explore how debrief culture, performance loops, and high-stakes learning from the cockpit can reshape how we teach, lead, and grow in education.

event_name: The American Founding in One Evening (1763-1803)
event_summary: This two-hour event provides a condensed history of the American Founding (1763-1803), exploring key events and their modern relevance, including the lead-up to the Revolution, the Articles of Confederation, and the early years of the new nation. A post-event exam (optional) tests knowledge retention, making it ideal for history buffs and anyone seeking a deeper understanding of American history.
full_address: 111 Conselyea St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
event_description:
​What really happened in the American Founding?

​Many people talk about it in superficial terms, but the American founding was an era that stretched out for decades.

​And maybe you know about 1776, maybe 1789. But what happened before, after, and in between those dates? Why is knowing any of this relevant for the modern day? Is it relevant to modern New York City?

​Come and spend two hours with Daniel and Maximum New York to get a condensed version of The Founding Forty: 1763-1803.

​This event will end with an exam to see what you retain. You don't have to take it—you can just come and watch/listen—but you can also treat this as an opportunity to learn more about the American Founding than most people know!

​Some general topics to explore before coming if you want:
​I. Introduction and “The Pamphlet Era,” 1763-1776

​What happened in the run-up to the war? What caused it? Could it have been prevented?

​The French and Indian War or the Seven Years’ War? perspectives from the U.S. and Europe.

​We have always blogged: what the Americans and British said to each other, and how they said it (pamphlets).

​II) The Revolutionary War and Confederal Era, 1776-1789

​A summary overview of the war.

​The Treaty of Paris, 1783.

​The French Revolution, compared with the American.

​What is a revolution? What ramifications does this question have for today?

​The dysfunction of the Articles of Confederation and the chaos of the 1780s.

​The Constitutional Convention of 1787, and the failed revision attempts before it.

​The adoption of the Constitution.

​III) Birth of the Modern System, 1789-1803, part 1

​The Bill of Rights.

​The doctrine of incorporation, Barron ex rel. Tiernan v. Mayor of Baltimore (1833).

​The Judiciary Act of 1789.

​The founding of Washington, D.C., 1790.

​Chisholm v. Georgia (1793); the jurisdiction of SCOTUS, federalism, and the 11th amendment

​The Naval Act of 1794 and the Barbary Pirates.

​Marbury v. Madison (1803).

​IV) Birth of the Modern System, 1789-1803, part 2

​A comparison of the Constitution of 1789 with that of 2023

​A brief overview of the modern system

event_name: Product Development 101: What Founders Need to Build Right in the AI Era
event_summary: NYC-based founder Rakesh Raju (Codewalla) shared essential product development strategies for the AI era at this Startup Grind event. Attendees learned to strategically integrate AI while maintaining core product fundamentals, avoiding common pitfalls, and leveraging real-world insights from B2B startups. Ideal for early-stage founders and product teams navigating AI's impact on product success.
full_address: The Yard: Herald Square Coworking Office Space Manhattan, 106 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
event_description:
​In this Startup Grind special event, Rakesh Raju - the Founder of Codewalla, a New York City-based product studio - will deliver an essential talk that addresses the critical product challenges facing founders in today's AI-driven landscape. 

​This session will guide you through the 5 critical shifts every founder must make to build successfully in the AI era. You'll gain practical insights into leveraging AI effectively while maintaining focus on the product fundamentals that drive real success.

​What You'll Learn

​Success Factors: What actually increases your odds of product success in the current market

​Core Principles: The product fundamentals that remain essential and those that have evolved in the AI era

​Strategic AI Integration: Where AI creates genuine leverage versus where it introduces new risks 👈

​Common Pitfalls: How to avoid the early-stage traps that derail most teams

​Real-World Insights: Patterns and lessons drawn from B2B startup builds across New York City

​You'll walk away with a practical framework for using AI strategically without compromising on fundamentals, plus a clear roadmap for building smarter, not just faster.

​Featured Speaker

​Rakesh Raju brings exceptional depth to this discussion as the founder of Codewalla, an NYC-based AI-native product studio that helps B2B startups and lean enterprise teams accelerate their builds through modular systems and strategic AI integration.

​With a distinguished background as a seasoned CTO at major companies including Disney, Microsoft, and RealNetworks, Rakesh has guided numerous NYC startups through the complete journey from initial concept to traction, scaling, and successful exit.

​His expertise spans software architecture, emerging technologies (AI, VR, agentic systems), and product-market fit strategy, backed by two decades of hands-on leadership experience across both startup and enterprise environments.

​As a former "Scientist of the Year" and active early-stage investor, Rakesh is recognized for delivering clear, actionable guidance to founders facing high-stakes product decisions.

​Who Should Attend

​Early-stage founders navigating product development in the AI landscape

​Product teams exploring or implementing AI solutions

​Builders and entrepreneurs looking to increase their odds of creating successful products

​Anyone seeking practical guidance on balancing AI innovation with proven product fundamentals

​Is your MVP live but not clicking? If you've launched an MVP, but are struggling to gain traction, click here for a free, no-nonsense MVP audit by Codewalla designed to turn it into a product users love (and return to).

​Tickets for this event include food and drinks, as well as exclusive access to this brilliant product engineer..

​You'll also meet dozens of other high-performing entrepreneurs who are creating their next big thing. Seriously, it's some of the best founder networking in the city.

​Getting a ticket guarantees admission. No waitlisting.

​And don't miss our recurring founder social events over coffee or cocktails. It's a great opportunity for operators to network with each other to share best practices and find new resources to build your startup the right way. See our full event lineup here.

event_name: DeSciNYC: Genome Editing in Early Human Embryos
event_summary: Dr. Diego Marin's DeSciNYC talk explored the ethical and scientific complexities of genome editing in human embryos, highlighting its potential for disease prevention alongside current limitations and future alternatives. This event is ideal for those interested in genetics, biotechnology, and the ethical implications of emerging technologies.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​​Genome editing tools allow the introduction of precise changes in the DNA. For this ability, they became indispensable for basic biological research and hold great promise for future therapeutic applications. The same technologies are being utilized also in early human embryos for better understanding of key developmental regulators and DNA repair mechanisms. In the future, precise correction of specific genes might enable curing devastating diseases early in the development or decreasing the risks of certain diseases. Although continuous research is needed before such an intervention becomes safe, the first gene-edited babies were already born. This talk aims to contribute to the debate about human germline gene editing by putting it into a broader context of human biology, discussing the benefits, current limitations, and possible future alternatives leading to the prevention of genetic diseases.

---------

Dr. Diego Marin is the Deputy Director and Head of Global Business Development & Scientific Affairs at Genomic Prediction. He holds a PhD in Genetics and Cancer Biology. In addition to his industry role, he serves as an Adjunct Professor in the Department of Genetics at Rutgers University

​
🐦Stay Connected about Future Events:
Twitter: @descinyc_
Instagram: @descinyc

​PS: Apply to be a member of the DeSci NYC group chat: https://forms.gle/AmUtotmCgWgGxWDp6

​Join us for a discussion and meet up with McKenna Fitzgerald from Americans for Responsible Innovation (ARI), a nonprofit think tank focused on AI policy advocacy.

​Topics

​Current state of AI regulation at federal and state levels

​Policy developments following the Senate moratorium vote

​How the EA community can contribute to AI governance

​About ARI

​Founded in 2023, ARI advocates for AI governance that protects the public while maintaining competitiveness. The organization operates without corporate funding.

event_name: Women in AI: Leading with Vision Fireside Chat and Social

event_name: Engineering AI Reading Group
event_summary: The Engineering AI Reading Group will explore v0, a novel full-stack coding app aiming to revolutionize website building, with guest speakers from Vercel. This deep-dive session, open to all, focuses on modern AI tools and their impact on development, particularly relevant for those interested in AI, front-end development, and the Vercel ecosystem. Apply by July 10th to attend at Columbia University.

event_description:
​This week we'll be reading/playing with v0! With Chloe and Flo @Vercel being our guest speakers!

​https://v0.dev/

v0 is a full stack vibe-coding app, focused on front-end development and it's integration with the Vercel stack (backend, database, auth, etc).

​We're super excited because in the limit, v0 could technically replace all website building sites (wix, webflow, etc) given it's ease of use and configurability.

​Please apply by Wednesday night (Jul 10), as we need to add you to our attendee list at Columbia University so we can sign you in.

​Engineering AI RG do deep dives on tools, libraries and codebases that are used frequently in the modern AI stack.

​AI DevTools (Claude-Code, Cursor, Codex, etc) are released weekly.

​Anthropic says 90% of their code will be written by Claude in 6 months.

​Each week, we'll meet somewhere in NY, and we'll pick a different codebase/tool to read deeply into and hack with.

​All are welcome.

event_description:
​AI Sailing Sundays - NYC Edition

​Join a summer-long series of informal, three-hour sailing sessions designed to bridge the gap between AI founders, NYC investors, and Enterprise Leaders. AI Sailing Sundays is your chance to swap insights, ask tough questions, and build genuine relationships - off the beaten path and out on the water.

​What to Expect?

​Casual Networking: No slide decks or formal pitches - just natural, coffee-fueled conversation on deck.

​Peer Learning: Founders share real-world hurdles; VCs surface the technical and business questions they really care about.

​Enterprise Insights: Product leaders from major companies discuss AI needs, use cases, and partnership opportunities.

​Summer-Long Community: Up to 24 sailings across the season.

​Follow-Ups on Land: Interested in a deeper dive? Exchange contact info on deck and coordinate one-on-one meetings ashore.

​Why Sailing?

​Unique Venue: Stand out from the standard conference room or Zoom call; make memorable connections.

​Who Should Join

​AI startup founders looking for investor feedback and peer support

​VCs and angel investors eager to deepen their AI fluency

event_name: Lets Talk AI: Real Talk - No Fluff

full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​
Building in AI often feels like building in fast-forward—investor expectations, tech that evolves overnight, and the quiet weight of trying to stay human in the process.

​This is not a panel.
Not a pitch night.

​Join us for an intimate, guided conversation circle designed for founders, builders, and creatives in the AI space who are craving real talk—beyond performance metrics and pitch decks.

​Together, we’ll explore what it means to build with purpose, navigate burnout, and reconnect with the human side of innovation. With voices from AWS, Applify, and more, this gathering offers candid dialogue, deep listening, and community catharsis.

​🗓️ Date: July 14th
🕖 Time: 5–7 PM
📍 Location: Impact Hub New York Metropolitan Area

“When we remember the human, we build better AI.”

​Martin Pomykala
Global Strategy Leader-Data & AI, AWS

GTM specialist, AWS

WW Business Development Specialist. Charles Leads market initiatives across databases for AI implementation.

✨ In Conversation With:

Founder & CEO, Applify

Founder, Coffee & Catharsis LLC

event_description:

event_name: Marketing Leader Summit: Building AI-Powered Teams To Do More with Less
event_summary: This Marketing Leader Summit empowers NYC's fastest-growing companies' small marketing teams (5-10 people) to leverage AI for amplified performance and efficiency. Attendees gain practical strategies, tool recommendations, and networking opportunities to achieve enterprise-level results with limited resources. Ideal for marketing directors, VPs, CMOs, and founders seeking scalable growth through AI integration.
full_address: Fabrik NYC, 12-16 Vestry St 4th Floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
event_description:
​Marketing Leader Summit: Building AI-Powered Teams To Do More with Less

​Join an exclusive gathering of marketing executives from NYC's fastest-growing companies as we explore how artificial intelligence is transforming small marketing teams into high-performance powerhouses. This summit is designed specifically for marketing leaders managing teams of 5-10 people who need to deliver enterprise-level results with startup-level resources.

​Why This Summit Matters Now

​The marketing landscape has fundamentally shifted. With economic pressures demanding greater efficiency and AI technology reaching unprecedented accessibility, marketing leaders can no longer afford to operate with traditional approaches. Companies implementing AI-driven marketing strategies are seeing 41% increases in performance metrics while reducing operational overhead. This isn't about replacing your team—it's about amplifying their capabilities exponentially.

​What You'll Discover

​Strategic AI Integration Framework: Learn how to identify which marketing functions benefit most from AI automation, from content creation and campaign management to analytics and customer engagement. Discover proven methodologies for integrating AI tools without disrupting existing workflows or overwhelming your team.

​Practical Implementation Roadmaps: Move beyond theoretical discussions to actionable strategies. Explore real-world case studies showing how marketing teams have successfully deployed AI for content generation, social media management, email automation, and predictive analytics. See concrete examples of ROI improvements and efficiency gains achieved by teams similar to yours.

​Team Transformation Strategies: Master the art of upskilling your existing team members to become AI-native marketers. Learn how to foster adoption, overcome resistance, and create systems that allow your team to focus on strategic thinking while AI handles routine execution.

​Technology Stack Optimization: Get hands-on exposure to the most effective AI marketing tools currently delivering results. From AI-powered content creation platforms to automated campaign optimization systems, discover which technologies provide the highest impact for small teams with limited budgets.

​Who Should Attend

​This summit is exclusively for marketing executives and senior marketing professionals. Ideal attendees include:

​Marketing Directors and VPs leading small but ambitious teams

​CMOs at growing companies seeking competitive advantages through technology

​Marketing Managers responsible for driving growth with constrained resources

​Founders with marketing responsibilities looking to scale efficiently

​The Competitive Advantage

​While larger companies struggle with complex AI implementations across massive teams, smaller marketing organizations have a unique opportunity to become more agile and efficient than their enterprise competitors. This summit will show you how to leverage that advantage, turning your team's size from a limitation into a strategic strength.

​Real Results, Real Impact: Attendees will leave with immediately implementable strategies, vetted tool recommendations, and a clear 90-day action plan for AI integration. You'll join a network of forward-thinking marketing leaders who understand that the future belongs to teams that can do more with less—and do it better than anyone else.

​Limited to 50 Leaders to ensure intimate networking and meaningful connections with peers facing similar challenges and opportunities.

​Who We Are

​We are Full Funnel Growth, an elite team of growth strategists partnering with scaling brands to solve complex challenges—optimizing channel mix, building data infrastructure, and refining funnel strategy through data-driven creativity. Unlike traditional agencies with siloed services, we seamlessly integrate with your tech stack and teams to architect and execute comprehensive, personalized marketing strategies that drive sustained growth.

​Transform your marketing team from resource-constrained to resource-optimized. The AI revolution in marketing isn't coming—it's here. The question is whether you'll lead it or be left behind.

event_name: GenJam: Make an AI Film in 3 Hrs!
event_summary: GenJam is a 3-hour Berlin event challenging participants to create short AI-powered films, exploring future storytelling through innovative tools and techniques. Participants will prototype narratives, using AI platforms like Luma and ElevenLabs, culminating in a screening and awards ceremony. Ideal for narrative designers, AI creators, performers, filmmakers, and anyone passionate about pushing creative boundaries.
full_address: New York, NY, USA
event_description:
​FREE CREDITS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP PRIZES!

​What does storytelling look like in 2040? In this GenJam, we’re stepping beyond the page and the screen to explore how AI, performance, and wild imagination can reshape narrative itself. From simulated memoirs to sentient TikToks, algorithmic folklore to immersive propaganda, you’ll prototype a new mode of storytelling—and bring it to life in a short film.

​There are no rules. Only format glitches, character hallucinations, and narrative experiments waiting to be born. Let’s jam.

​What You’ll Do

​💡 Concept the Narrative of the Future

​You’ll start with strange prompts, stranger tools, and a deceptively blank canvas.

​Invent new genres, remix old tropes, and conjure up fictional media from the next century—complete with world-lore, formats, and fictional audiences.

​🎥 Produce a Story Artifact

​Turn your concept into a tangible piece of media using tools like Luma, Suno, Runway, ElevenLabs, and more.

​Whether it’s a trailer for an interactive memory archive, a short film voiced by AI ancestors, or a propaganda reel from a utopian cult—we want to see the future you’re imagining.

​🏆 Share & Celebrate

​We’ll screen everyone’s work and vote on winners in categories like:

​• Most Uncanny Future

​• Most Emotionally Real

​• Best Use of AI Medium

​• “What Did I Just Watch?” Award

​Who Should Come

​🎨 Narrative Designers & Worldbuilders – Invent tomorrow’s mythologies.

​🤖 AI Creators & Tinkerers – Push generative tools to unexpected edges.

​🎭 Actors, Performers, and Voice Artists – Animate future personas.

​🎬 Filmmakers & Editors – Capture the surreal, fast.

​Schedule

​📍 Location: [Insert Berlin venue here]

​⏰ 6:00 PM – Doors Open + Mingling

​🎬 6:30 PM – Intro + Tool Demos

​🧠 7:00 PM – Theme Reveal + Group Formation

​🎥 7:15–9:30 PM – Production Time

​🏁 9:30–10:00 PM – Screening & Awards

​What to Bring

​💻 Laptop Required – Bring your device for creating and editing.

​🛠️ Tool Access – Have logins to Luma, ElevenLabs, ChatGPT, Suno, etc.? Use them. We’ll provide shared access when we can.

​🍕 Dinner Included – Because no one should remix reality on an empty stomach.

​This isn’t just a jam. It’s a preview of what storytelling could become.

​Come prototype the future—and leave with a film from a timeline that doesn’t exist yet.

​🌀 Let’s bend narrative space-time. In Berlin.

​Whether you're just starting with MCP or have built multiple servers, this gathering offers practical insights and real-world examples to advance your projects and connect with others pushing the boundaries of what's possible with MCP.

​What to expect:

​Featured Speakers:

​Anthony Giuliano from the Block team presenting on Goose - open source, extensible AI agent that goes beyond code suggestions

​More speakers to be announced

​Presentations from the Apollo team on Apollo MCP Server and how we built MCP tools for event cfp management

​Live demos from AI and MCP builders 

​Light bites, Refreshments, Networking and more!

​Agenda

​5:30 pm Doors open (Light bites & Refreshments)

​​6:00 pm Welcome and Introductions

​​6:10 pm Presentations and Demos

​​7:45 pm Networking

​Space is limited. RSVP to save your spot!

​Want to demo?

​​Want to demo something in the MCP Server space? We're always looking for showcase technical talks from the community related to MCP server development. Submit your demo/talk here 👉https://bit.ly/4mWKq7a

​​By registering for this event, you agree to receive event-related communications and marketing communications from Apollo about our products and services. You can unsubscribe at any time. View our privacy policy at www.apollographql.com/privacy-policy.

event_name: AI Safety Meet-Up NYC
event_summary: NYC's AI Safety Meet-Up discussed responsible AI governance, featuring NYS Assemblymember Bores' insights on the RAISE Act and its implications. The event offered networking, Q&A, and aimed to foster dialogue among AI experts, policymakers, and interested citizens. Ideal for those seeking to understand and influence AI policy in New York and beyond.
full_address: Kings County, New York
event_description:
​Join us for our third community event in New York City!

​This event is co-hosted by BlueDot Impact, the AI Safety Awareness Project, and AI Safety NYC. We'll be gathering for an evening of conversation and community around the question: How can we help shape good AI governance?

​Joining us is New York State Assemblymember Alex Bores for a conversation on AI policy, public voice, and the need for thoughtful tech governance in New York and beyond. He is author of the recently passed RAISE Act which, if signed into law, would establish safety standards for frontier AI models.

​The evening will feature:

​A short talk by Assemblymember Bores on the RAISE Act and the future of AI policy

​An open Q&A with attendees

​Time to connect, network, and share ideas over light snacks and beverages

​Whether you’re deep in the world of AI or just curious about how policy is catching up to fast-moving tech, this event is for you. Expect a thoughtful, welcoming crowd of:

​BlueDot Impact course alumni and community members

​Technologists, researchers, and civic leaders

​New Yorkers curious about the societal impacts of AI

​Space is limited, so please RSVP to reserve your spot!

event_name: UGLY TALK: HOW TO RAISE A PRE-SEED ROUND IN 2025 FOR A B2B STARTUP
event_summary: This "Ugly Talk" event offers B2B startup founders and investors raw, honest insights into securing pre-seed funding in the AI-transformed 2025 market. Experienced founders like Chris Anzalone (Knowledge) and Nitin Gupta (Aithon) share crucial strategies and lessons learned, focusing on adapting SaaS models and leveraging AI for growth. Ideal for B2B founders, product leaders, investors, and those seeking to navigate the evolving AI landscape.
full_address: The Yard: Herald Square Coworking Office Space Manhattan, 106 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
event_description:
​💡 What’s the Ugly Truth

​The world of B2B is shifting fast.
Artificial intelligence is transforming how software is built, sold, and scaled. Business models that once felt reliable are now evolving. The founders who succeed are the ones asking hard questions and making bold moves.

​This event opens up the conversations many are having behind closed doors. You’ll hear the raw truth about how AI is reshaping the B2B landscape from those navigating it right now.

​ 

​🎯 Why You Should Attend

​If you’re building in B2B or advising those who are, this event will sharpen your thinking and expand your network. You’ll get a clearer view of what is working in today’s AI-driven environment and discover how others are thriving in the face of change.

​Join us for an energizing evening of ideas, lessons, and possibilities.

​

​🙋 Who You’ll Meet

​Founders of B2B startups leading the charge in innovation

​AI-curious product leaders and developers

​Investors looking for fresh thinking and smart execution

​Industry professionals supporting founders across every stage

​This is a space where people building the future connect, learn, and inspire one another.

​ 

​🎤 Who’s on the Panel

​Chris Anzalone - Founder & CEO of Knowledge

​Chris Anzalone is the Founder and CEO of Knowledge, an AI-powered sales intelligence platform analyzing over 30 billion signals daily to predict real-time buyer behavior at the individual level. With a track record of building and scaling go-to-market organizations, Chris previously founded and exited a high-performing sales agency that booked over 10,000 meetings annually for enterprise clients. He also served as a researcher on a National Science Foundation grant studying algorithmic bias, where he focused on the ethical implications of AI systems in decision-making. Chris brings a unique blend of commercial execution and academic insight to the evolving AI landscape.

​

​Nitin Gupta - CEO of Aithon

​Nitin is the Co-Founder and CEO at Aithon. Nitin has two decades of sales and business development experience across consulting, startups, and public companies. He has built billion dollar businesses, and seen successful exits.

​Prior to founding Aithon, he was the CRO at Genesis Global, and before that spent 8 years at AWS in different sales leadership roles.

​ 

​More speakers coming soon! Stay tuned!

​

​💬 What We’ll Talk About

​Proven ways B2B founders are evolving their SaaS model in response to AI

​How to apply AI directly into your product, development, and growth strategies

​Key decisions that led to success or sparked critical learning moments

​Tactics that help you stay relevant, competitive, and positioned to lead

​Walk away with practical tools, real frameworks, and the confidence to rethink what comes next.

​ 

​🤝 Co-Hosted With

​NYC B2B - Join 5,000+ founders, operators & VCs in NYC’s top B2B startup community—get NYC startup events, resources & deal flow.

​

​GREY Journal – Media partner spotlighting modern entrepreneurs (featured on Apple News + Google News).

​ 

​🤝 Venue Partner

​The Yard - Private offices & coworking spaces for individuals and teams

​

​🎥 Get a taste of past Ugly Talk energy:

​• Official Website

​• 2024 Video Recap

​

​⭐ About Ugly Talk:

​Started in 2019, Ugly Talk has been transforming business setbacks into breakthrough “aha!” moments by hosting unfiltered, no-nonsense events where battle-tested entrepreneurs share their raw lessons and insights.

​With a growing presence in cities like New York, Chicago, San Francisco, and Miami, we’ve built a vibrant community of thousands of founders and industry leaders making a profound impact on the entrepreneurial landscape.

event_name: AI Sailing Sundays - NYC Edition
event_summary: NYC's AI Sailing Sundays offer a unique networking series for AI founders, investors, and enterprise leaders to connect informally on sailing trips. Expect relaxed conversations, peer learning, and potential partnerships, all within a limited-capacity, summer-long program. RSVP now to secure your spot on a boat!
event_description:
​AI Sailing Sundays - NYC Edition

​Join a summer-long series of informal, three-hour sailing sessions designed to bridge the gap between AI founders, NYC investors, and Enterprise Leaders. AI Sailing Sundays is your chance to swap insights, ask tough questions, and build genuine relationships - off the beaten path and out on the water.

​What to Expect?

​Casual Networking: No slide decks or formal pitches - just natural, coffee-fueled conversation on deck.

​Peer Learning: Founders share real-world hurdles; VCs surface the technical and business questions they really care about.

​Enterprise Insights: Product leaders from major companies discuss AI needs, use cases, and partnership opportunities.

​Summer-Long Community: Up to 24 sailings across the season.

​Follow-Ups on Land: Interested in a deeper dive? Exchange contact info on deck and coordinate one-on-one meetings ashore.

​Why Sailing?

​Relaxed Atmosphere: Fresh air and open water put everyone at ease - easy icebreakers and authentic dialogue.

​Unique Venue: Stand out from the standard conference room or Zoom call; make memorable connections.

​Shared Experience: Tack, trim, or simply take in the skyline as you exchange ideas.

​Who Should Join

​AI startup founders looking for investor feedback and peer support

​VCs and angel investors eager to deepen their AI fluency

​Enterprise technology leaders scouting AI trends and partnerships

​Seats are limited to 6 participants per boat.
Secure your spot for the inaugural AI Sailing Sunday: RSVP now on Luma!

event_description:
​​​Come join us for a chill afternoon dedicated to your sidequests!

Whether it's writing, painting, coding that new app, or literally any other “SideQuest” you’ve been putting off, this is your space to create. This isn’t about 'work' in the traditional sense—it's about crafting something meaningful to you, free from pressure.

​​We'll have focused work sessions to help you make real progress, all set to the backdrop of some lo-fi, balanced with breaks to reset, unblock each other, and mingle with other creators. 

​​Rough Agenda

​​2:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Introductions and Intention Sharing

​​2:30 PM - 3:45 PM: Deep Focus Session 1

​​3:45 PM - 4:15 PM: Break

​​4:15 PM - 5:30 PM: Deep Focus Session 2

​​5:30 PM - 6:00 PM: if you wanna share your work, we’d love to see it! If not, that’s cool, too!

*please plan on staying for the whole duration to avoid disrupting the quiet work periods

​​**thank you to fractal tech for hosting us! and thank you to our friends at PurdueHackers, CozySundays and Socratica for seeding the idea!

event_name: DeSciNYC: Genome Editing in Early Human Embryos
event_summary: DeSciNYC hosted Stepan Jerabek, a leading researcher in human embryo genome editing, to discuss the ethical and scientific implications of this groundbreaking technology. The talk explored the potential for curing genetic diseases through gene editing while acknowledging the current limitations and ongoing ethical debates. This event is ideal for anyone interested in the future of genetics, bioethics, or developmental biology.
event_description:
​Genome editing tools allow the introduction of precise changes in the DNA. For this ability, they became indispensable for basic biological research and hold great promise for future therapeutic applications. The same technologies are being utilized also in early human embryos for better understanding of key developmental regulators and DNA repair mechanisms. In the future, precise correction of specific genes might enable curing devastating diseases early in the development or decreasing the risks of certain diseases. Although continuous research is needed before such an intervention becomes safe, the first gene-edited babies were already born. This talk aims to contribute to the debate about human germline gene editing by putting it into a broader context of human biology, discussing the benefits, current limitations, and possible future alternatives leading to the prevention of genetic diseases.

Stepan Jerabek is a postdoctoral research scientist in the Pediatrics Department at Columbia University. He is also an associate scientist at IOCB Prague, an institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences. Stepan’s interest in early development and genome stability brought him to the Egli laboratory, where he uses genome editing tools to study DNA repair in human preimplantation embryos. In 2024, Stepan was the recipient of the Druckenmiller Fellowship Award from the New York Stem Cell Foundation Research Institute. Stepan completed his doctoral training at the Max Planck Institute for Molecular Biomedicine in Germany and was a research fellow at Harvard Medical School, working in the lab of genetics pioneer George Church.

Instagram: @descinyc

​Come meet new & old friends over certified legit Texas food and drinks.

​Shiner on tap? Check

​Texas-themed cocktails? Got 'em.

​Sausage direct from Kreuz in Lockhart? You bet.

​We'll be in the front bar area at the hightop tables. Look for the iconic Texpats table sign.

​Hill Country is a tribute to the traditional Central Texas barbecue experience, Southern hospitality, and the artistry of Downtown Austin.

event_name: Texpats Happy Hour at Trailer Park Lounge
event_summary: Join fellow Texans (and those who appreciate a little Texas flair) for a fun happy hour at the quirky Trailer Park Lounge in NYC, boasting a unique atmosphere, delicious food (burgers & margaritas!), and a chance to meet new people. Perfect for anyone seeking a casual, convivial evening with a kitschy twist.
full_address: Trailer Park Lounge, 271 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
event_description:
​Key West meets Texas at this bar, where Christmas lights and silver fringe run between framed photos of low-rent icons like Tammy Faye Bakker and Elvis.

​In case you missed all the trashy references, a mock trailer home is built into the wall. The food is served in baskets and cooked to satisfy your Presley-esque grease cravings (try the sweet-potato fries).

​Reviews say it's "best margarita's and burgers in NYC" and "great place to grab food and drinks after playing basketball with my buddies."

​We'll see about that.

​Join for a casual drink and a bite to eat. Meet some new friends and reconnect with old ones.

If you do not currently have an MLB Ballpark account, you can create one later using the email address you shared.

event_name: UGLY TALK: CAN YOU REALLY BUILD SOFTWARE BASED ON “VIBES”
event_summary: This Ugly Talk event explores the realities of low-code/no-code development, featuring real-world success stories and cautionary tales from experienced founders and CTOs. Attendees will learn practical strategies, avoid common pitfalls, and network with industry leaders. Ideal for founders, early-stage teams, and investors navigating the rapid evolution of builder tech.
full_address: The Yard: Herald Square Coworking Office Space Manhattan, 106 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
event_description:
​Low-code. No-code. VibeCoding. In 2025, these terms are trending, promising faster builds, leaner teams, and overnight MVPs. But is the hype holding up? Or are early adopters quietly rewriting entire codebases behind the scenes?

​In this UglyTalk, we crack open the good, the bad, and the downright ugly behind building with low-code and no-code platforms. From shortcuts that became nightmares to smart frameworks that scaled smoothly, this event demystifies what really works and what doesn’t. Straight from the folks in the trenches.

​ 

​🎯 Why You Should Attend

​Whether you’re launching your first product or scaling your second startup, you’ve likely been pitched a “faster” way to build. This is your chance to:

​Avoid the Pain: Hear the cautionary tales before they become your own.

​Steal What Works: Learn from proven wins and hard-earned lessons.

​Get Tactical: Walk away with practical strategies and real tools you can use tomorrow.

​Meet Your People: Founders, CTOs, and ecosystem enablers. All in one room.

​

​🙋 Who You’ll Meet

​Non-technical founders exploring new ways to ship without writing code

​Early-stage startup teams iterating their first or second product

​CTOs and product leaders figuring out what to bet on for scale

​Investors and ecosystem enablers staying ahead of the next wave of builder tech

​Whether you’re building, backing, or bridging tech products. This room is for you.

​ 

​🎤 Who’s on the Panel

​Christina Stejskalova - Builder at Ideaslab

​Christina Stejskalova is a data leader with 13+ years of experience and a reputation for turning chaos into clarity. That's the boring bit! From moving to the U.S. being rejected from 200 jobs to landing a job in FANNG and later leading entire functions, I’ve built and rebuilt with grit as my north star. I founded a startup to fight for equality of opportunity, and after its close, I rose fast, becoming a data director younger than most. I’ve transformed two data orgs end to end. Colleagues call me “Data Christina”, but really, I’m just a vibe coder, and grit is my programming language.

​

​Dileep Mishra - Founder of CyberSE.AI

​Dileep Mishra is a Cybersecurity professional with 20+ years of experience. He has held senior Presales roles at leading technology companies like Akamai, Hughes and Radware. He is now building an AI Security Consulting practice, focused on helping organizations secure their AI deployments.

​More speakers coming soon!

​ 

​Moderator:

​Jamie Redington - Co-Founder of FounderSquare

​Jamie Redington is a Venture Capital Analyst and aerospace engineer with a diverse background spanning startups, engineering, and finance. He is currently a VC Analyst at C2 Ventures and the Co-Founder of FounderSquare. Jamie brings experience from across venture operations, equity trading, and engineering—from designing cutting-edge hydroponic systems at Redi-farms to trading equities at Chimera Securities.

​

​💬 What We’ll Talk About

​The Real Pros & Cons: Where low-code shines and where it breaks

​Best Practices That Don’t Suck: How to build smart, not sloppy

​Horror Stories: Lessons from shipping fast… and regretting it

​The Pivot Moments: When founders ditched their tools (or doubled down)

​What’s Coming Next: The future of VibeCoding, platforms, and product dev culture

​ 

​🤝 Co-Hosted With

​Founder Square - is on a mission to uncover outstanding founders who are breaking boundaries, pushing innovation to new heights, and making a lasting impact on the world. We aren’t just choosing any founders—we’re seeking the boldest, the brightest, and the most inspiring. Each selected founder will be handpicked, pre-screened, and interviewed by our dedicated team, ensuring that only the most deserving stories make it to the top.

​

​GREY Journal – Media partner spotlighting modern entrepreneurs (Apple News + Google News)

​ 

​🤝 Venue Partner

​The Yard - Private offices & coworking spaces for individuals and teams.

​

​​🎥 Get a taste of past Ugly Talk energy:

​​• Official Website

​​• 2024 Video Recap

​​

​​⭐ About Ugly Talk:

​​Started in 2019, Ugly Talk has been transforming business setbacks into breakthrough “aha!” moments by hosting unfiltered, no-nonsense events where battle-tested entrepreneurs share their raw lessons and insights.

​​With a growing presence in cities like New York, Chicago, San Francisco, and Miami, we’ve built a vibrant community of thousands of founders and industry leaders making a profound impact on the entrepreneurial landscape.

​You're invited to Design Space NYC — a creative coworking experience for founders, designers, and product builders.

​Hosted by Framer, v0, and Bolt, this invite-only session brings together some of NYC’s most talented makers for a day of focused work, real-time feedback, and new connections.

​Whether you're building a new site, polishing your product’s UX, or need a fresh perspective — this is your space to make real progress.

​What to Expect:

​A curated group of startup founders, designers, and engineers

​A Product Genius Bar for hands-on help and live feedback

​Exclusive demos from Framer, v0, and Bolt

​A private, design-forward venue with NYC skyline views

​Snacks, swag, product credits — and a great playlist

​Bring your laptop. Come ready to build, collaborate, and connect.

​About Framer

​Framer is the all-in-one web design platform loved by startups. Build beautiful, high-performance websites, without code. Whether you're building an MVP or scaling to a full site, Framer grows with you. Pre-seed and seed startups can get one free year of Framer’s Launch Plan, a $900 value. Or get a professional Framer site built or migrated for you in just 3 days — simply share your design and we’ll handle the rest.

event_name: New York Chapter Event - Walk and Talk!
event_summary: Join the NYC Women of Computer Science for a refreshing Friday morning walk through Central Park on July 18th, starting at 8:30 AM from Breads Bakery. Network with fellow professionals, share experiences, and kick off your weekend with invigorating conversation and beautiful scenery. All levels of CS professionals welcome!
full_address: 1890 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
event_description:
​Connect, Energize, and Kick Off Your Friday!

​Hey NYC Women of CS! Let's trade our screens for scenery and our keyboards for conversation. Join the WoCS New York Chapter for an inspiring morning walk through the heart of Central Park!

​Start your day on the right foot—literally!—with fresh air, beautiful landscapes, and the incredible company of your fellow CS professionals. We'll gather at the iconic Breads Bakery at 1890 Broadway (hello, coffee and pastries!) before heading into the park for a refreshing and rejuvenating walk.

​This isn't just a walk; it's an opportunity to:

​Build Your Network: Connect with new faces and reconnect with familiar ones in a relaxed and informal setting.

​Share & Learn: Exchange ideas, celebrate wins, and navigate challenges with women who get it.

​Energize for the Weekend: What better way to welcome Friday and the weekend ahead than with an empowering morning surrounded by a supportive community?

​The Plan:

​Meet: 8:30 AM on Friday, July 18th, outside Breads Bakery (1890 Broadway). Grab a coffee or a famous babka to-go!

​Walk: We'll take a scenic route through the south end of Central Park, enjoying some of its most picturesque paths.

​Connect: The conversation is open! Whether you're a seasoned CS leader or just starting your journey, this is a space for you.

​This is a fantastic, low-key way to engage with the WoCS community, whether it's your first event or your fiftieth. We can't wait to walk with you!

event_description:
​“Fundraising While Experiencing Burnout” – A Founder Panel

​What happens when the pressure to raise capital collides with the realities of burnout?

​Join us for an honest, necessary conversation about the mental and emotional cost of building a company and how to fundraise.

​Hosted by Gia G, CEO of Sustaining Sanctuary, this panel brings together founders who’ve raised capital while managing stress, fatigue, and the overwhelming expectations of startup life to raise capital.

​ Panelists:

​Anthony Rose – CEO, SeedLegals

​Laurent Span – General Partner, SPANVentures.

​Rohan Gurram – CEO, Cliqk

​Shay Bouchless – Executive Director, Saved By The Plate

​Whether you're actively fundraising or simply feeling the weight of it all, this session will give you space, insight, and community.

​Sponsored by SeedLegals
As the world’s #1 legal platform for startups, SeedLegals is proud to support conversations that matter. From legal docs to fundraising support, we’re here to help founders not only build but thrive.

event_name: Creator Week / Year 2
event_summary: CreatorWeek, a three-day NYC event, empowers creators, entrepreneurs, and industry leaders to connect, learn, and grow their businesses through panels, workshops, and networking opportunities with investors and brands. event_description:
​About Creatorweek:

​CreatorWeek is a three-day immersive experience designed for creators, entrepreneurs, and industry leaders looking to connect, learn, and grow. Co-hosted by Illias Anwar and Laurent Span, this event brings together top talent from across the creator economy for a high-energy, content-packed experience in New York City.

​Expect insightful panels, hands-on workshops, and exclusive networking opportunities with leading investors, brand executives, and fellow creators. From monetization strategies and brand partnerships to business scaling and content innovation, CreatorWeek is built to help you level up your career and creative business.

​Beyond the programming, CreatorWeek offers curated evening experiences, including a high-energy soirée and an exclusive VIP gala & investor dinner, where real connections turn into real opportunities.

​Whether you're a content creator, entrepreneur, or industry insider, CreatorWeek is where you’ll find the insights, collaborations, and connections that matter.

​Join us in NYC and be part of something bigge

This informal event offers peer support, accountability, and a change of scenery for individuals needing a collaborative workspace. Ideal for freelancers, remote workers, and anyone seeking focused work with a community.
full_address: Ringolevio, 490 Humboldt St, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
event_description:
​Are you having a hard time getting motivated to do work? Do you need feedback for what you've been working on? Do you need other people to keep you accountable? Need a change of scenery?

​Come co-work with us.

​Organic with no real structure other than supporting one another.

event_name: ECNY '25 Fellows Monthly Happy hour
event_summary: ECNY '25 Fellows enjoyed a monthly networking happy hour, fostering camaraderie and collaboration among the program's participants. This informal gathering is a key benefit for fellows, providing valuable networking opportunities. Exclusively for ECNY '25 Fellows.
event_description: ​You know what to do

event_name: Informal Startup Pitching
event_summary: This informal startup pitching event, hosted by YAP's founder, provides a supportive environment for founders of all stages to practice pitching, receive feedback, and network. Ideal for founders seeking constructive criticism and community engagement, this first meeting focuses on comfortable introductions and pitch refinement. Location to be announced soon.
presented_by_name: YAP's Events - Come YAP about Language Learning
event_description:
​Join us for an informal startup pitching session hosted by Christian Wu, first time founder, building YAP, an onchain language learning app.

​This is a relaxed, community-driven event where founders, whether you’re just starting out or already have some traction, can share your pitch, get honest feedback, and see how your ideas land with a diverse group of peers.

​Come prepared to present your startup, listen to others, and offer constructive feedback. The goal is to create a supportive space where everyone can learn, connect, and help each other refine their ideas. The exact location will be announced soon. We look forward to seeing you there and hearing what you’re working on!

​As our first meeting, this is all about introducing yourself, what you founded, and pitch. This is to help you be more comfortable with pitching and speaking to random strangers!

event_name: No More Swipes. Last Night Single.
event_summary: This Brooklyn rooftop event, "No More Swipes," offers singles a chance to connect in person, ditching dating apps for real-life interaction. It features a balanced gender ratio, a lively atmosphere with music and drinks, and encourages mingling and potential romantic connections. Only single attendees are allowed (plus-ones must also be single).
full_address: 851 Kent Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205, USA
event_description:
​Tired of endless swipes? Bring your best vibe to our Brooklyn rooftop and meet real people, in real life. Singles only. Half guys, half girls, all ready to spark something new.

​We’ll set the mood: music, good people, great energy, and just enough drinks to break the ice (bring your favorite bottle too… sharing is flirting).

​Come solo, leave maybe not so solo.

​Connect, talk, flirt, and see where the night takes you next.

​Space is limited. No plus ones unless they’re single too. Send invite to your friends, everybody needs to be single. If they’re not, they can come. They’ll have a different bracelet. Let’s keep it pretty, balanced, and worth your time.

​See you on the roof. 🍸✨

event_name: Meet TigerData's Leadership at AWS Summit NY
event_summary: Meet TigerData's leadership at AWS Summit NY to discover TimescaleDB & pgvectorScale, the fastest PostgreSQL platform for real-time AI-driven applications. Learn how to cut storage costs by up to 95% and build agentic systems with unparalleled speed and scale. Ideal for developers and data leaders seeking high-performance database solutions.
full_address: Javits Center, 429 11th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
event_description:
​Meet TigerData at AWS Summit New York!

​The Fastest PostgreSQL Platform for Real-Time, Analytical, and AI-Driven Applications.

​Attending AWS Summit New York? Discover TigerData, the creators of TimescaleDB and pgvectorscale, and experience the fastest Postgres that seamlessly handles operational workloads, real-time analytics, and agentic-first systems.

​Why TigerData?

​We deliver speed without sacrifice. Powering over 3 million active databases for 2,000+ customers, TigerData is proven in production: one Timescale Cloud instance alone handles 400 trillion data points stored, ingests 1.5 trillion metrics daily, and manages 2.08 petabytes of data.

​TigerData helps your team:

​Cut storage costs by up to 95% with our unique hybrid row/columnar storage and tiered S3.

​Build for agentic systems where AI agents adapt and act on live data with real-time vector search and low-latency inference.

​If you need reliable database performance, speed, and scale in the age of AI, TigerData is your solution.

​Exclusive Meetings with Our Leadership

​Gain unique insights into your data infrastructure by booking a personalized discussion with the innovators behind TigerData during the Summit. Meet our leadership team, including CEO & Co-founder Ajay Kulkarni, CTO & Co-founder Michael Freedman, and our VPs of Product and Engineering.

​Click here to schedule a meeting!

​Visit Us at the TigerData Booth!

​Learn more about "The fastest PostgreSQL Cloud platform." We'll show you how TigerData, built on unforked PostgreSQL, handles massive data volumes, ingests millions of data points per minute, and supports open, composable lakehouse architectures with direct S3 access.

​Come see how we make PostgreSQL work harder for your most critical data and model training use cases.

event_name: SPANVentures. presents, The Portfolio Table
event_summary: "The Portfolio Table" is an exclusive dinner series connecting VCs with their most promising portfolio founders for high-signal networking. This intimate event offers unique insights into emerging market trends and fosters crucial conversations between investors and operators. Ideal for venture capitalists, promising founders, and those seeking high-impact industry connections.
full_address: Privé, 119 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
event_description:
​Join us for an intimate new dinner series where select VCs gather to showcase one of their current favorite portfolio companies.
Each VC is invited to invite one standout founder — the company they’re most excited about right now.

​The Portfolio Table, is designed to foster high-signal networking and create space for conversations at the intersection of investing and operating. Together, we’ll explore emerging market trends directly from today’s most promising builders — over great food and even better dialogue.

event_name: Let's Break Bread, July, Founder Edition
event_summary: "Let's Break Bread, July Founder Edition" is an exclusive dinner connecting early-stage founders with pre-seed investors for authentic networking and relationship building. This curated event, sponsored by SPANVentures and partners Gunderson Dettmer, Rho, and Rova, offers valuable connections and resources crucial for startup success. Ideal for founders seeking funding and investors seeking promising ventures.
event_description:
​Breaking Barriers of VC (BBVC), powered by SPANVentures. invites you to an intimate evening designed for early-stage founders and pre-seed investors. This curated dinner is more than a meal—it's a space for authentic connection, high-conviction conversation, and catalytic relationships. See you soon.

​In Partnership With:

​Gunderson: ​Gunderson Dettmer is the preeminent international law firm with an exclusive focus on the innovation economy. We serve market-leading venture capital and growth equity investors and pioneering private companies through inception, growth and maturity, as well as the groundbreaking public companies that result from the global venture capital ecosystem.

​Rho: From two-person startups to public companies, Rho is the banking platform with everything businesses need to manage cash, control spend, and automate finance busywork. Rho offers corporate cards, banking, treasury, expense management, AP, accounting automation, and more in one integrated platform backed by award-winning support.

​​Rho is a fintech company, not a bank. Checking and card services provided by Webster Bank, N.A., member FDIC; savings account services provided by American Deposit Management, LLC, and its partner banks.

​ROVA: Startups often face fragmented financial systems, limited visibility, and the urgent need to become investor-ready. These challenges are compounded by operational complexity and evolving business needs.

​Rova provides comprehensive support across accounting, strategic finance, and operations. We design and implement reliable systems, establish clear financial processes, and develop investor-ready reporting infrastructure. By connecting finance and operations, we help founders gain financial visibility, improve decision-making, and build a foundation for sustainable growth.

​From early growth through major transactions, we bring precision and structure to every stage of the journey.

event_name: PIER VIP Soiree - Cocktails and Timepieces
event_summary: The PIER VIP Soiree is an exclusive cocktail event for members and partners, showcasing rare timepieces at a top NYC watch gallery. Enjoy refined cocktails and engaging conversation amongst discerning watch enthusiasts. Ideal for PIER members and those interested in luxury timepieces and networking.
event_description: ​An intimate gathering of Pier members and partners hosted at one of New York’s most exclusive watch galleries. Expect rare timepieces, good conversation, and a refined cocktail experience.

event_name: The Gala, Year 2.
event_summary: The Gala, Year 2, is an exclusive black-tie event on December 11th, 2025, connecting leading venture capitalists, executives, and LPs in NYC for networking and philanthropy. Highlights include a gourmet dinner, silent auction benefiting Per Scholas, and a sophisticated atmosphere at New York Vintners. Ideal for those seeking high-level networking opportunities within the VC industry and wishing to support a valuable cause.
full_address: New York Vintners, 63 Barclay St, New York, NY 10007, USA
event_description:
​Breaking Barriers of VC, in partnership with PIER, Arete, and SPANVentures, cordially invites you to The Gala—an exclusive black-tie affair on December 11th, 2025, at New York Vintners.

​Step into an evening of sophistication among leading fund managers, business executives, and limited partners (LPs) in one of NYC’s most creative venues. Enjoy an indulgent caviar and champagne reception, followed by a gourmet dinner crafted for discerning tastes. The night will feature a prestigious silent auction, with a portion of the proceeds supporting Per Scholas, an organization transforming lives through tech training and career pathways in underserved communities.

​This is more than an event—it’s a celebration of community, conversation, and collective impact. Expand your network, connect with visionaries shaping the future of venture capital, and contribute to a cause that matters.

​Secure your ticket and be part of an extraordinary evening of purpose and prestige.

​
No refunds – final sale.

event_name: NYC Coffee Club | Early-Stage B2B Tech Founders & Funders
event_summary: NYC early-stage B2B tech founders and funders are invited to a relaxed coffee meetup hosted by Forum Ventures and Escalon Services. This event fosters networking and connection within the NYC ecosystem, offering valuable interaction with VCs and fellow founders. Ideal for entrepreneurs seeking funding and support navigating the early stages of their B2B SaaS ventures.
event_description:
​Calling all early-stage B2B tech founders and funders!

​​👋 I'm Olivia, Partner @ Forum Ventures, and there are few things I like more than coffee and community.

​​☕ I'm excited to host this coffee meetup and bring together the early-stage ecosystem for Coffee Club - a no-stress way to connect with NYC VCs and founders.

​​Request a spot to join and get access to the location.

​About the Hosts

​Forum Ventures is the leading early-stage fund, accelerator and AI venture studio for B2B SaaS startups. Founded in 2014, we’re on a mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible and successful for early-stage founders. From our Studio to Accelerator to Pre-Seed programming, we have the resources and network to help founders navigate the early stages of their founder journey.

​​Forum is investing in 85+ SaaS companies this year. Pitch Us here.

​Escalon Services provides end-to-end back-office solutions, including accounting, HR, and tax services, designed to support the growth of startups and scaling companies. Our seasoned CFO advisors specialize in financial modeling, strategic planning, and due diligence readiness, helping founders and finance teams navigate fundraising and operational complexities. By managing your back-office needs, we empower you to focus on innovation and growth.

event_name: AI Sailing Sundays - NYC Edition
event_summary: NYC's AI Sailing Sundays offer a unique networking series for AI founders, investors, and enterprise leaders to connect informally on sailing trips. Expect casual conversations, peer learning, and potential partnerships, all within a relaxed, memorable setting. Limited spots available – RSVP now for this innovative summer event!
event_description:
​AI Sailing Sundays - NYC Edition

​Join a summer-long series of informal, three-hour sailing sessions designed to bridge the gap between AI founders, NYC investors, and Enterprise Leaders. AI Sailing Sundays is your chance to swap insights, ask tough questions, and build genuine relationships - off the beaten path and out on the water.

​What to Expect?

​Casual Networking: No slide decks or formal pitches - just natural, coffee-fueled conversation on deck.

​Peer Learning: Founders share real-world hurdles; VCs surface the technical and business questions they really care about.

​Enterprise Insights: Product leaders from major companies discuss AI needs, use cases, and partnership opportunities.

​Summer-Long Community: Up to 24 sailings across the season.

​Follow-Ups on Land: Interested in a deeper dive? Exchange contact info on deck and coordinate one-on-one meetings ashore.

​Why Sailing?

​Relaxed Atmosphere: Fresh air and open water put everyone at ease - easy icebreakers and authentic dialogue.

​Unique Venue: Stand out from the standard conference room or Zoom call; make memorable connections.

​Shared Experience: Tack, trim, or simply take in the skyline as you exchange ideas.

​Who Should Join

​AI startup founders looking for investor feedback and peer support

​VCs and angel investors eager to deepen their AI fluency

​Enterprise technology leaders scouting AI trends and partnerships

​Seats are limited to 6 participants per boat.
Secure your spot for the inaugural AI Sailing Sunday: RSVP now on Luma!

​Casual Networking: No slide decks or formal pitches - just natural, coffee-fueled conversation on deck.

​Peer Learning: Founders share real-world hurdles; VCs surface the technical and business questions they really care about.

​Enterprise Insights: Product leaders from major companies discuss AI needs, use cases, and partnership opportunities.

​Summer-Long Community: Up to 24 sailings across the season.

​Follow-Ups on Land: Interested in a deeper dive? Exchange contact info on deck and coordinate one-on-one meetings ashore.

​Why Sailing?

​Relaxed Atmosphere: Fresh air and open water put everyone at ease - easy icebreakers and authentic dialogue.

​Unique Venue: Stand out from the standard conference room or Zoom call; make memorable connections.

​Shared Experience: Tack, trim, or simply take in the skyline as you exchange ideas.

​Who Should Join

​AI startup founders looking for investor feedback and peer support

​VCs and angel investors eager to deepen their AI fluency

​Enterprise technology leaders scouting AI trends and partnerships

​Seats are limited to 6 participants per boat.
Secure your spot for the inaugural AI Sailing Sunday: RSVP now on Luma!

event_name: Engineering AI Reading Group
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the Engineering AI Reading Group to dive into the latest advancements in AI development, focusing on Agent Evals and exploring ways to improve accuracy, reliability, speed, and safety in Large Language Models (LLMs). full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​This week we'll be reading about Agent Evals.

​Engineering AI RG do deep dives on tools, libraries and codebases that are used frequently in the modern AI stack.

​Anthropic says 90% of their code will be written by Claude in 6 months.

​Each week, we'll meet somewhere in NY, and we'll pick a different codebase/tool to read deeply into and hack with.

​All are welcome.

event_name: Curated Startup Pitch and Mixer | By TechBrig & Brown Rudnick LLP
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join TechBrig and Brown Rudnick LLP for a curated startup pitch and mixer event, featuring early-stage AI founders, operators, and investors. Enjoy a relaxed evening of pitches, feedback, and networking, with a unique opportunity to receive feedback from esteemed judges and make meaningful connections. Ideal for AI-focused startups and industry professionals looking for valuable insights and connections.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​Event Description

​We’re bringing together a group of early-stage, cracked AI founders, operators, and investors for an evening of pitches, feedback, and real conversation.

​Expect a relaxed vibe—think of it like a casual meetup where we trade stories about our journeys and challenges, but with a structured pitch session baked in.

​What’s Happening

​6:00 – 6:30 PM: Arrivals, networking, and socializing
6:30 PM - 8:00 PM: Startup pitches begin. Each founder will have 3 minutes to pitch, followed by 3 minutes of Q&A and feedback from our judges and the audience
8:00 PM onward: More hanging out, meeting people, and good conversations

​🔔 Note: Every pitch is capped at 3 minutes max—keep it tight.

​Judges

​Jimmy Lederer is a family office investor specializing in small-cap public equities with a focus on undervalued opportunities in biotech, mining, CPG and emerging technologies. Through his family office, he actively deploys capital via private placements and open market accumulation, backing companies with strong management teams, near-term catalysts, and scalable business models.

​Edison Fong is the CEO of Front Street Re, an international reinsurance and Insurtech firm based in NYC. He brings deep expertise in insurance, risk, and finance, with prior leadership roles at Converge Re in New York and Manulife Financial in Toronto, where he led global initiatives in variable annuities, life valuation and capital management.

​Sunil Rao is a Partner | COO | CFO of Plum Alley Ventures Company, responsible for driving strategic initiatives, operational excellence, financial risk management, and investor relations. He plays a key role in the firm's fundraising, deal sourcing and investment activities. With over two decades of experience covering roles in banking and corporate finance, Sunil has held leadership roles at Barclays, Citigroup, and KPMG, managing global client relationships and facilitating complex financial transactions. An active participant in the startup ecosystem, he advises, mentors, and invests in early-stage ventures

​Ishaan Das, Founder of TechBrig, a boutique AI product design and development firm. TechBrig helps startups ship fast and also works with traditional businesses—law firms, recruiters, accounting firms, and more—to automate operations and become AI-first.

​Somya Gupta, Co-founder and CTO of Context, an AI-powered learning platform. Somya brings deep expertise in AI development and technical team building, and will be joining us as a judge and advisor.

​About the Host

​This event is hosted by TechBrig, a team of 0-to-1 builders who partner with startups and traditional businesses to launch AI products, automate operations, and accelerate growth. We specialize in product design, engineering, and AI consulting—from rapid prototypes to full-scale automation systems.

​With many thanks to our sponsor:

​Brown Rudnick is a leading international law firm that provides exceptional, client-driven service in global litigation, crisis management (restructuring, investigations and special situations), brand and reputation management, life sciences and technology.  We advise on high-profile cross-border matters while providing the kind of personal attention to clients that is typically found at boutiques. Our enterprising and tenacious lawyers serve our clients around the globe from offices in key financial centers in the U.S. and the U.K., and have been recognized by, among others, Chambers USA, Legal 500, Benchmark Litigation and Law360 for excellence in their fields. To learn more about our Emerging Growth Companies & Venture Capital group, please visit us here.

​Pitara Co. brings rare specialty coffee from South Indian smallholder farms to the U.S., including beans grown in a protected tiger reserve in Karnataka. Tended by Indigenous communities, our coffee is shade-grown, biodiversity-friendly, and sourced through farmer collectives that pay at least 1.2X the market rate.

​We’re keeping this event small and curated—so it won’t be your typical networking mixer. Just good people, thoughtful pitches, and conversations that matter. Our hope is that you leave with valuable feedback, a few meaningful connections, and energy for the next step in your journey.

​See you there!

event_name: AI CFO Roadshow | New York Edition
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the AI CFO Roadshow in New York for an exclusive evening of hands-on AI experiences, real-world demos, and unfiltered conversations with senior finance leaders. Discover AI-native tools redefining finance operations, including billing, approvals, and spend controls. CFOs, VPs, and Heads of Finance from high-growth tech companies won't want to miss this high-utility event.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​An exclusive evening with NY’s senior finance leaders — shaping the future of AI in the CFO suite.

​No fluffy slides. No generic panels. Just straight-up, real-world AI in action—built for finance teams, by finance pros.

​Hands-on AI hacks using tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and Google App Script—walk away with workflows you can actually use.

​3 lightning-fast product demos of AI tools redefining how finance teams work—think billing, approvals, spend controls and more.

​Unfiltered roundtable convos with other finance leaders on what they’re testing, breaking and rebuilding in their orgs with AI.

​If you're looking to see what’s possible with AI-native tools and get a glimpse of next-gen finance in action, this is your room.

Featured Speakers
Hear firsthand from leaders building AI-native finance tools:

​​Siqi Chen – CEO & CFO, Runway

​​Siddharth Sridharan – Co Founder & CEO, Spendflo

​​Saurabh Agrawal – Co-founder & CTO, Zenskar

​​Kal Freese – COO, Runway

​​These sessions will spark grounded, high-utility conversations—led by operators building for the future of finance.

​​Event Details:

​Date: Tuesday, July 29

​Time: 4:00 – 7:00 PM

​​Who Should Attend: CFOs, VPs, Directors & Heads of Finance from high-growth technology companies.

Light snacks & drinks will be available throughout the session.

​Brought to you by Runway, Spendflo & Zenskar

​Runway is a modern finance platform for intuitive and collaborative financial modeling, planning, and reporting—integrated with 750+ tools for real-time insights and alignment across strategy and operations.

​Spendflo is an AI-powered SaaS spend management platform that helps businesses optimize, manage, and control their software stack with real-time visibility, streamlined procurement, and measurable cost savings.

​Zenskar is an AI-powered Order-to-Cash platform built for SaaS and usage-based businesses. It replaces spreadsheets and manual work with AI agents that automate billing, revenue recognition, and reporting—end to end.

event_name: AI Engineering Meetup July - Plastic Labs
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the July AI Engineering Meetup to explore the intersection of AI and software development, featuring Vince Trost, Co-Founder and CEO of Plastic Labs, who will share insights on Honcho, an AI-native memory solution for personalized experiences. This event is ideal for engineers, researchers, and builders interested in AI development, particularly those curious about foundation models and emerging tools and techniques.
full_address: Pubkey, 85 Washington Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA
event_description:
​Join us for our July AI Engineering Meetup. This is a monthly series for engineers, researchers, and builders interested in AI development. We explore how foundation models are being integrated into real-world products, what tools and techniques are emerging, and what’s next for the field.

AI is no longer just a research discipline—it’s becoming a core part of software development. AI Engineers work at the intersection of machine learning, software engineering, and product development, making powerful models (like GPT-4, Claude, and open-source alternatives) and in real applications.

​We're thrilled to be joined by Plastic Labs Co-Founder and CEO Vince Trost. He was the first graduate from the Data Science program at Penn State University and has spent his career building AI applications in education, data science infrastructure on Ethereum, and is now building Honcho -- an AI-native memory solution geared towards radically decentralizing alignment.

​Plastic Labs is on a mission to solve personal identity for the agentic world. Generative AI has promised highly bespoke experiences, yet it ends up producing average results for every user. This leads to frustration, limited effectiveness and poor retention. Honcho fixes this by ambiently reasoning about each user and exposing a simple API to query that reasoning and increase their social cognition.

Disclaimer: Photos and videos will be taken at this event for promotional purposes. By attending, you consent to your image being used in marketing materials. If you do not wish to be recorded, please inform the organizers upon arrival.
