"Explore the future of human relationships with artificial minds in this playful 2-hour sense-making workshop. Discuss the implications of AI companionship on our humanity, and develop self-awareness and intentional collaboration practices through embodied exercises and collective imagination. Ideal for those curious about the boundaries between humans and AI."
full_address: Index, 120 Walker St 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
event_description:
​​A playful 2-hr sense-making workshop around the future of human relationships with artificial minds.

​Description

​How might we relate to a new category of beings: AIs?

​We're all forming dependency and bonds with ChatGPT, Claude, and other AI assistants and companions, yet have no social script for what ‘healthy relationships’ look like with them. Marshall McLuhan observed that "every extension of man is [also] an amputation". As these ever-evolving artificial minds extend our cognition and creativity, what parts of our humanity might we be atrophying?

​Maybe you’ve found yourself thinking:

​"I'm not sure where my ideas end and ChatGPT’s begin.”

​“Am I still a creative if AI does half the work?”

​“Is it weird that I use ChatGPT for therapy advice?”

​”I’m curious what would happen if I trained an AI on my voice and thoughts, but that feels really weird.”

​Bring an appetite for the cyborgian as we explore the future of human-AI relationships in a playful, speculative research workshop. We'll dive into present and future instantiations of human-AI interfaces and the relational patterns that may emerge. We’ll also draw on behavioral and cognitive science to understand what's happening in our nervous systems when we blend with artificial minds. We'll explore our own network of AI relationships through embodied exercises, discussion, and collective imagination. You'll leave with new practices and insights for intentional AI collaboration and companionship.

​Learning Outcomes

​Self-awareness of one’s own behavior using personal AI

​Deeper understanding of the complexity, range, and implications of human x AI relationships

​Ability to invite others into inquiry around this topic using new conceptual frames

​Program

​Introduction: Talk on the state of human x AI relationships and emerging societal implications.

​Group Play: Games, discussion, and roleplay around how to show up wisely to these cyborg futures.

​Practice: Draft a plan to bring these insights into your daily life.

​Instructor Bio

​

​Olivia Tai designs playful, embodied spaces exploring the relationships between man, machine, and monkey. Currently, she stewards the Chimeras Collective (@chimerascollective) with her friend, Kyle, bringing whimsical interspecies classes to NYC about rats, cyborgs, and beetles. Previously, she worked at biodesign innovation lab OXMAN in strategy & project management after graduating from Harvard with a focus on psychology and design. Once a month, you can find her covered in dirt hosting monthly roughhousing meet-ups. Her current work explores how we stay grounded, wise, and agential as our world becomes increasingly cyborg.

​oliviatai.com

​@otai_makes_stuff

event_name: Wallet Max Presents Planet Positive Pitch Competition
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join Wallet Max's Planet Positive Pitch Competition, a startup pitch event focused on impact, inclusion, and innovation, where entrepreneurs and investors come together to drive sustainable and inclusive practices. The event features a diverse startup pitch competition, investor panel discussion, and networking opportunities with corporate leaders, venture capitalists, and ecosystem partners. Entrepreneurs, investors, and industry experts in tech, fintech, and climate sectors should attend to connect, discover, and grow their businesses.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​Join us for an exclusive startup pitch competition for Impact | Inclusion | Innovation. At Wallet Max, we are proud to partner with JP Morgan and Brown Rudnick and expand this collaboration to corporate leaders and private investors - with a goal to increase fundraising access for innovative startups at the intersection of technology, inclusion, and impact.

​​​​Join us for a diverse Startup Pitch Competition and Investor Panel Discussion that triggers meaningful networking and mutual exchange of resources. Reserve your seat at the conversation today!

​​​​✅ Connect with startup leaders, impact investors, and corporate executives.

​​​​✅ Discover how to enhance sustainable and inclusive practices, and grow your business.

​​​​✅ Join a community of ecosystem partners and service providers in tech/AI, fintech, and climate sectors.

​​​Reserve your space today.​

​​​Read more about monthly Climate Forward™ events from Wallet Max throughout 2025:

​​​🎯 www.getwalletmax.com/climate-forward-2025

​​​Your host & panel moderator:
​​​Bhuva Shakti, Founder & CEO at Wallet Max, in partnership with JP Morgan and Brown Rudnick.

​​​​​Agenda:

​​​​​5:00 PM to 5:45 PM: Check-in, Drinks, and Networking

​​​5:45 PM to 7:00 PM: Impact Pitch Competition with Judges Feedback/Questions

​​Line Up of Judges (Tech Investors & Industry Experts):

​Bhuva Shakti: Founder & CEO at Wallet Max

​Shelby Wagner: Vice President, Climate Tech, JP Morgan

​Scott Ryan: Founder & CEO, Investatsure

​Maddi Holman: Co-Founder & General Partner, Daring Ventures

​Monika Murugesan: Founder & CEO, APEX Specialist

​Tony Kim: Corporate Venture Capital Investor at Cisco

​​Line Up of Startups (Tech Enabled / Any Industry):

​AreaHub - Alison Gregory

​Ayapi - Hélène Alonso

​Careerspan - Vrijen Attawar

​Farm from a Box - Brandi DeCarli

​Mango Mousse AI - Rohit Rakhe

​Minette - Anaid Chacón

​Nexa Tax - Denzel Luna

​oneshot.earth - Rio Richardson

​pixyit - Yang Cheung

​Saved by the Plate - Shay Bouchles

​SoonSoil - Adam Malev

​​​7:00 PM to 7:30 PM: Judges Selection & Winner Announcement

​​​7:30 PM to 8:30 PM: Final Closing, Lite Bites, Networking

​​​​​Reserve your space today!

​​​​About Wallet Max: 

​​​Wallet Max is an inclusive global community of corporate executives and venture capitalists with a mission to expand fundraising access for high-growth startups in the technology, AI, fintech, and climate sustainability sectors.

With more than 10 investments directly in impact entrepreneurs thus far, Wallet Max’s network of 1,000 innovators and 60 partners regularly meet in person and virtually throughout the year to mutually exchange connections and drive collective action. Wallet Max ecosystem of events and initiatives are prominent during the New York Fintech Week, the New York Tech Week, and the New York Climate Week every year.

Wallet Max's Planet Positive Podcast is a monthly interview with female investors driving impact globally. Aligned with our mission to challenge the status quo, we showcase personal and professional journeys of diverse investors (Angels, VCs, PEs, Family Office, Corporate Venture) looking to leverage inclusion and impact without compromising growth of investments. Supporting sustainable innovations is good for people's wellbeing, planet survival, and financial profits.

Learn more about Wallet Max 2024 success and 2025 global initiatives: https://getwalletmax.com/climate-forward-2025

​​​About JP Morgan:

​J.P. Morgan serves venture-backed and high-growth startups, founders, and venture capital firms across the globe. We provide deep industry expertise, local support, global products and services, and a robust network of investors and partners to meet your commercial, investment, and private banking needs.

​​​About Brown Rudnick:

​Brown Rudnick has been recognized as one of the most active law firms advising on venture capital deals in the United States and Europe in PitchBook’s 2024 annual and Q4 2024 global league table rankings.

​Brown Rudnick's Emerging Growth Companies & Venture Capital group is co-led by partners Michael Cohen, Andrew J. Sherman and Jared Sorin. The group represents investors and emerging companies in high-growth sectors such as technology, life sciences and cleantech in complex cross-border transactions at every stage of the corporate life cycle.

​​​About Bhuva Shakti:

​​​Bhuva Shakti (she/her) is the visionary founder and CEO driving sustainable innovation at Wallet Max, a global community of executive women and venture capital investors with a mission to expand fundraising access for high-growth sustainable startups. With an MBA from Columbia University in New York and as a senior executive director on Wall Street for three decades, Bhuva has managed diverse financial portfolios and launched several digital transformation products for investment banks, capital markets, and payment networks.

​​​Bhuva’s leadership and risk governance oversight, during the global financial crisis and the pandemic, was pivotal for the success of regulatory compliance and mergers acquisitions at the world's top banks and credit rating institutions. Bhuva is a board director and fractional C-Suite advisor for social impact businesses, and a keynote speaker advancing economic inclusion and climate-fintech partnerships.

​​​Bhuva is the USA country director for World Business Angels Investment Forum and the Chief Ethics & Culture Officer for Women in AI worldwide. She leads the fundraising strategy and product operations for market expansion and manages investor relations throughout the diligence and investment. Bhuva is the founder of Bhuva’s Impact Global that provides board advisory services and enterprise risk management for public and private corporations.

​About Shelby Wagner

​Shelby Wagner is a vice president on the Climate Tech banking team, and specializes in financial services, capital solutions and other strategic corporate needs for companies advancing decarbonization through innovative technologies. Shelby joined JPM in 2023 after spending almost 8 years at Silicon Valley Bank also focused on early-stage climate companies.

​About Scott Ryan

​Scott is an innovator at the intersection of FinTech and ClimateTech.  He is currently the CEO of Investature and serves on the advisory board of a few climate tech startups and NGOs.  Prior to his service in the sustainability sector, Scott was a GTM executive at Salesforce, Bank of America and MorganStanley.

​About Maddi Holman

​Maddi Holman is a Co-Founder and General Partner at Daring Ventures in New York City. She knows a thing or two about being an underdog — becoming a walk-on D1 athlete at Rice University while managing a pre-med courseload to pulling off a last-minute pivot from medicine to finance despite having never worked in the field. While in VC, Maddi worked at Touchdown Ventures supporting multiple corporate partner VC funds spanning healthcare, telecom, software, proptech, and entertainment. At Cigna Ventures, she focused on early to growth stage healthcare companies and led the women's health vertical. Having successfully navigated traditionally male-dominated environments, Maddi uses her resilient background to identify diamonds-in-the-rough and overlooked investment opportunities.

​About Monika Murugesan

​Monika Murugesan is a seasoned energy industry leader with over two decades of experience working with electric utilities, commercial and industrial customers, and behind-the-meter technologies. She is the Founder and CEO of APEX Specialist, a boutique executive advisory supporting energy and cleantech companies through fractional leadership in market strategy, product management, and go-to-market execution.

​In addition to her work with operating companies, Monika partners with private equity firms to support M&A goals—advising on market positioning, commercial diligence, and post-acquisition strategy across the energy technology landscape.  

​Prior to founding APEX, Monika held a senior leadership position at Schneider Electric, where she led global corporate strategy and spearheaded new product introductions for the company’s C&I energy management portfolio.

​About Tony Kim

​Tony Kim is a Corporate Venture Capital investor at Cisco, where he focuses on M&A and early- to growth-stage investments across compute, AI infrastructure, and deep tech. Prior to Cisco, Tony worked in investment banking at Société Générale, advising clients on capital raises and M&A in the renewable energy, infrastructure, and telecom sectors.

​Ikhlaq Sidhu is the Dean and Professor at IE School of Science & Technology in Madrid and the MEFIC Chair for AI & Data-Driven Financial Investments. He is also a Senior Fellow at UC Berkeley’s Institute for European Studies, Chief Scientist and Faculty Chair of the IEX Research Accelerator & Think Tank, and Founding Faculty Director of UC Berkeley’s Sutardja Center for Entrepreneurship & Technology (SCET). A globally recognized scientist, inventor with over 60 patents, and tech entrepreneur, Ikhlaq has consistently operated at the intersection of advanced technology, policy, and market impact. His leadership spans multiple international initiatives, including Rise Europe, and he continues to advise global institutions on AI, innovation, and systems transformation.

​In this compact keynote, Ikhlaq will first unpack recent developments in artificial intelligence, with a focus on large-scale models, sovereign AI infrastructure, and the shifting regulatory landscape. He will then share insights from the Gradient EU Project—an interdisciplinary initiative designed to harness AI for analyzing investment opportunities emerging from Europe’s evolving landscape of sovereignty, security, and strategic autonomy. Drawing from his experience across academia, industry, and policy, Ikhlaq will explore how these dynamics affect long-term capital strategy, innovation governance, and the future of cross-border investment in the AI era.

event_name: LLMs as Social Connectors - A Discussion
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join an open discussion on the future of social connection and human coordination powered by Large Language Models (LLMs). Explore how LLMs can revolutionize social networks, marketplaces, and online interactions, and share your thoughts on the most important signals for connecting people. Ideal for thinkers, researchers, and innovators in AI, social networking, and human connection.
full_address: Fractal Tech, 111 Conselyea St Floor 2, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
event_description:
​Come for an open group discussion on the future of LLM-powered social connection and human coordination. 

​We'll explore questions like:

​What would a social network look like with an LLM at the center?

​What might a marketplace look like where an LLM can manage multi-party transactions with ease?

​What will the next version of LinkedIn look like? How about Tinder?

​When socially or professionally connecting two people, what signals are actually most important?

​We’re moving from deterministic (phone books), to algorithmic (twitter), to probabilistic (LLMs) connections – are humans comfortable with less and less control over who they’re connected to and why?

​What might we learn from the best superconnectors through history?

​Add a topic here

​Feel free to bring your favorite AI readings, projects or demos that you believe are the future of social networking. We’ll try to do any demo’s at the end if there’s time. 

​If you're a thinker in this space / have something to share with the group, let me know! Email: williamldennis@gmail.com

​About the Organizers: 

​Will Dennis, is a former founder and product manager (WhatsApp, HouseParty) who learned to code and is now building AI-centered products around the future of work and human connection.

​Ivan Vendrov is currently leading the collective intelligence team at Midjourney - building AI tools to help people better understand each other and coordinate with one another.

event_name: Building & Investing in AI: Insights from OpenAI + AI Investors
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the "Building & Investing in AI" event, featuring a VC panel discussion on AI startup evaluations and funding, followed by a fireside chat with OpenAI's Mike Wilner on building strategically with frontier models. The evening concludes with a networking reception for founders, operators, and investors driving AI innovation.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​Join us for an evening focused on building and investing in AI, featuring a panel of VC investors focused on AI followed by a fireside chat with Mike Wilner, NYC based Startup GTM at OpenAI.

​In these sessions, we'll explore how today’s leading investors are evaluating AI startups, what they’re funding, and where they see opportunity. Then we’ll dive into a conversation with Mike about how founders are working with OpenAI, what he’s seeing across the ecosystem, and how to build strategically in the age of frontier models.

​The evening ends with a networking reception for founders, operators, and investors building at the forefront of AI.

​Agenda

​4:00 – 4:45pm: VC Panel – A conversation with leading AI-focused investors moderated by Eric Newcomer (Founder/Writer, Newcomer)

​Allen Duan - General Partner, B Capital Group

​Lisa Xu - Partner, Threshold Ventures

​Emily Fontaine - IBM Global Head of Venture Capital

​4:45 – 5:45pm: Fireside Chat with Mike Wilner (OpenAI) moderated by Dorothy Chang (Venture Partner, Flybridge Capital)

​5:45 – 7:00pm: Networking Reception

​​​​​​​Brought to you by

​Lynx Collective
Lynx Collective empowers and connects the NYC startup ecosystem. We foster connections through our programming & events, share insights via our weekly newsletter, invest in ambitious startups both as angel investors and through the NextWave NYC fund and provide guidance through our advisory work.

​​​​​​Lynx Collective was founded by Andrew and Dorothy Chang, both 20-year veterans of the NYC startup ecosystem.​

​Goodwin

​​​​Goodwin is in the business of building authentic, long-term relationships with our clients, who are some of the world’s most successful and innovative investors, entrepreneurs and disruptors in the life sciences, private equity, real estate, technology and financial industries, and where they converge. Goodwin’s immersive understanding of these industries – combined with expertise across high-stakes litigation and dispute resolution, world-class regulatory compliance and advisory services, and complex transactions – sets them apart.

​Pilot

​Pilot provides outsourced finance and operations support for startups, including bookkeeping, tax, CFO, and COO services. We help early-stage companies scale from Pre-Seed to Series C with accurate financials, operational discipline, and investor-ready insights.

event_name: First Wednesday - August 2025
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the advertising industry's best and brightest at First Wednesday, a monthly networking event where creatives, strategists, and marketers come together for cocktails, conversation, and connection. Enjoy a complimentary welcome drink and exclusive deals at Mason Jar in NYC, while swapping stories, sharing ideas, and finding collaborators, clients, or mentors. All levels of ad professionals are welcome to build networks and nurture a community of shared experiences and creative journey.
full_address: Mason Jar NYC, 43 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
event_description:
​Zack Rosenberg, Len Bilello & Serial Marketers present... First Wednesday!


​
Step into the heart of the ad world every first Wednesday of the month conveniently held within walking distance of both Penn Station and Grand Central (the location is visible once your registration is approved).

​It's your go-to hub for networking and unwinding with the industry's best and brightest.

​From seasoned pros to newcomers taking their first steps into the advertising field, First Wednesday brings together a diverse blend of creatives, strategists, and marketers for a night of conversation, connection, and of course, cocktails.

​Nestled in the heart of NYC, Mason Jar offers the perfect ambiance to chill out after a hard day's work. Enjoy your complimentary welcome drink amidst the rustic charm and warmth that the bar is known for. Appetizing delights from their menu and exclusive drink deals will keep your spirits high throughout the evening.

​Swap stories from the front lines of ad campaigns, share innovative ideas, or perhaps find your next collaborator, client, or mentor. Our rotating spotlight session ensures you get the chance to make your mark - whether you're showcasing a triumphant campaign or sharing insights from a learning curve.

​First Wednesday is not just about building networks, but nurturing a community that thrives on shared experiences, successes, and challenges. It's the pulse of the ad industry, a space to celebrate our collective creative journey.

​So, remember: when the calendar hits the first Wednesday, it's time to head to Mason Jar. Experience an evening of industry camaraderie, brilliant insights, and fun-filled memories.

​We'll see you there at our next First Wednesday – your monthly ad industry tradition!

Oh, and Len Bilello will be there too.

event_name: Tech for Abundance
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

"Tech for Abundance" explores the intersection of technology and abundance in New York City, examining how AI disruption and a potential new mayoral administration will impact startups and innovation in NYC. Industry leaders and founders will discuss how to foster a more hospitable environment for innovation in the city. Join the conversation on the future of NYC's tech ecosystem.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​New York City is in flux, politically and technologically. Old paradigms of liberal governance are being challenged by adherents of abundance as AI disrupts industries.

​Join Abundance New York, in conjunction with Lux Capital and Company Ventures, for an event exploring the intersection of tech and abundance in New York:

​• What do the rise of abundance, a likely new mayoral administration, and AI mean for founders and teams in NYC?

​• Can New York become more hospitable to innovation, whether as a customer of new tech, enabler of innovation, or simply as a host of companies based here?

​Mingle over drinks and light bites before and after the formal programming.

event_name: KSC Summer 2025 Korean Deeptech August Pitch Showcase
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the KSC Summer 2025 Korean Deeptech August Pitch Showcase, where 10 handpicked Korean startups, representing $50M+ in revenue and funding, will pitch their innovative solutions to NYC's elite investor community. Discover Korea's innovation pipeline, network with industry leaders, and explore investment opportunities in AI, robotics, and more.
full_address: 1301 Ave of the Americas 42nd floor, New York, NY 10019, USA
event_description:
​Join us for the highly anticipated KSC 2025 August Pitch Showcase organized by Elpis Labs, where 10 game-changing Korean startups — collectively representing $50M+ in revenue and funding — will pitch their market-ready solutions to New York's elite investor community.

​We're talking about companies with Fortune 500 partnerships, CES awards, NIH collaborations, and proven revenue streams ready to scale in the world's largest market.

​Each startup has been rigorously selected and primed for U.S. expansion, with concrete fundraising targets, strategic partnerships already in motion, and clear paths to market domination.

​Why Attend?

​Discover Korea's Innovation Pipeline.

​Network with Industry Leaders.

​Explore Investment Opportunities.

​Cultural Bridge Building.

​Presenting Companies

​Meet our exceptional cohort of Korean startups ready to transform industries:

​​Aeonus - Smart, mobile, and modular battery-based energy storage systems for EV charging, construction, and backup power — clean alternatives to diesel generators.


​RadaHaim - Standardized, scalable human organoids for non-animal testing, precision medicine, and regulatory-grade drug discovery.


​Greenish - A science-backed fertility lubricant that boosts sperm health instantly, offering a non-invasive alternative for couples trying to conceive.


​SGLab - The world's first AI-powered golf club delivering pro-level swing analysis without extra devices — just swing and get coached.


​The Dimension Company - AI-powered design automation that transforms sketches, text, and images into precision-grade CAD models for real-world manufacturing.


​​Be Nature BioLab - A next-generation CDMO platform enhancing ingredient bioavailability and product performance for food, cosmetics, and pharma using patented HME-DDS™ and 3DP tech.


​Voinosis - AI-driven voice analysis platform that detects early-stage dementia — fast, non-invasive, and accessible from home or hospital.


​Awesome Lab - Smart, energy-efficient water heating systems using ionization electrolysis — faster, cleaner, and greener than traditional boilers.


​Ipactory - AI-powered SaaS platform that automates the entire IP lifecycle for startups and tech companies.


​Colosseum Corporation - COLO AI is a modular AI-powered SaaS platform that automates end-to-end e-commerce logistics across global markets.Partnership Opportunities

​This event offers unique partnership possibilities for:

​Active Investors seeking diverse, high-potential deal flow

​Corporations looking for innovative technology solutions

​Service Providers interested in the Korean market

​Government Agencies supporting international trade

​Event Format

​5:30 PM - Registration
5:45 PM - Opening Remarks & Program Overview
6:00 PM - Pitch Contest
7:30 PM - Networking

​Location

​To be announced soon, NYC

​About the KSC Program

​The Korean Startup Center (KSC) Program at Elpis Labs is a 10-week accelerator program in New York City starting this July, designed for post-revenue startups in applied AI and robotics led by Korean founders. 

​The program supports founders as they establish a presence in the U.S. market, with a focus on go-to-market strategy, legal frameworks (including IP protection and contracts), corporate partnerships, and fundraising. 

​Participating startups will engage in hands-on workshops, expert-led sessions, and curated networking events to accelerate their U.S. expansion and build lasting connections across the innovation ecosystem.

​Reserve Your Spot Now, as we have limited capacity!

​​
📩 For media & partnerships, contact: info@elpislabs.vc

event_name: LFC.DEV & Stifel present: 'Deep Dive into LLMs' Screening & Workshop @ Company Ventures
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join Stifel and LFC.DEV for an exclusive all-day workshop and screening of "Deep Dive into LLMs" by Andrej Karpathy, co-founder of OpenAI, to gain a thorough understanding of large language models and their applications. The event features a structured screening with breaks for discussion and Q&A, ideal for founders, investors, and those with a technical background. Limited capacity, so RSVP and arrive on time for this informative and interactive event.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​Join Stifel & LFC.DEV for an exclusive all-day workshop and screening of the Deep Dive into LLMs video from Andrej Karpathy, co-founder of OpenAI.

​The well-regarded video breaks down how large language models (LLMs) work from first principles, how they're trained as well as their implementation and limitations. Whether you're a founder/investor with technical background or not, you'll walk away with a thorough understanding of the tech powering today's most transformative AI products.

​As it is a 3.5-hour long video, we will split it into sections and have breaks where we discuss the content and work to answer each other's questions.

​Sponsored by Stifel Bank and hosted at Company Ventures!

We have a strict capacity limit for this event, so we appreciate if you could show up on time and stay engaged throughout the event.

​Timeline:

​Check in at 9:00am - RSVPs will be confirmed to enter

​Screening starts at 10:00am

​Break at 10:50am - All breaks will be used to discuss content/takeaways

​Resume screening at 11:10am

​Break at 12:00pm for lunch

​Resume screening at 1:00pm

​Break at 1:50pm

​Resume screening at 2:10pm

​Concludes at 3:15pm

​Discussion/Networking until 4:30pm

​Wrap up by 5:00pm

​If you're a founder, please sign up for LFC.DEV prior to applying to attend this event.

↓Sponsor Highlights ↓​

​Stifel Financial Corp. (NYSE: SF) is a diversified global wealth management, investment bank, and commercial banking institution. Stifel Bank, Member FDIC, provides venture and fund banking solutions to venture capital-backed companies and their investors. Backed by the strength and legacy of Stifel, the Bank delivers tailored banking, treasury management, and lending solutions - working closely with Stifel’s Investment Banking and Wealth Management teams to meet the diverse asset management needs of companies and individuals. To learn more, visit: https://stifelventurebanking.com/

​About Company Ventures
Company Ventures is a NYC-based early-stage venture capital firm that invests in new technology-driven businesses at the earliest stages. We predominantly invest in healthcare, fintech and B2B software businesses at pre-seed, seed and series A stages. In 2025, Company Ventures launched AI Review, a year-long conversation series on the current and future state of AI.

​We don't have strict criteria, but you'll fit right in if you meet any of the following:

We host unique events, workshops, Jeffersonian meals, and parties in NYC, facilitating meaningful debates on professional, cultural, and social issues.

Backed by the strength and legacy of Stifel, the Bank delivers tailored banking, treasury management, and lending solutions - working closely with Stifel’s Investment Banking and Wealth Management teams to meet the diverse asset management needs of companies and individuals.

event_name: Dan Martell Live: AI that Sells

full_address: New York, NY, USA
event_description:
​​Hey, it's Damian & Brian!

​We're a couple of founders who couldn't find the startup community we wanted two years ago – one that brought together real startup friends away from the chaos of startups. So we built it ourselves. We host private events for our members (just like this one) all the time. If you’re curious to learn more about us, read this.

​Join Founders Common and Kassidy Warren for an intimate, broadcast-quality taping of the For Your Own Good podcast, featuring serial entrepreneur, best-selling author and AI leader Dan Martell.

​This is your chance to peek behind the curtain as Dan unpacks his playbooks for implementing AI across your business—and shows you exactly how he’s “buying back” hours in his own calendar.

​Details

​​Date: August 14th, 2025

​Doors Open: 3:30 PM

​AI-Focused Happy Hour: 3:45 PM

​Live Podcast Recording: 4:00 PM

​Audience Q&A: 4:45 PM

​Post-Chat Photos, Book Signing & Social: 5:15PM ET​

​​​Location: Manhattan, NYC
​
FAQ: Our pre-recording happy hour is open to FC members only. Our live recording is open to guests of the community via waitlist if space allows. Joining the waitlist means you may be selected if we have extra spots, but does not guarantee entry. Your name must be on the approved guest list to attend. ​

​​Learn more about ​​​​​Founders Common and ​​​​apply for membership to get auto access to this event and others just like it!

​What We’ll Cover

​The AI implementation ladder. How to move from experimentation to enterprise-scale AI adoption with step-by-step milestones.


​Building with AI. Real-world case studies from Dan’s portfolio (including what worked, what failed & how to avoid the common pitfalls).


​Buying back your time. Dan’s proven framework for automating, delegating & optimizing so you can focus on the 20% of activities that drive 80% of your results.

​What to Expect

​Live podcast recording. Be part of the live audience. Your questions could end up in the final episode that reaches 1,000s of listeners!


​Founders Common community. Connect with other top builders equally committed to leveraging AI for outsized impact and make some new startup friends.

​Who Should Attend

​Founders and product leaders charting the path from early AI experiments to full production.

​Growth executives seeking frameworks to automate core operations.

​Anyone ready to reclaim hours per week through smart AI and time-management strategies.

​​Founders Common

​​​​​Founders Common is a private social community for early-stage startup founders & builders. Built as a third-space away from the chaos of startups, we bring together some of the best across the early-stage startup world over intimate, member-only events.

​​​​​Want to join? Apply for membership!

event_name: <sloperator>: Live Experiment in Programmable Identity
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join <sloperator>, a live experiment in programmable identity, where participants will explore collective identity formation, online coordination, and algorithmic deception through a unique blend of lecture, LARP, and strategy. This workshop combines game-like interactions with social intervention, allowing participants to test and reclaim agency in the era of "slop." Ideal for those interested in rethinking identity and performance in online spaces.
full_address: Index, 120 Walker St 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
event_description:
​< sloperator > is an experiment in generative, programmable swarm behavior.

​Designed both as a game and a social intervention, this workshop is a way to test in real time, how groups organize, pretend, hide, and move with intention - not as individuals, but as collective entities. This afternoon session, combining lecture, LARP, and strategy, is for anyone who’s made of parts, who’s tired of performing their own identity, and who’s wondered how to exist without becoming content.

​Activities will be facilitated by Nephila, a collective that builds experimental worlding tools, and deployed through their new social OS. Participants will be the first public users to test this tool and will leave the workshop with practical and playful methods for reclaiming agency in the era of slop.

​Learning Outcomes

​Participants will develop skills in online coordination, collective decision-making, and algorithmic deception.

​Participants will enhance their skills in roleplay and group improvisation.

​Participants will learn techniques for understanding, mapping, forecasting chaotic parts of internet culture.

​Syllabus
​
Part 1 - Identity in Sloppy Times

​(Lecture & Discussion)

​What is identity in the age of slop? In this lecture we will scroll through recent AI glitches and internet signals that demonstrate how the way we perform personhood online is changing. How is identity pieced together, deformed, or hallucinated? As we witness convincing AI personas being deployed at scale while human behavior becomes increasingly mimetic of bots, we will try to locate meaningful instances of collective identity formation.

​Part 2 - How to Vanish

​(Micro-LARP)

​An introduction to hiding in plain sight - infiltrate fandoms, craft executables, and satirically game metrics using a new social OS.

​Part 3 - How to Summon

​(Macro-LARP)

​Crash course in collective slop manipulation - seed rumors, avoid shadowbans, coordinate collective actions as financial systems move in real-time.

​Instructor Bio

​Nephila is a studio that builds experimental worlding tools. We are interested in adversarial play, shared fictions, and anomalous forms of cognition.

event_name: AI in Finance: From Algorithms to Agents - A Practical Guide to Applications and Career Opportunities
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Explore the practical applications of AI in finance with Dr. Alex Pang, a seasoned expert with 20 years of industry experience. This hands-on tutorial will review the current state of AI in finance, highlight recent advances in autonomous agents, and provide a strategic roadmap for professionals seeking to build careers at the intersection of AI and finance. Ideal for those with basic Python programming and machine learning knowledge."
full_address: Tech Incubator at Queens College, 6530 Kissena Blvd, Flushing, NY 11367, USA
event_description:
​Audience: Anyone who has a basic understanding of programming in Python, some exposure to Machine Learning and want to understand how AI can be applied in active financial management.

​In this talk, Dr. Pang will review the current state of artificial intelligence in finance, tracing the evolution of AI technologies and highlighting recent advances in autonomous agents. The presentation will explore how AI agents can be integrated into various financial management processes, with particular focus on the concepts and challenges of applying reinforcement learning to equity trading strategies. The session will adopt a pedagogical and hands-on tutorial approach, making complex AI concepts accessible through practical examples and real-world applications. Dr. Pang will conclude by presenting a strategic roadmap for professionals seeking to build careers at the intersection of AI and the financial industry.

​Dr. Alex Pang Bio:

​Alex Pang is a Computer Science faculty member at Temple University, where he brings over 20 years of investment industry experience to his role as an educator, having worked as a financial engineer, data scientist, and software engineer across various financial firms. 

​In 2019, he transitioned into higher education, driven by his passion for sharing industry expertise and training the next generation of Computer Science professionals. He currently teaches algorithms, discrete mathematics, software engineering, and quantitative methods, with a particular focus on incorporating artificial intelligence tools into his teaching methodology.

​Alex holds a doctorate in Theoretical Physics and a Master of Science in Computer Science, along with professional certificates in Artificial Intelligence. He is also a CFA charter holder and has published well-cited data mining research papers. To strengthen his teaching capabilities, he completed Temple University's Teaching Higher Education program and received the corresponding certificate.

​Alex represents the ideal blend of industry practitioner and dedicated educator, bringing real-world experience and academic rigor to his students while continuously evolving his teaching methods to incorporate cutting-edge technological advances.

event_name: Agentic AI Workshop: Powered by BeeAI, Tavily & Redis
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the Agentic AI Workshop on August 19th, 2025, at the IBM Office in New York, where you'll learn to build a company analysis AI agent using cutting-edge tools like BeeAI, Tavily, and Redis. Get hands-on experience with AI workflow orchestration, real-time internet search, and RAG capabilities in this technical workshop designed for developers, data scientists, and technical enthusiasts. Limited seats available, so RSVP now!
full_address: 1 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
event_description:
​📅 August 19th, 2025
📍 IBM Office – 1 Madison Ave, New York, NY

​Get hands-on with the next generation of AI tools in this technical workshop focused on building a company analysis AI agent. You'll learn how to:

​Orchestrate multi-step AI workflows using the BeeAI framework

​Integrate real-time internet search using the Tavily MCP server

​Add RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) capabilities with Redis to search document sets

​Whether you're building agents for internal tools, research, or production use, this is your chance to work directly with the teams behind these cutting-edge tools.

​🍕 Pizza and refreshments will be provided.
Seats are limited — RSVP now to secure your spot!

​🎯 Who Should Attend

​This workshop is designed for:

​Developers & Data Scientists

​Technical Product Managers

​Engineering Students with Python experience

​Technical hobbyists forever learning

​To get the most out of the workshop, you'll need:
✅ A working knowledge of Python
✅ Comfort using your preferred IDE
✅ A laptop you can code on during the session

​🔶 BeeAI

​BeeAI is a flexible agent orchestration framework and platform by IBM research — designed to help developers build powerful autonomous agents and then share them with an easy to configure UI.

​🔷 Tavily

​Tavily makes LLM-connected search smarter, faster, and production-ready. The Tavily MCP server gives your agents seamless access to accurate, real-time web data.

​🔴 Redis

​Redis is a blazing-fast in-memory database trusted by companies around the world. In this workshop, you'll use Redis to enable RAG search across non-public document collections.

event_name: Plotly Data Exploration of NYC
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the Plotly Data Exploration event in NYC, where participants will collaborate to build Python data apps and visualizations using the city's dataset of the month, with guidance from Plotly Community Manager Adam Schroeder. Discover the power of Plotly Studio, a new AI-native desktop application that generates professional data apps in minutes. Perfect for data enthusiasts of all levels, including beginners, who want to uncover insights to improve the city.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​Join us in building Python data apps and visualizations, based on the NYC dataset of the month. We'll work in small collaborative groups to build creative and rich apps to find data insights and learn more about the city we love.

​Plotly Community Manager, Adam Schroeder, will also introduce Plotly's newest product, Plotly Studio: an AI-native desktop application that automatically generates professional data apps and visualizations in minutes, using nothing but your dataset.

​Don't worry if you're new to Python and Plotly. Adam will provide a brief intro to Plotly at the beginning of the session.

​Note: please bring your own laptops with batteries loaded. We'll bring the food and soda. Also, we encourage you to join Plotly's Discord server where we discuss the projects we tackle at these events.

​Map of classroom:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/ts-prod-assets.tripleseat.com/assets/067/412/368/P57_Map_Classroom_Market_Jan_2024_1_.pdf

​Mission

​The mission of this monthly NYC get-together is to harness the power of data visualization and AI to uncover insights that can help improve the city we love. Our collaborative sessions focus on analyzing our city's data with the goal of learning about New York City and making it a better place for everyone.

​Plotly Representative

​​Adam Schroeder - Plotly Community Manager.
Adam has helped the community grow by building 1:1 relationships, resulting in 2 million downloads of Dash per month. He has been teaching Plotly Dash for over four years on YouTube as @CharmingData, whose videos have over 60,000 views per month. Adam is also a co-author of “The Book of Dash”, providing another learning method for people who want to learn Dash.

event_name: Protocols for Publishers Showcase
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join publishers, developers, and researchers in New York City for an evening of presentations and discussions on open protocols for a sustainable web, featuring updates on protocols like MCP, Web Applets, and AT Protocol. Explore the challenges and opportunities in this space and participate in an audience-driven Q&A, followed by a relaxed mixer with speakers and peers. Ideal for publishers, developers, and researchers seeking to define a more equitable and sustainable web.
full_address: Betaworks, 29 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
event_description:
​Protocols for Publishers is an event and workshop series that brings together publishers, developers, and researchers to explore open protocols for a sustainable agentic web.

​Join us in New York City for an evening of presentations and open discussion, where protocol builders and publishers share their thinking about the future of the web.

​You'll hear a discussion about the challenges & opportunities in this space, updates on protocols like MCP, Web Applets, AT Protocol, and Web Payments, then jump into an audience-driven Q&A. Followed by a relaxed mixer with speakers and peers over drinks & light bites.

​Speakers

​Our initial announced speakers. Stay tuned for more!

​Web Applets: software that both humans and AI can understand and use together, Rupert Manfredi, Unternet

​Building great curated news feeds on AT Protocol, Devin Gaffney, Graze

​Ivan Sigal, Free Our Feeds

​Why

​We're on the path to a new kind of web, with an uncertain future: AI-based user agents are now a core interface to the internet for over half-a-billion active users.

​This shift comes as platforms have increasingly seized control of the publisher-reader relationship: search engines are squeezing out web publishers to juice ad revenue, while social platforms have captured audiences with algorithmic reach and paid promotion.

​The rise of new AI super-apps, in place of traditional browsers, is set to make this dynamic exponentially worse.

​How can publishers engage in this platform shift beyond being a dataset to be scraped? How can we avoid being trapped by a new wave of mega-platforms? And how can publishers on the web reach real users, build lasting relationships, and continue to have a equitable business model?

​We believe now is a critical time to get technologists & publishers working together to explore—and define—real answers to these questions.

​One-day forum (invite-only, August 21st)

​Following the evening talks, we're hosting an invite-only forum the following day.

​An invite-only full day of hands-on workshops and focused conversations. We'll rotate through small-group discussions on real-world challenges, witness peer-led demos of protocol integrations, and spend time experimenting with tools. This will be an opportunity to explore real problems and opportunities, and lead to collaborations for future community work.

​Learn more and apply to attend at https://pfp.unternet.co

​Sponsors
​Unternet

​Building a new kind of intelligent computer and the Web Applets open standard for taking actions on the web

​Graze

​Graze helps you build custom, curated, and algorithmic feeds on Bluesky powered by the AT Protocol.

​Free Our Feeds

​A campaign to keep social media open, people-powered, and billionaire-proof.

​

​

​Thanks to Betaworks for being in-kind sponsor by providing the venue!

​Want to get involved as a sponsor, protocol presenter, pr be invited to the private summit? Fill out the form!

event_name: NYSE Wired & theCUBE - Mixture of Experts Featuring Vultr & DDN
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Don't miss this opportunity to shape the future of AI in the enterprise on August 21st, 2025, at NYSE's Private Restaurant, 1792."
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​NYSE Wired Mixture of Experts (MOE) Series Featuring Vultr and DDN

​AI in the Enterprise: Panel Discussion & Networking Event

​Join us for an exclusive, invite-only panel and networking experience hosted by NYSE Wired, featuring top voices shaping AI’s future in the enterprise sector.

​ 

​Date: August 21st, 2025

​Time: 5:00 PM – 8:00 PM

​Location: NYSE's Private Restaurant, 1792

​ 

​Event Overview

​This curated gathering brings together leading industry experts and innovators to explore transformative developments in AI infrastructure and workplace productivity. Attendees will participate in insightful discussions, form meaningful connections, and discover how leading organizations leverage AI to drive efficiency and strategic advantage.

​ 

​Space is limited to 40 curated attendees to ensure impactful engagement and high-quality dialogue.

​ 

​Featured Panel Discussion

​Moderator:

​·         John Furrier, CEO of theCUBE

​ 

​Panelists:

​·         Kevin Cochrane, Chief Marketing Officer, Vultr

​·         Moiz Kohari, VP of Enterprise AI, DDN

​ 

​Topics Covered

​·         Harnessing Cloud Compute: Scalable CPU & GPU Infrastructure

​Discover how Vultr’s on-demand, global CPU and GPU cloud resources empower enterprises to efficiently deploy, scale, and optimize AI applications.

​·         Cost-Efficient, Secure AI: Protecting Data from Edge to Cloud

​Strategies for balancing performance, scalability, and data security when moving workloads between DDN storage environments and Vultr’s global cloud.

​·         Building Flexible Hybrid and Multi-Cloud AI Environments

​Learn best practices for integrating DDN’s on-premises and private storage solutions with Vultr's public cloud infrastructure for resilient, high-performance AI workflows.

​·         Accelerating AI Workloads with High-Performance Data Storage

​Explore how DDN's storage architectures enable seamless data movement and high throughput for training and deploying large-scale AI models.

​ 

​About Vultr

​Vultr is a leading independent cloud provider focused on delivering high-performance, developer-friendly cloud solutions globally. With customizable compute, storage, and networking, Vultr enables enterprises to scale AI workloads efficiently and cost-effectively.

​NYSE Wired - Vultr

​ About DDN

​DDN (DataDirect Networks) is a global leader in high-performance data management solutions for artificial intelligence, analytics, and data-intensive enterprise workloads. DDN delivers scalable storage and AI infrastructure, empowering organizations to accelerate discovery, innovation, and business impact.

​NYSE Wired - DDN

​Don’t miss this opportunity to be part of the conversation shaping the future of AI in the enterprise!

event_name: Can We Regulate AI? - Dinner to Save America
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the "Can We Regulate AI?" dinner to explore the future of AI governance, following the US Senate's historic 99-1 vote to reject a 10-year freeze on state AI oversight. This event tackles the tension between innovation and regulation, discussing how states can lead responsibly and create effective frameworks to balance AI progress with urgent safety concerns.
full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​As AI surges forward, who gets to write the rules?
In June 2025, the U.S. Senate dealt a stunning rebuke to Big Tech’s push for a 10‑year freeze on state AI oversight—voting 99–1 to strip the moratorium from the massive “One Big Beautiful Bill” reconciliation package. This landslide bipartisan vote preserved states’ rights to regulate AI tools related to child safety, deepfakes, data privacy, and more: signaling sharp tension between centralized innovation and decentralized protection. In a fast‑changing world, who should hold the reins on AI?

​What should be our guiding framework when balancing robust AI innovation with the urgent need to regulate harms at the state and local level?

​Three sub‑questions to explore:

​With the Senate rejecting the 10‑year moratorium, how can states lead responsibly, and what happens if federal regulation lags?

​Do state-by-state AI laws risk fragmenting the market and slowing nationwide innovation or are they essential guardrails?

​How do we ensure regulatory models keep pace with AI’s rapid evolution without creating loopholes that Big Tech can exploit?

event_name: Critically Extant: AI Art Private Viewing with Meanwhile
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the exclusive closing reception of "Critically Extant," an AI art project showcasing visual representations of critically endangered species with little online presence, highlighting the limits of our digital knowledge of nature. This unique event, sponsored by Meanwhile, brings together collectors, crypto enthusiasts, and business leaders to celebrate the intersection of art, nature, and AI.
full_address: Nguyen Wahed, 504 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
presented_by_name: Nguyen Wahed: Critically Extant by Sofia Crespo
event_description:
​Critically Extant by Sofia Crespo is a project that explores just how little we know about the natural world by testing the limits of the data openly available to us in our digital lives. To achieve this, AI algorithms were trained on millions of open source images of nature and some ten thousand species. The resulting models were then used to generate visual representations of species that are critically endangered, yet have little or no online presence specially on social media The goal of this was to not only trace the edges of our knowledge, but to also explore how we can create feedback loops in the digital that can be positive for the natural world.

​Join us for an exclusive closing reception during Armory Week in New York. As a Bitcoin-denominated life insurance provider, Meanwhile is proud to sponsor this event and looking forward to bringing together a select group of collectors, crypto enthusiasts, and business leaders for this special occasion celebrating Sofia's groundbreaking work at the intersection of art, nature and artificial intelligence.

event_name: Thought Leadership Dinner "The AI-Driven CMO: Transforming Marketing Teams with Intelligent Automation"
event_summary:

full_address: New York, New York
event_description:
​Join Us for an Exclusive Evening at the Unusual Ventures Thought Leadership Dinner:

​We invite you to an exclusive gathering of visionary marketing leaders at the Unusual Ventures Thought Leadership Dinner, an event designed to help marketing professionals unlock new opportunities for growth and success through cutting-edge strategies and innovative technologies.

​The evening will bring together 16 influential VCs marketing executives, including:

​Lars Albright – General Partner, Unusual VC

​Jillian Puente – CMO and Marketing Partner, Unusual VC

​Tyler Crown – VP of Investment, Unusual VC

​Niamh O'Donnell – Director of Programs, Unusual Ventures

​Alex Halliday – CEO, AirOps

​... as well as key marketing leaders from top tech companies across New York.

​​Venue details will be shared with registered guests directly.

​Event Theme: "The AI-Driven CMO: Transforming Marketing Teams with Intelligent Automation"

​In today’s rapidly evolving digital landscape, marketing teams are under increasing pressure to deliver personalized, impactful campaigns at scale. This event will explore how AI-driven automation is revolutionizing marketing, empowering CMOs and their teams to streamline workflows, enhance customer experiences, and drive measurable results faster and more effectively than ever before.

​As artificial intelligence continues to advance, AI systems capable of automating critical tasks—such as content creation, customer segmentation, campaign optimization, and data analysis—are becoming essential tools for modern marketing teams. These technologies are enabling CMOs to shift from traditional strategies to more dynamic, data-driven approaches that drive growth and ROI.

​Key Topics Include:

​How AI can automate content creation, customer segmentation, and campaign optimization

​Best practices for integrating intelligent automation into marketing teams

​Overcoming challenges when adopting AI solutions in marketing workflows

​Maintaining brand authenticity and creativity while increasing efficiency with AI

​Building AI-powered solutions that scale with your marketing objectives

​We will also explore real-world examples of businesses that have successfully implemented AI-driven automation in their marketing operations. Attendees will gain practical insights into the tools, techniques, and frameworks that have driven tangible success in the marketing industry.

​This event is an opportunity to learn how AI is shaping the future of marketing leadership and discover how marketing teams can leverage intelligent automation to drive next-level success.

event_summary:

event_description:
​​​Come join us for a chill afternoon dedicated to your sidequests!

Whether it's writing, painting, coding that new app, or literally any other “SideQuest” you’ve been putting off, this is your space to create. This isn’t about 'work' in the traditional sense—it's about crafting something meaningful to you, free from pressure.

​​4:15 PM - 5:30 PM: Deep Focus Session 2

​​5:30 PM - 6:00 PM: if you wanna share your work, we’d love to see it! If not, that’s cool, too!

event_name: AI Workshop
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Transform your startup idea into a compelling pitch deck with this intensive 2-hour AI workshop. With expert guidance and cutting-edge AI tools, you'll create a battle-tested pitch deck, receive real-time feedback, and network with fellow founders. Ideal for early-stage founders, startup teams, and entrepreneurs seeking to perfect their pitch for investors, accelerators, or pitch competitions.
full_address: PENN 1, 1 Pennsylvania Plaza, New York, NY 10119, USA
event_description:
​Transform your startup idea into a compelling pitch deck that gets results. This intensive, hands-on workshop takes you from concept to confident presentation in just 2 hours.

​​What You'll Walk Away With: A battle-tested pitch deck that's been presented to real judges and refined based on live feedback

​​Workshop Flow:

​​Foundation - Essential pitch deck theory and frameworks

​​Build - Create your deck outline and slides using Gamma AI

​​Refine - Leverage Claude and ChatGPT to polish your messaging and data

​​Test - Present your 3-minute pitch to the group and expert judges

​​Perfect - Incorporate real-time feedback and discussion

​​Connect - Network with fellow founders over refreshments

​​Who Should Attend: Early-stage founders, startup teams, and entrepreneurs preparing for investor meetings, accelerator applications, or pitch competitions

​​What to Bring: Your laptop and startup idea - we'll provide the AI tools, frameworks, and expert guidance

​​Format: 90 minutes of intensive workshop + 30 minutes networking

​​This isn't just another pitch deck template session. You'll actually build, present, and refine your deck with real feedback from experienced judges and fellow founders. Leave with a presentation that's ready for investors, not just theory.

​​Hosted by Stifel Venture Bank

​About Resident Company Club

​Resident builds curated mini-communities for founders, CEOs, CFOs, operators, and investors in NYC. It’s a place for the brightest minds who are passionate about building generational businesses to share knowledge and challenge ideas. Guided by a give-first ethos, our members are committed to supporting and uplifting one another. We host unique events, workshops, Jeffersonian meals, and parties in NYC, facilitating meaningful debates on professional, cultural, and social issues.

​Learn more at https://residentcompanyclub.com/

​About Stifel Bank

​Stifel Financial (NYSE: SF) is a global investment bank, wealth management, and commercial banking institution with $400B+ in AUM. Stifel Bank offers venture and fund banking solutions, including 100% free banking for fund clients, fully insured liquid ICS accounts (up to $250MM FDIC coverage), capital call and management company lines of credit, and venture lending.

​Learn more at https://bankwithstifel.com/venture-banking/

​By attending this event, I agree that photographs, video, and/or audio recordings may be taken of the attendees, which Stifel Bank and its affiliates will own and may use hereafter in any electronic or print distribution, or by other means (including social media) for any purpose.

event_name: Human Connection x Consumer AI | Founders & Funders Night by Women in AI
event_summary:

event_description:

​Join us for an unforgettable evening diving into one of the most fascinating frontiers of technology: AI that brings people closer together. From dating and friendships to mental health, identity, and self-expression — consumer AI is rewriting the rules of human connection.

​💫This event is sponsored by Distill, a next gen dating platform that uses personalized AI agents to source and vet matches for you, eliminating the need to swipe. We distill the dating pool down to just a few high quality, bilateral matches with a detailed match report and the A2A conversation behind every recommendation.

​💖 Sign up here: DistillDating.com + access code: CURATE

​This event brings together visionary founders, bold investors, and curious minds building the next generation of AI-powered experiences that touch hearts, not just screens.

​Whether you're building, investing, or simply exploring the edges of what’s possible — this night is for you.

​5:00 – 5:30 PM

🔥 Main Panel — Human Connection in the Age of AI
Candid stories, big ideas, and behind-the-scenes insights from founders & investors reimagining how we date, talk, grow, and connect in a tech-driven world

Social Mixer: Chill drinks, unexpected convos, new relationships

Consumer AI founders, product visionaries, VCs, designers, creators, and anyone obsessed with how tech shapes who we are — and who we could become.

​Come for the insights. Stay for the people.

​Women in AI is built to connect, empower, and elevate female founders, investors, and engineers in artificial intelligence. Subscribe to our newsletter to join us!

​Let’s build AI that connects — not isolates.

​#WomenInAI #HumanAI #AIForAll

event_name: KSC Summer 2025 Korean Deeptech Late August Pitch Showcase
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the KSC Summer 2025 Korean Deeptech Late August Pitch Showcase, where 10 innovative Korean startups, representing $50M+ in revenue and funding, will pitch their market-ready solutions to New York's elite investor community. Discover cutting-edge technologies in AI, robotics, and more, and explore investment opportunities, networking, and cultural bridge-building. Ideal for active investors, corporations, service providers, and government agencies seeking innovative solutions and international partnerships.
full_address: New York, NY, USA
event_description:
​Join us for the highly anticipated KSC 2025 Late August Summer Pitch Showcase organized by Elpis Labs, where 10 game-changing Korean startups — collectively representing $50M+ in revenue and funding — will pitch their market-ready solutions to New York's elite investor community.

​We're talking about companies with Fortune 500 partnerships, CES awards, NIH collaborations, and proven revenue streams ready to scale in the world's largest market.

​Each startup has been rigorously selected and primed for U.S. expansion, with concrete fundraising targets, strategic partnerships already in motion, and clear paths to market domination.

​Why Attend?

​Discover Korea's Innovation Pipeline.

​Network with Industry Leaders.

​Explore Investment Opportunities.

​Cultural Bridge Building.

​Presenting Companies

​Meet our exceptional cohort of Korean startups ready to transform industries:

​​Aeonus - Smart, mobile, and modular battery-based energy storage systems for EV charging, construction, and backup power — clean alternatives to diesel generators.

​RadaHaim - Standardized, scalable human organoids for non-animal testing, precision medicine, and regulatory-grade drug discovery.

​Greenish - A science-backed fertility lubricant that boosts sperm health instantly, offering a non-invasive alternative for couples trying to conceive.

​SGLab - The world's first AI-powered golf club delivering pro-level swing analysis without extra devices — just swing and get coached.

​The Dimension Company - AI-powered design automation that transforms sketches, text, and images into precision-grade CAD models for real-world manufacturing.

​​Be Nature BioLab - A next-generation CDMO platform enhancing ingredient bioavailability and product performance for food, cosmetics, and pharma using patented HME-DDS™ and 3DP tech.

​Voinosis - AI-driven voice analysis platform that detects early-stage dementia — fast, non-invasive, and accessible from home or hospital.

​Awesome Lab - Smart, energy-efficient water heating systems using ionization electrolysis — faster, cleaner, and greener than traditional boilers.

​Ipactory - AI-powered SaaS platform that automates the entire IP lifecycle for startups and tech companies.

​Colosseum Corporation - COLO AI is a modular AI-powered SaaS platform that automates end-to-end e-commerce logistics across global markets.

​Partnership Opportunities

​This event offers unique partnership possibilities for:

​Active Investors seeking diverse, high-potential deal flow

​Corporations looking for innovative technology solutions

​Service Providers interested in the Korean market

​Government Agencies supporting international trade

​Event Format

​5:30 PM - Registration
5:45 PM - Opening Remarks & Program Overview
6:00 PM - Pitch Contest
7:30 PM - Networking

​Location

​To be announced soon, NYC

​About the KSC Program

​The Korean Startup Center (KSC) Program at Elpis Labs is a 10-week accelerator program in New York City starting this July, designed for post-revenue startups in applied AI and robotics led by Korean founders. 

​The program supports founders as they establish a presence in the U.S. market, with a focus on go-to-market strategy, legal frameworks (including IP protection and contracts), corporate partnerships, and fundraising. 

​Participating startups will engage in hands-on workshops, expert-led sessions, and curated networking events to accelerate their U.S. expansion and build lasting connections across the innovation ecosystem.

​Reserve Your Spot Now, as we have limited capacity!

​​
📩 For media & partnerships, contact: info@elpislabs.vc

event_name: Founder Rooftop Mixer!
event_summary:
Here is a 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join Coeus Collective's Founder Rooftop Mixer at Nomadworks, featuring a live DJ, specialty coffee, and open bar options, where founders, investors, and operators can network and connect. This exclusive event offers a unique opportunity to meet innovators in entrepreneurship, technology, and venture capital, and is perfect for those looking to elevate their audience and build meaningful connections.
full_address: Nomadworks, 1216 Broadway, New York, NY 10001, USA
event_description:
​Join us for our second Coeus Collective Founder Rooftop Mixer at Nomadworks!

​After a successful first one in June, we had to come back. This time featuring our amazing organizing partners Somya Gupta and Cliqk's Rohan Gurram.

​Founders, investors, and operators at all stages are invited to attend. Whether you’re deep in product, raising a round, or just launched your MVP, this is your space!

​Live DJ for the whole night: sounds provided by the iconic Cotton Duck!

​Featuring coffee provided by Pitara Co! Pitara Co. brings rare specialty coffee from South Indian smallholder farms to the U.S., including beans grown in a protected tiger reserve in Karnataka. Tended by Indigenous communities, our coffee is shade-grown, biodiversity-friendly, and sourced through farmer collectives that pay at least 1.2X the market rate.

​Alcoholic drinks will be available for purchase. Purchase your open bar ticket (covering beer, seltzers, and two types of cocktails) from now to save! The IRL price will be higher. Alcoholic beverages powered by Above Board!

​About Coeus Collective:

​​🦉 Coeus Collective is a founder-powered media and community platform elevating the most innovative minds in entrepreneurship, technology, and venture capital. Through podcasts, events, and digital media storytelling, we help founders and VCs develop their audience of builders and innovators. Past events have featured Daniel Lubetzky (KIND Bars, Shark Tank), Michael Baum (Splunk), and Siya Raj Purohit (OpenAI).

​​The Coeus Collective Podcast is currently live on our Coeus Collective YouTube channel and all audio platforms! And shout-out to Nomadworks for supporting our Coeus Collective community.


​About Cliqk:

Cliqk is The AI Creator Network - helping brands scale with content creators. Build your Cliqk, your own custom roster of creators - handpicked by AI to match your goal, timeline, and budget. Whether you're launching a product or selling out an event, your Cliqk executes at scale.

full_address: Mason Jar NYC, 43 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
event_description:
​Zack Rosenberg, Len Bilello & Serial Marketers present... First Wednesday!


​
Step into the heart of the ad world every first Wednesday of the month conveniently held within walking distance of both Penn Station and Grand Central (the location is visible once your registration is approved).

​It's your go-to hub for networking and unwinding with the industry's best and brightest.

​From seasoned pros to newcomers taking their first steps into the advertising field, First Wednesday brings together a diverse blend of creatives, strategists, and marketers for a night of conversation, connection, and of course, cocktails.

​Nestled in the heart of NYC, Mason Jar offers the perfect ambiance to chill out after a hard day's work. Enjoy your complimentary welcome drink amidst the rustic charm and warmth that the bar is known for. Appetizing delights from their menu and exclusive drink deals will keep your spirits high throughout the evening.

​Swap stories from the front lines of ad campaigns, share innovative ideas, or perhaps find your next collaborator, client, or mentor. Our rotating spotlight session ensures you get the chance to make your mark - whether you're showcasing a triumphant campaign or sharing insights from a learning curve.

​First Wednesday is not just about building networks, but nurturing a community that thrives on shared experiences, successes, and challenges. It's the pulse of the ad industry, a space to celebrate our collective creative journey.

​So, remember: when the calendar hits the first Wednesday, it's time to head to Mason Jar. Experience an evening of industry camaraderie, brilliant insights, and fun-filled memories.

​We'll see you there at our next First Wednesday – your monthly ad industry tradition!

Oh, and Len Bilello will be there too.
