event_name: Rookies & Vets: NYC VC & MBA Summer Send-Off
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the Rookies & Vets: NYC VC & MBA Summer Send-Off to connect with fellow MBA VC summer associates and NYC VC investors for an evening of networking, conversation, and relationship-building. This unique event brings together the next generation of venture investors to share perspectives and experiences. Open to MBA VC summer associates, NYC VC investors, and those looking to build relationships in the venture ecosystem.
event_description:
​Join us for our first-ever summer send-off!

​We’re bringing together MBA VC summer associates and NYC VC Investors for an evening of drinks, conversation, and connection. Whether you’re wrapping up your internship or recently started in venture, this is a chance to meet peers in the ecosystem, share perspectives, and build relationships with the next generation of venture investors.

​Brought to you by:

​​​Lynx Collective connects and supports the NYC startup ecosystem through curated events and a weekly newsletter, founded by longtime startup veterans Andrew Chang (investor, advisor, board member) and Dorothy Chang (investor at NextWave NYC & Flybridge).

event_name: AI Builders Lunch w/ Next Wave NYC
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join NYC-based AI founders, engineers, and product builders for an intimate lunch, hosted by Next Wave NYC, to connect and converse about building the next wave of AI-powered products. Enjoy casual networking and great food without pitches or panels. This event is ideal for innovators and startup enthusiasts looking to connect with like-minded individuals in the NYC startup ecosystem.
event_description:
​Join us for an intimate lunch bringing together NYC-based AI founders, engineers, and product builders. Hosted with Next Wave NYC, this casual gathering is a chance to connect with fellow innovators building the next wave of AI-powered products. No pitches, no panels—just good food and great conversation.

​
​Brought to you by:

​Next Wave NYC is a pre-seed venture fund led by seasoned NYC founders and operators, investing in early-stage startups focused on AI applications and developer platforms. Backed by Flybridge, it aims to be the first check and strategic partner for the city's next generation of world-changing entrepreneurs.

​Lynx Collective connects and supports the NYC startup ecosystem through curated events and a weekly newsletter, founded by longtime startup veterans Andrew Chang (investor, advisor, board member) and Dorothy Chang (investor at NextWave NYC & Flybridge).

event_name: FC NYC • Founders Run & Coffee!
event_summary:
Here is a 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join Founders Common for a weekly run with fellow founders, operators, and builders, followed by coffee and networking opportunities. This free event is open to all, with a 4-mile route suitable for all paces, and concludes with post-run coffee at Rhythm Zero. Perfect for startup founders and builders looking to connect with like-minded individuals in the community.
full_address: Bandit Running, 328 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
event_description:
​Join Founders Common for our weekly runs with other founders, operators & builders across the city! Come run and then hang out afterward to chat with new friends across the startup community over coffee.

​​This event is free & open to everyone (FC members, guests & brand new friends)!

​Details

​​7:00 AM – bag drop @ Bandit

​​7:07 AM – group leaves (sharp!)

​​8:00 AM – post-run coffee @ Rhythm Zero

​​FAQ: 4 miles. All paces welcome!

​Founders Common

​​​​​​Founders Common is a private social community for early stage startup founders & builders. Built as a third-space away from the chaos of startups, we bring together some of the best across the early stage startup world over intimate, member-only events.

​​​​​​Want to join? Apply for membership!

event_name: FC NYC • Panel Chat
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join Founders Common for an exclusive, member-only panel chat with top startup voices on July 31st, 2025, featuring a happy hour and intimate Q&A session. This private event, capped at 30 attendees, offers a unique opportunity for early-stage startup founders and builders to connect and learn from industry experts. Apply for Founders Common membership to secure your spot!
full_address: New York, NY, USA
event_description:
​Hey, it's Damian & Brian!

​We're a couple of founders who couldn't find the startup community we wanted two years ago – one that brought together real startup friends away from the chaos of startups. So we built it ourselves. We host private events for our members (just like this one) all the time. If you’re curious to learn more about us, read this.

​Join us for a special, member-only happy hour turned panel conversation with a few top voices in the startup world. We’re almost done nailing down the details, but prior panels have been on (and included) the future of content marketing (ft. Ari Cagan & John Hammond) and building a 100K+ community (ft. Sugary & DK Kim).

​Details

​Date: July 31st, 2025

​Happy Hour: 6:30PM ET

​Panel: 7:30-9:30PM ET

​​Location: TBD

​We’re almost done nailing down the details, so stay tuned for updates to this event as they happen!
​
What to Expect

​Private 1:1 time with top voices in startups *

​​Exclusive seat in a small, intimate group

​​Live Q&A opportunity to ask questions

​Great conversations with top builders

​​New friends across the early-stage startup world

​* Members only.

​​Like all of our events, these conversations are small by design (this event will be capped at just 30 attendees) to allow for more personal conversations and funner experiences. As an attendee, you’ll be part of a small group of other top builders listening to a group of top voices in the startup world chatting about a pressing, hot-button startup topic.
​
FAQ: Our pre-panel happy hour is open to FC members only. Our panel chat is open to guests of the community via waitlist if space allows. Joining the waitlist means you may be selected if we have extra spots, but does not guarantee entry. Your name must be on the approved guest list to attend. ​

​​Learn more about ​​​​​Founders Common and ​​​​apply for membership to get auto access to this event and others just like it!

​Founders Common

​​​​​Founders Common is a private social community for early-stage startup founders & builders. Built as a third-space away from the chaos of startups, we bring together some of the best across the early-stage startup world over intimate, member-only events.

​​​​​Want to join? Apply for membership!

event_name: FC NYC • Founders Run & Drinks! (Night Brooklyn Edition)
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join Founders Common for a free, night-time group run in Brooklyn, followed by post-run conversations and networking with fellow founders, operators, and creatives. Meet at Domino Bocce Courts in Williamsburg at 7:30 PM for a 5k run along the West Side Highway. Open to all paces and levels, this event is a great opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals in the startup community.
full_address: Domino Bocce Courts, 15 River St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
event_description:
​Join Founders Common for a late night edition of our weekly runs throughout the Summer. Come out after work for a special run with other founders, operators, and creatives—then hang afterward for conversations!

​This event is free and open to everyone (members, guests, and new friends) and is part of a limited Summer Series of NYC evening runs.

​Details

​​​7:30 PM – meetup at Domino Bocce Courts in Williamsburg

​​​7:45 PM – group run heads out southbound along the West Side Highway

​​​8:30+ PM – post-run conversations

​FAQ: ~5k. All paces welcome. No bag drop available.

​Founders Common

​Founders Common is a private social community for early-stage startup founders & builders. Built as a third-space away from the chaos of startups, we bring together some of the best across the early-stage startup world over intimate, wellness-centered gatherings.

​Not a member yet? Apply here for access to more events.

event_name: Studio Visit | Sarah Meyohas
event_summary:
Here is a summary of the event:

Join us for an exclusive private studio tour with conceptual artist Sarah Meyohas, known for her innovative projects that explore the intersection of art, technology, and finance. Get a behind-the-scenes look at her groundbreaking work, featuring augmented reality, AI, and cryptocurrency. Ideal for art enthusiasts, tech-savvy individuals, and those interested in the fusion of art and finance.
event_description:
​We are pleased to invite you to an exclusive, behind-the-scenes private studio tour of conceptual artist Sarah Meyohas, whose pioneering work explores the intersection of art, technology, and finance.

​Known for her groundbreaking projects such as Bitchcoin and Cloud of Petals, Meyohas uses augmented reality, artificial intelligence, and cryptocurrency to examine how emerging technologies shape contemporary life. Her work has been exhibited at leading institutions including the New Museum, the Barbican Centre, and the Centre Pompidou, and has been featured in The New York Times, Artforum, and The Wall Street Journal.

event_name: Waypoint Dinner Series: July NYC
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

"Join the Waypoint Dinner Series in NYC for an exclusive evening of insights and connections with GTM experts, exploring scalable solutions and proven strategies for optimizing sales pipelines, streamlining operations, and boosting revenue. Enjoy a complimentary dinner at a top NYC spot while learning from industry leaders Polaris, Discern, and LeanData. This event is a must-attend for growth-oriented business leaders seeking innovative ideas and transformative conversations to elevate their GTM strategy."
event_description:
​Join us for a dynamic evening of insights and connections as Polaris, Discern, and LeanData host a private, invite-only dinner meetup designed to fuel your growth journey! Over a delicious meal, we’ll dive into scalable solutions and proven strategies that span the full spectrum of GTM.

​Whether you're looking to optimize your sales pipeline, streamline operations, or explore innovative ways to boost revenue, this meetup is your opportunity to engage with GTM experts who are ready to share real-world tactics for success.

​Dinner will be provided at one of the city's favorite spots, with our compliments. Take advantage of this moment to end your day with innovative ideas and motivating conversations designed to transform your GTM strategy from start to finish!

​Learn more about the hosts below:

​About Polaris: Polaris Ops is an AI Native RevOps agency, guiding companies, as they deploy the capabilities necessary to thrive in times when the only constant is change and uncertainty.

​About Discern: Discern gives revenue teams complete visibility into sales forecasting and pipeline performance, eliminating the guesswork from revenue planning. By automating sales data consolidation and providing real-time, system-validated insights, Discern helps businesses improve forecast accuracy, optimize pipeline management, and drive predictable growth.

​​About Lean Data: Lean Data empowers businesses with advanced lead management and routing solutions, optimizing sales efficiency and boosting revenue growth.

event_name: Flushing Tech Meetup - Hackathon at TIQC
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Join the Flushing Tech Meetup's hackathon at the Queens College Tech Incubator for a bi-weekly, freeform, self-organized 2-hour meetup where tech enthusiasts can bring their ideas and projects to collaborate and innovate. Connect with a vibrant community of tech enthusiasts, learn, and share knowledge in a dynamic environment. Open to seasoned pros, aspiring entrepreneurs, and hobbyists alike!"
full_address: Tech Incubator at Queens College, 6530 Kissena Blvd, Flushing, NY 11367, USA
event_description:
​Get ready to dive into the world of innovation and collaboration at the Tech Incubator at Queens College, where the Flushing Tech Meetup is hosting an electrifying hackathon just for you! In-person event!

​What’s in store for you?

​Bring your laptops, your brightest ideas, and ongoing projects – let’s build something extraordinary together! The Flushing Tech Meetup invites you to a bi-weekly, freeform, self-organized 2-hour hackathon where creativity knows no bounds. Whether you’re a seasoned pro, aspiring entrepreneur, or a passionate hobbyist, this event is tailor-made for tech enthusiasts like you!

​Why join the Flushing Tech Meetup?

​We’re more than just a group – we’re a vibrant community of tech enthusiasts from all walks of life! At the Flushing Tech Meetup, we connect, learn, share, and inspire. Whether you’re a commuter or a local resident, our goal is to cultivate a thriving tech community in and around Flushing, NYC. Join us for engaging workshops, exciting demos, insightful presentations, and networking events that will keep you at the forefront of the latest tech trends.

​Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to be part of something big! Mark your calendar, gather your tech gear, and join us at the Queens College Tech Incubator on Saturday from 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM. Let’s build the future together!

event_name: Build & Connect: Hands-On AI Workshop for PE and VC-Backed Finance Leaders
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the "Build & Connect" workshop, where finance leaders can explore AI tools like ChatGPT and Gemini to drive smarter decisions and connect with like-minded peers. Learn how to analyze data quickly, uncover insights, and deploy custom AI agents for finance workflows, with no technical background required. This interactive workshop is designed for finance, strategy, and operations leaders looking to build AI-first teams and workflows.
event_description:
​Join an interactive workshop built for finance leaders. You’ll get hands-on with powerful AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, and NotebookLM to analyze data quickly, uncover insights, and drive smarter decisions. But beyond the tools—you’ll connect with like-minded leaders who are actively building AI-first teams and workflows.

​What You’ll Learn

​How to use AI for faster data analysis, financial modeling, and executive-ready summaries

​Prompt strategies to extract insights from reports, spreadsheets, and internal documents

​Deploying custom AI agents for recurring finance workflows (e.g. forecasting, reporting, due diligence)

​Navigating top tools: Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini, NotebookLM, CustomGPT, and n8n

​Who Should Attend

​Finance, strategy, and operations leaders exploring GenAI

​No technical background needed—just a laptop and real-world challenges

​Executives looking to connect with peers and build an AI-first mindset across their org

​You’ll Walk Away With

​AI-powered workflows you can use immediately

​A curated stack of tools for smarter decision-making

​New peer connections with leaders embracing AI-first thinking in finance

event_name: Goodnight Summer : The Final Unveil
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join "The Beautiful Unveil" for a farewell summer bash, where fashion, tech, and creativity converge under the summer sky. This exclusive event brings together innovators, entrepreneurs, and creatives shaping the future of fashion, featuring curated cocktails, good music, and bold style. Dress to express and connect with like-minded visionaries building a new creative economy.
full_address: Unveiled, 94 N 13th St, Brooklyn, NY 11249, USA
event_description:
​The Beautiful Unveil – Last Thursday of the Summer

​Free entry with RSVP

​Your Hosts

​Tony Henry Founder & CEO, 99 Yards A trailblazer in fashion tech, Tony Henry is the visionary behind 99 Yards—a fast-growing platform revolutionizing how fashion professionals connect, collaborate, and create. With roots in both the fashion and entertainment industries, Tony is building tools that power the next generation of creative economies through technology, transparency, and global community.

​Chacha Sands-Little Founder, Beacon | Creative Director Chacha Sands-Little is the founder of Beacon, a bold new cultural media company connecting creators and audiences through collectible publishing, immersive events, and curated retail. With early pilots and a growing global network of creators and supporters, Beacon is on a mission to scale monetizable IP, cultural equity, and creator-led storytelling. For Chacha, Beacon is more than a platform — it’s a movement for the next era of media.

​Jennie Wang Founder, Jen House | Crypto Investor & Cultural Strategist Jennie Wang is a powerhouse crypto investor and cultural connector, redefining influence and representation in the Web4 space. Former Investment Director at $600M fund, Now the founder of Jen House, Jennie blends tech, culture, crypto and community—backed by brands like Coca-Cola, Vitamin Water, Jupiter, moonshot and Rabbit AI…

​

​Kimberly Morgan Founder, House of Morgan | Strategic Marketer & Brand Builder Kimberly Morgan is a seasoned brand strategist and founder of House of Morgan, a boutique marketing and creative consultancy rooted in cultural authenticity and visionary storytelling. With experience leading brand, content, and community strategy at companies like Airbnb, Kimberly specializes in shaping powerful narratives that move industries forward. She is deeply committed to elevating voices at the intersection of culture, commerce, and community.

​Join us for one moment before the season fades—The Beautiful Unveil, where fashion, tech, and creative energy collide under the summer sky.

​We’re bringing together the minds shaping the future of fashion—designers, founders, 3D artists, models, developers, and dreamers—for a night of celebration, connection, and collaboration. Let’s toast to building a new creative economy together, one vibe, one vision, and one unforgettable party at a time.

​Expect good music, bold style and curated cocktails to remember.

​This is the summer’s last statement.

​Dress to express. Come to connect. Leave inspired.

event_name: ComfyUI Official NYC September Meet-Up
event_summary:
Here is a 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the ComfyUI NYC Community for their September Meet-Up, featuring technical sessions, live demos, and discussions on real-time video AI, creative AI, and the latest ComfyUI ecosystem advancements. Discover the latest innovations from industry experts and sponsors, including Livepeer, Wan, and ZeroSpace. Attendees will gain insights into cutting-edge AI workflows, generative AI, and creative possibilities in film and video production.
full_address: New York, NY, USA
event_description:
​ComfyUI NYC Community powered by Livepeer
September Meet-Up

​​Join us for our monthly ComfyUI NYC Meetups, where we dive into real-time video AI, creative AI, and the latest advancements in the ComfyUI ecosystem. Each meetup features technical sessions, live demos, and discussions with community experts.

Livepeer is the creator and maintainer of ComfyStream, an open source real time interactivity plugin for ComfyUI. Check out https://daydream.live/ for a taste of the magic!

​​✨Sponsors

​Wan
Wan is a comprehensive and open suite of video foundation models that pushes the boundaries of video generation.

ZeroSpace
ZeroSpace is a next-gen production & creative studio specializing in the integration of digital, virtual, and live content.

​Past Events:

​July Meetup: A showcase of real-time AI video workflows using ComfyUI, TouchDesigner, and Livepeer by Dotsimulate, plus a production-focused session with Jacky Lu.

​June Meetup: Calvin Herbst showcasing FLUX and WAN 14B using open-source multimodal pipelines within ComfyUI.

​LINK TO VIDEO

​May Meetup: A demo of Daydream + ComfyStream for real-time video AI, paired with techniques for using ComfyUI to leverage generative AI in accelerating and extending traditional 3D production pipelines.

​LINK TO VIDEO

event_summary:

The current $79 early bird pricing is only for the first 25 tickets; prices will rise for the next two tiers after this!

About Cliqk:

Cliqk is The AI Creator Network - helping brands scale with content creators. Build your Cliqk, your own custom roster of creators - handpicked by AI to match your goal, timeline, and budget. Whether you're launching a product or selling out an event, your Cliqk executes at scale.

About Coeus Collective:

​Coeus Collective is the community for those who are building the future in NYC. Our events and media bridge the gap between idea and impact. We aim to be the first stop in your journey to being a founder or creator and seek to provide you with the resources and partners you need to get started. event_name: Wallet Max and Fintech Is Femme Present: The Emerald Climate Fintech Summit 2025
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the Emerald Climate Fintech Summit 2025 on September 19th in Manhattan, New York, to discover the latest innovative and sustainable fintech solutions driving climate action. This exclusive event brings together a diverse audience of changemakers, entrepreneurs, and professionals from fintech, climate tech, and beyond to unlock regenerative systems that benefit people, planet, and profit.
full_address: Civic Hall, 124 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
event_description:
​Discover the next generation of bold, INNOVATIVE, & sustainable fintech solutions that are driving our planet forward

​Climate tech is about directing capital toward a livable planet—and that makes it fintech.

From funding clean energy and scaling carbon markets to embedding sustainability in everyday transactions, these innovations rely on the same tools that power financial systems.

And just like fintech, climate tech isn’t only about technology—it’s about access. When climate solutions are paired with financial inclusion, we unlock regenerative systems that work for People, planet, AND PROFIT.

​CLIMATE FINTECH isn’t the future—it’s the now.

​Join us on September 19th at The Emerald Summit during Climate Week 2025 and discover the next generation of bold, innovative, & sustainable fintech solutions that are driving our planet forward.

​​What: Wallet Max and Fintech Is Femme Emerald Summit 2025

​​When: September 19th, 2025 (during NYC Climate Week)

​​Where: Manhattan, New York 

​​Who’s in the Room:

​At the intersection of NYC Climate Week, UN General Assembly, NYC Fashion Week - expect international audience, diverse industries, corporates/NGOs

​Startup founders, small-medium-businesses, tech builders - climate, fintech, AI, data, infrastructure (from Seed to Series B+), impact-driven, women-led

​Investors (Angels, Venture Capital, Private Equity, Family Offices, Fund of Funds) - investing from pre-seed all the way through IPO

​Corporate Boards, Executives, Middle Management - Board directors/members, CEOs, C-Suite (CTO, CIO, CFO, Chief Sustainability Officers, AI Officers)

​Policymakers and public sector leaders - NYC state/city officials, local regulators, bankers, financial institutions, Wall Street professionals

​Others - students, university professors, community organizations, media representatives (covering NYC Climate Week locally/regionally/globally)

​Note: climate touches all sectors. So, you can expect executives from healthcare, food, climate, fintech, tech/AI, fashion, and many more

​Startups interested in presenting their pitches can submit their interest at http://getwalletmax.com/startup-pitch-summit-2025 by August 19, 2025.

​​Why The Emerald Summit Matters:

​When climate solutions are paired with financial inclusion, we unlock regenerative systems that work for people, planet, and profit.

​Climate fintech isn’t the future. It's the now.

​If you’re a changemaker, entrepreneur, or professional passionate about impacting our world: you won’t miss this Summit.

​Reserve your space today and make your mark as a leader in climate tech.

​MEET YOUR HOSTS...

​Bhuva Shakti (she/her) is the visionary founder and CEO driving sustainable innovation at Wallet Max, a global community of executive women and venture capital investors with a mission to expand fundraising access for high-growth sustainable startups. With an MBA from Columbia University in New York and as a senior executive director on Wall Street for three decades, Bhuva has managed diverse financial portfolios and launched several digital transformation products for investment banks, capital markets, and payment networks.

​Bhuva’s leadership and risk governance oversight, during the global financial crisis and the pandemic, was pivotal for the success of regulatory compliance and mergers acquisitions at the world's top banks and credit rating institutions. Bhuva is a board director and fractional C-Suite advisor for social impact businesses, and a keynote speaker advancing economic inclusion and climate-fintech partnerships.

​Bhuva is the USA country director for World Business Angels Investment Forum and the Chief Ethics & Culture Officer for Women in AI worldwide. She leads the fundraising strategy and product operations for market expansion and manages investor relations throughout the diligence and investment. Bhuva is the founder of Bhuva’s Impact Global that provides board advisory services and enterprise risk management for public and private corporations.​

​

​Nicole Casperson is an award-winning journalist, content director, professor, and leading voice in fintech. As the Founder & CEO of Fintech Is Femme, she leads a thriving media platform and community of over 50,000 fintech leaders dedicated to shaping a more inclusive financial landscape.

​Leveraging her extensive background as a former finance reporter and editor specializing in B2B sectors, Nicole provides trusted insights and analysis through her newsletter, podcast, and event series. She has been honored as a Top 100 Women in Fintech, Top 50 Women in Media, and as a storyteller with a Shorty Impact award.

​Nicole's impactful contributions span prestigious speaking engagements, regular features in Forbes, and the release of her debut book, Fintech Feminists, published under Wiley, which has rapidly ascended to the #1 new bestseller spot on Amazon.

​

​​About Wallet Max: 

​Wallet Max is an inclusive global community of corporate executives and venture capitalists with a mission to expand fundraising access for high-growth startups in the technology, AI, fintech, and climate sustainability sectors.

With more than 10 investments directly in impact entrepreneurs thus far, Wallet Max’s network of 1,000 innovators and 60 partners regularly meet in person and virtually throughout the year to mutually exchange connections and drive collective action. Wallet Max ecosystem of events and initiatives are prominent during the New York Fintech Week, the New York Tech Week, and the New York Climate Week every year.

Wallet Max's Planet Positive Podcast is a monthly interview with female investors driving impact globally. Aligned with our mission to challenge the status quo, we showcase personal and professional journeys of diverse investors (Angels, VCs, PEs, Family Office, Corporate Venture) looking to leverage inclusion and impact without compromising growth of investments. Supporting sustainable innovations is good for people's wellbeing, planet survival, and financial profits.

Learn more about Wallet Max 2024 success and 2025 global initiatives: https://getwalletmax.com/climate-forward-2025

​About Fintech Is Femme: 


​
​Fintech Is Femme is a media company and community dedicated to shaping fintech's future. The publication provides news and analysis on innovative startups to established institutions, showcasing their impact and vision through an industry-leading newsletter, podcast, and event series. Subscribe to the Fintech Is Femme Newsletter here.

​Note that photographs and video will be taken throughout the event and will be used for marketing purposes only.

​Once your seat at the table has been approved, your payment method on Luma will be charged. Please note that there are no refunds for this event given the exclusive nature.

Network with like-minded individuals, learn from industry leaders, and gain actionable insights to turn mid-summer momentum into lifelong advantages. event_description:
​​What Makes This Different

​​This isn't about surviving your internship—it's about thriving beyond it:

​​Serial entrepreneurs who built million-dollar side hustles while working full-time

​​Creator-founders monetizing their personal brands during their internships

​​NYC's most ambitious interns who are launching, building, and scaling right now

​​Tactical strategies, real revenue numbers, actionable blueprints

Connect with interns already building their next chapter + premium CPG sampling

​​7:00 PM - 8:00 PM: Founder-Builder Panel
"From Side Hustle to Main Character: Building Your Empire While Everyone Else is on Autopilot"

​​Featuring builders who:

​​Launched profitable businesses during their Goldman internship

​​Built 6-figure personal brands while working at unicorns

​​Turned mid-summer insights into post-graduation opportunities

​​Monetized their expertise before returning to campus

​​8:00 PM - 8:30 PM: Builder Mixer
Final connections with fellow interns, active founders, and potential collaborators

​​💎 Who Should Attend

​​✅ Summer interns who've learned something valuable and want to monetize it
✅ Side hustle launchers ready to scale beyond "someday"
✅ Content creators turning followers into revenue streams
✅ Future founders who won't wait until graduation to start building
✅ Anyone who sees July as acceleration time, not vacation time

​​🏆 Featured Panelists

​​Curating NYC's most impressive young builders who turned their internship insights into profitable ventures.

​Vivek Pandit - Forbes 30 under 30 and co-founder of PeduL created a recruiting marketplace in 2019, aimed at presenting opportunities to diverse Gen Z talent who otherwise might not be reached by large corporations. Partners include Paramount, Visa and Audible. The New Jersey-based organization has raised $1.5 million and reached 160,000 students, including at HBCUs and tribal colleges.

​Jonathan Javier (#JWoW) | Founder of Wonsulting- From first-gen Filipino background to Forbes 30 Under 30, Jonathan turned his own struggle with job rejections into a mission to "turn underdogs into winners." As founder of Wonsulting, he's helped thousands land offers at Google, Facebook, Amazon, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs while building a 3 million follower community across social platforms. He's spoken at 250+ universities across 9 countries and been featured on Forbes, NY Times, WSJ, NY Times, and CNBC for his career expertise. Jonathan created WonsultingAI, an AI-powered job search tool that solves for everything you need to land a job coming from a non-traditional background. He gets the Gen Z career struggle – making him perfect for our intern audience.

​​Panel lineup dropping soon...

​​📍 Venue

​​Date: July 29th
Time: 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM EST
Dress Code: None

​​💭 Why We're Hosting This

​​July is the make-or-break month for ambitious interns. It's when you either:

​​Level off like everyone else, or level up and separate yourself from the pack.

​​The interns who build momentum in July become the entrepreneurs, executives, and industry leaders everyone remembers. They don't wait for permission, perfect timing, or graduation.

​​They build now.

​​This event is for the builders who understand that mid-summer momentum creates lifetime advantages.

event_name: Founder Poker & Game Night
event_summary:

Join MEOW X RRE VENTURES for an exclusive Founder Poker & Game Night, where 20 selected builders can connect over drinks and a high-stakes poker game with no pitches or name tags. Enjoy a unique, low-key evening with standard casino-style Texas Hold'em rules and no rake. Ideal for founders and builders looking to make real connections in a relaxed, competitive setting.
full_address: Maxwell Tribeca, 135 Watts St, New York, NY 10013, USA
event_description:
​MEOW X RRE VENTURES.

​We’re bringing together a sharp group of builders for an evening that’s low-key but high-stakes. ​

​​No name tags, no pitches — just good drinks, real connections, and a competitive game. ​

​​20 seats only — RSVP to secure your spot at the table.

​​HOUSE RULES:

​BLINDS: $1/$2 (or as agreed by table).

​MAX BUY-IN: 200 BB or table max; no min; Venmo full amount to table bank prior to play.

​​REBUYS/ADD-ONS: you must sit out until your chips are fully in play and sorted.

​​RULES: standard casino-style Texas Hold'em; organizer has final say on disputes.

​​STRADDLES: unlimited, starting UTG.

​​RUNOUTS: default is 1; multiple runouts require all players involved to agree.

​​OTHER: e.g., 2-7, bomb pots, etc. allowed with unanimous table consent.

​​No rake.

full_address: Index, 120 Walker St 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
event_description:
​In this three hour workshop, we’ll be paying special attention to the various files we accumulate digitally: that thing you saved for later; a forgotten screenshot; a treasured document. Uncover something new from the files you already have sitting on your hard drive. You may not leave feeling any more organized but we will have created something beautiful together. Bring your laptop!

​Learning Outcomes

​Create new compositions out of existing material

​Playfully approach your archive

​Share your files and work collaboratively with other workshop attendees

​Learn about different artistic approaches to accumulation through short exercises

​Instructor Details

​Molly Soda (b. Amalia Soto, San Juan, Puerto Rico, 1989) is an artist based in New York. Her practice incorporates performance, video, photography, and installation, with work often existing online, evolving and decaying along with broader shifts in culture.

event_name: Creatives in Finance
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Join the 'Creatives in Finance' event to unlock the $104B opportunity in the creator economy, where finance professionals can monetize their expertise without compromising their day jobs. Network with 50 curated attendees, learn from high-impact panels, and explore strategic partnerships in a unique, exclusive setting. Ideal for finance professionals with creator ambitions looking to dominate the next decade."
full_address: Midtown Manhattan, New York, NY, USA
event_description:
​The $104B Opportunity Wall Street Is Missing

​Finance professionals are sitting on untapped creator economy goldmines. Goldman analysts with 50K followers. JP Morgan VPs teaching on TikTok. Hedge fund associates building course empires.

​These aren't side hustles. They're the future of finance.

​What You'll Experience

​🍷 Welcome Reception (6:00 - 6:30 PM) Arrive, grab refreshments, and start networking. Perfect timing for after-work transition - no need to rush from the office.

​🎯 High-Impact Panel (6:30 - 7:00 PM) Learn from finance professionals who've cracked the creator code:

​How to monetize expertise without compromising your day job

​Compliance strategies that actually work at top-tier firms

​Building audiences while climbing the corporate ladder

​Revenue frameworks tested by 6 and 7-figure finance creators

​🥂 Strategic Mixer (7:00 - 7:30 PM) Network with 50 curated finance professionals who are building empires after hours. This isn't random networking - it's strategic positioning with your future collaborators and competitors.

​💼 Live Marketplace (Throughout Event) The ultimate test: sell your courses, consulting, artwork, or services to fellow finance professionals. Real money, real transactions, real practice monetizing your expertise.

​Why Now?

​The arbitrage window is closing. Finance content gets 10x engagement vs other B2B verticals. Financial creators command premium rates ($50K+ for sponsored posts). Yet 90% of finance talent has never monetized their expertise.

​Your competition isn't just hiring your colleagues - they're partnering with them.

​Event Details

​📍 Location: Premium Manhattan venue (address shared upon confirmation)
👥 Capacity: 50 attendees (applications close when full)
💰 Cost: Free (sponsored by forward-thinking firms)
🎯 Target: Finance professionals with creator ambitions

​What Makes This Different

​This isn't another networking mixer. This is strategic positioning for the finance creators who will dominate the next decade. Every person in that room will be running something important in 5 years.

​We're facilitating those connections now, before they become impossible to access.

​Questions?

​Corporate partnerships: Natalie@thegenztea.com
General inquiries: DM

​The intersection of finance + content is the next trillion-dollar market. Position now or watch from the sidelines.

​#FinanceCreators #WallStreet #CreatorEconomy #NYC

event_name: AI Agents Hackathon
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the AI Agents Hackathon event:

Join the AI Agents Hackathon on September 6, 2025, where builders, researchers, and founders come together to craft autonomous systems that will define the next decade. This 24-hour event focuses on creating real AI agents with multi-agent systems, supply chain orchestrators, and personal AI that can tackle complex domains. It's an inclusive event with a focus on empowering women in AI, offering dedicated mentorship, networking, and a direct pipeline to female-founded AI companies.
full_address: Meatpacking District, New York, NY 10014, USA
event_description:
​🤖 AI AGENT HACKATHON
​Building the Future of Autonomous Intelligence

​September 6, 2025 | Co-hosted with The Residency

​The Inflection Point is Now

​2025 is the year of AI agents. While everyone else is still building wrappers around LLMs, the sharpest builders are crafting the autonomous systems that will define the next decade. Women make up just 22% of AI professionals worldwide and only 12% of AI researchers – but that changes here, today, with us.

​This isn't another hackathon. This is where the future gets built.

​What We're Building

​Real agents. Real autonomy. Real impact.

​We're talking multi-agent systems that reason, plan, and execute without handholding. Supply chain orchestrators. Research companions that think alongside you. Personal AI that actually understands context. The kind of technology that recent winners like RiskWise have proven can tackle complex domains like supply chain risk analysis with AI agents that provide timely, game-changing insights.

​Prize Categories:

​Who Should Be Here

​The Builders:

​Engineers who think in systems, not just code

​Researchers who want their work in production, not just papers

​Founders building the next Anthropic, not the next ChatGPT wrapper

​Women in AI who are tired of being the only one in the room

​The Visionaries:

​Product leaders who understand that agents ≠ chatbots

​Technical founders ready to 10x human capability

​Anyone who believes diverse teams are better at identifying potential biases and blind spots in AI systems

​Why This Matters for Women

​Women's involvement in AI isn't just about technical expertise – it's crucial for ensuring AI solutions tackle ethical and social challenges. Diversity brings unique insights into the ethical and societal implications of AI, helping reduce bias and create technologies that better serve all members of society.

​We're actively building the future we want to see:

​50% of judging panel are women leaders in AI

​Dedicated mentorship track with female AI executives

​Networking designed for meaningful connections, not small talk

​Direct pipeline to female-founded AI companies actively hiring

​Co-hosted with The Residency

​The Residency – where ambitious builders live and work alongside equally driven peers – brings their network of entrepreneurs who've already raised from a16z, Collaborative Fund, and other top-tier investors. With Sam Altman as startup advisor and a track record of supporting high-potential builders, this isn't just an event – it's your entry point into the ecosystem that shapes the future.

​The Technical Stack

​What you'll have access to:

​$1000 in credits per team across OpenAI, Anthropic, Groq, and Azure

​Open source frameworks: LangGraph, AutoGen, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel

​Real datasets from partners (healthcare, finance, climate, supply chain)

​GPU clusters for training custom models

​Direct API access to latest frontier models

​What we expect:

​Working demos, not slide decks

​Code that runs, not promises it will

​Impact that scales, not toys that impress

​The Details

​When: September 6, 2025 (24 hours of pure building)
Where: Location TBD
Team Size: 1-4 people
Skill Level: Intermediate to Expert (we'll have tech talks, but this isn't a tutorial)

​What's Included:

​Meals designed by actual humans who understand nutrition

​Late-night debugging sessions with people who actually get it

​Post-event investor connections for top teams

​Apply Now

​Space is intentionally limited to 200 builders. We're optimizing for signal, not noise.

​
Commitment required: Full 24 hours, no exceptions

​Special consideration for:

​Women in AI (we're serious about changing the demographics)

​Technical teams with novel approaches to agent architecture

​Builders who've shipped AI products in production

​International participants

​"The future belongs to those who build it. And the future of AI belongs to those building autonomous agents today."

​Ready to shape the next decade of AI?

​Questions? Reach out to natalie@thegenztea.com

​This event is committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All genders, backgrounds, and experience levels are welcome. We enforce a zero-tolerance policy for harassment.

event_name: August Founder Breakfast
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the August Founder Breakfast, a curated event for seed-stage founders to connect with peers and gain actionable insights on scaling their business. Expect real talk and sharp conversations on traction, metrics, and storytelling, with a focus on making sharper decisions on legal, hiring, and GTM strategies. Ideal for founders who've raised pre-seed or seed funding and are looking to build momentum towards their next round.
event_description:
​​Join us for a highly curated breakfast designed for seed-stage founders.

​​The goal? A high-signal room with peers who are in the same chapter. Expect real talk, sharp peers, and conversations that don’t happen on panels.

​​Who Should Attend?

​Founders who’ve raised pre-seed or seed and are now focused on building momentum — assembling the team, refining GTM, and crafting the narrative for their next round.

​This is for those making key decisions around traction, metrics, and storytelling, and looking to learn alongside others on the same journey.

​​Why Attend?

​Make sharper decisions around legal, hiring, GTM, and early traction, and the foundations that set you up to scale

​Get clarity on what investors want to see between rounds

​Connect with a curated group of peers navigating the same inflection point

​Founders attending include YC & a16z-backed teams, repeat founders, and early operators from Uber, Meta, Ramp, Palantir, etc. 

​​Important Reminders:

​​Format: A highly interactive morning of structured conversation over breakfast with peer discussions, and a practical Q&A session.

​​Stay Connected: Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on our community, events and opportunities.

​​Photography Notice: By attending, you consent to being photographed or recorded for promotional purposes.

​About the Hosts & Sponsors:

​Brderless:

​Brderless was founded by Amy Quan to create a go-to knowledge hub supporting early-stage founders who are building in the post-Web2 world. We bridge the gap between bootstrapping and venture scaling, by providing essential skills, strategic insights, and access to experienced mentors through curated and tactical initiatives.

​Paul Hastings:

​Paul Hastings is a leading global law firm with dedicated teams focused on helping startups, high-growth companies, and venture capitalists navigate complex legal challenges. Our specialized groups provide expert, practical legal advice in areas such as venture financing, intellectual property, and regulatory compliance, where we are ranked Band 1 nationally for our Fintech and Payments work. We ensure founders receive actionable guidance and comprehensive support at every stage of their growth journey.

event_description:
​MEOW X DEALROOM MEDIA X LERER HIPPEAU.

​​We’re bringing together a sharp group of builders for an evening that’s low-key but high-stakes. ​

​​HOUSE RULES:

​​BLINDS: $1/$2 (or as agreed by table).

​​MAX BUY-IN: 200 BB or table max; no min; Venmo full amount to table bank prior to play.

​​REBUYS/ADD-ONS: you must sit out until your chips are fully in play and sorted.

​​RULES: standard casino-style Texas Hold'em; organizer has final say on disputes.

​​STRADDLES: unlimited, starting UTG.

​​RUNOUTS: default is 1; multiple runouts require all players involved to agree.

​​OTHER: e.g., 2-7, bomb pots, etc. allowed with unanimous table consent.

​​No rake.

event_name: 110th NY Hardware Meetup @ Industry City/Adafruit | Space Tech
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join the 110th NY Hardware Meetup at Adafruit in Industry City, exploring the growing NYC space tech industry with keynote speakers from Melagen Labs and Icarus Robotics. Network with hardware professionals, learn from industry experts, and discover opportunities for collaboration and growth. This event is ideal for engineers, makers, and entrepreneurs interested in space technology and innovation.
full_address: Adafruit Industries, 168 39th St Suite 1905CC, Brooklyn, NY 11232, USA
event_description:
​​​​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the next NY Hardware Meetup in Industry City at Adafruit! This month's event will be about the growing NYC space tech industry.

​​​​​Hardware Meetups happen in over 30 cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other.

​​​​​This month we'll be hosted by Adafruit at their facility in Industry City!

​Adafruit, established in 2005 by MIT engineer Limor Fried, has been at the forefront of the maker movement. It provides an unparalleled online platform for electronics education, the Internet of Things (IoT), and the latest high-tech chips for engineering. With a commitment to excellence and open-source, Adafruit is a trusted resource for makers and engineers of all ages and skill levels. Adafruit has expanded its offerings to include tools, equipment, and electronics that Fried personally selects, tests, and approves before they go into the Adafruit store. Adafruit is a 100% woman-owned manufacturing company, a certified Minority and Woman-owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE), a certified Women’s Business Enterprise (WBE), and WOSB.

​Industry City is a dynamic 35-acre creative campus on the Brooklyn waterfront in Sunset Park. Once a historic industrial hub, it has been transformed into a vibrant destination blending innovation, culture, and community. Home to over 650 businesses across 16 buildings, Industry City offers a unique mix of artisanal shops, global eateries, art installations, and event spaces. Whether you're here for a meetup, to explore the diverse food options, or to enjoy live events, Industry City provides an inspiring backdrop for connection and creativity.

​​​SPEAKERS

​Limor Fried. Adafruit was founded in 2005 by MIT engineer, Limor "Ladyada" Fried. Her goal was to create the best place online for learning electronics and making the best-designed products for makers of all ages and skill levels. Limor is a proud contributor to the open-source community, offering all of her product designs for free on Adafruit’s website, and participated in the first Open Source Hardware Summit drafting of the Open Source Hardware definition. Limor was the first female engineer on the cover of WIRED magazine, was awarded Entrepreneur magazine's Entrepreneur of the Year, was awarded the Most Influential Women in Technology award by Fast Company magazine, was on the cover of Make: Vol. 57, and was named a WHITEHOUSE CHAMPION OF CHANGE in 2016.

​Muhammad Hunain is the founder and CEO of Melagen Labs, a deeptech startup developing dual-use lightweight bioengineered radiation shielding. He has a background in Aerospace Engineering from Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University. Before founding Melagen Labs, he led a Mars rover mission as Project Manager at NASA L’SPACE, overseeing a team of PhDs and aerospace professionals, and collaborated with Google and Microsoft on projects -- all by the age of 19

​Ethan Barajas is the CEO of Icarus Robotics. He is a mechanical engineer who has designed agricultural nanolabs for NASA and the ISS in high school and developed lunar rovers with NASA JPL at Caltech.

​​​​AGENDA

​​​​​6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments

​​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction

​​​7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+A

​​​8:20 - Community open mic

​​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.

​​​8:30 - Mix + mingle

​SHOUT-OUTS

​Special thanks to the nonprofit Empire Space, a community of space companies that brought us Melagen Labs and Icarus Robotics as speakers and includes other resources for space startups in NYC.​​

​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?

​​​​Sponsorship: ​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.

​​​​Host an event at your space: We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?

​​​​Speaker: Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.

​​​​If you want to get involved, head here: https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

event_name: Unmuted in the Park -The Role of Selfishness
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join "Unmuted in the Park: The Role of Selfishness" in Central Park for a thought-provoking conversation on the role of self-interest in America's divisions. This free pop-up event offers a 360° discussion on whether selfishness is destroying the country or essential for progress, featuring sharp takes and diverse perspectives. Ideal for curious individuals seeking better conversations and new connections.
full_address: Mineral Springs, Central Park, W 70th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
event_description:
​A Free Unmuted Pop-Up | Central Park

​Everyone says America is divided. But what if the real problem isn’t division. It’s self-interest?

​Are we falling apart because too many people are looking out for themselves? Or because we don’t look out for ourselves enough: as cities, as families, as voters, as workers?

​Some say selfishness is destroying the country: corporations hoarding, individuals isolating, no sense of shared sacrifice.
Others say selfishness is exactly what we need: Look out for your own. Be independent. Make the system work for you.

​At this Unmuted pop-up, we’ll gather in Central Park for the big questions, and 360° conversation. You’ll hear sharp takes, test your own views, and meet people who think differently, but are just as curious as you are.

​Come if you’re:

​Tired of both cynicism and naïve idealism

​Craving better conversations than your group chat allows

​A little opinionated and totally open

​Leave with:
A few new friends. And one question you can’t stop thinking about.

​We’ll set the tone. You bring your voice.

event_name: Fast Fashion and Luxury Beliefs - Wine Happy Hour to Save America
event_summary:
Here is a 3-line summary of the event:

Join a thought-provoking happy hour discussion on the complexities of fast fashion, exploring the unintended consequences of abandoning it and the challenges of transitioning to sustainable alternatives. This event delves into the ethical and economic implications of fast fashion's demise on vulnerable workers and economies. Open-minded individuals interested in intelligent conversation are invited to apply and attend.
event_description:
​Fast Fashion and Luxury Beliefs: A Harder Look at Who Pays to Be Ethical

​
While fast fashion is often condemned for its environmental and ethical abuses, the call to abandon it outright may reflect a luxury belief: a moral stance affordable only to those who don’t rely on cheap clothing or garment industry jobs. What happens to the 75 million workers, many in vulnerable economies, whose livelihoods depend on fast fashion if it's swiftly dismantled? Who exactly will fund the massive infrastructure shift required to replace fast fashion’s global supply chains with sustainable alternative: governments, brands, or consumers? And finally, if prices rise and access to affordable clothing shrinks, how do we avoid punishing the very people fast fashion once served?

​Intelligent, open-minded, and looking to meet similar folks? Join us for an After Hours happy hour at a wine bar in midtown to discuss. Application only.

event_name: Decentral Park Meetup
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the Decentral Park Meetup:

Join the Decentral Park Meetup on July 28th to learn about Traditional Dream Factory's innovative 25-hectare web3 powered ecovillage in Portugal, featuring regenerative living practices and collective governance through blockchain technology. Discover how TDF is revolutionizing sustainable living and inclusive decision-making. Ideal for those interested in eco-friendly living and decentralized governance.
full_address: 111 Conselyea St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
event_description:
​Join us on July 28th for a Decentral Park meetup featuring Ani Anca, the co-founder of Traditional Dream Factory (TDF)! TDF is transforming a former farm in Abela, Portugal, into a thriving 25-hectare web3 powered ecovillage village. With thousands of trees planted and sustainable practices like biochar carbon sequestration, agro forestry, solar energy, and circular resource management, come learn about this model for self-sustaining regenerative living!

​Leveraging crypto as a tool for collective governance, they've introduced web3 collective mechanisms granting token holders stay and decentralized voting rights. Their approach integrates blockchain to foster inclusive, transparent decision-making while sharing land stewardship, creating local and allowing for global mobility

Meetup Rules:

No shilling your venture backed/for profit projects
Respectful discussion and vibes

event_name: AI is Our Greatest Invitation ~ CHT Ted Talk viewing & discussion
event_summary:

This event invites individuals to share their hopes and fears about AI and collectively consider its direction for humanity. All voices are welcome to contribute to this critical conversation.
full_address: 111 Conselyea St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
event_description:
​Artificial Intelligence is a revolutionary technology with the potential to skyrocket human flourishing, or lead to our demise.

​Join us for a viewing of the May 2025 Ted Talk "Why AI Is Our Ultimate Test and Greatest Invitation" from Tristan Harris, Founder of the Center For Humane Technology.

​After the viewing (15 min), we will have a candid, facilitated discussion about the points raised & our own hopes & fears regarding AI.

​We have the power to direct where AI takes us as a community & as humanity. The choice is ours.

​Please join us! Your voice & presence are welcome.

event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Connect with fellow tech founders and creators on a 30-minute morning power walk, followed by casual hooping and games. This unique event combines physical activity with networking and trust-building, with the added bonus of joining a private WhatsApp group and getting featured on the staaake List for increased exposure."
event_description:
​Wednesday morning power walk: 30 min walk as an icebreaker, then 30 min of casual hooping — think shooting around, light games like HORSE. Just a chill way to connect and build trust. For tech founder & creators!

​​staaake Power Walk

​​It’s more like a break where you kill two birds at once—you get your steps in and meet peers, without wasting time.

​​Why it’s better than a regular meetup

​​Meetups are a hit or miss. And even if it’s bad, you usually stay and end up thinking, I could’ve done more with that time.
With a power walk, even if you don’t vibe with the group, at least you got your steps in.

​​Bonus: Join Our Private WhatsApp Group

event_name: First Wednesday - January 2026
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Join the ad industry's best and brightest for a night of networking, connection, and cocktails at First Wednesday, held at Mason Jar in NYC. Enjoy complimentary drinks, appetizing eats, and exclusive deals while swapping stories and sharing innovative ideas with seasoned pros and newcomers alike. A monthly hub for industry camaraderie, collaboration, and celebration."
full_address: Mason Jar NYC, 43 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
event_description:
​Zack Rosenberg, Len Bilello & Serial Marketers present... First Wednesday!


​
Step into the heart of the ad world every first Wednesday of the month conveniently held within walking distance of both Penn Station and Grand Central (the location is visible once your registration is approved).

​It's your go-to hub for networking and unwinding with the industry's best and brightest.

​From seasoned pros to newcomers taking their first steps into the advertising field, First Wednesday brings together a diverse blend of creatives, strategists, and marketers for a night of conversation, connection, and of course, cocktails.

​Nestled in the heart of NYC, Mason Jar offers the perfect ambiance to chill out after a hard day's work. Enjoy your complimentary welcome drink amidst the rustic charm and warmth that the bar is known for. Appetizing delights from their menu and exclusive drink deals will keep your spirits high throughout the evening.

​Swap stories from the front lines of ad campaigns, share innovative ideas, or perhaps find your next collaborator, client, or mentor. Our rotating spotlight session ensures you get the chance to make your mark - whether you're showcasing a triumphant campaign or sharing insights from a learning curve.

​First Wednesday is not just about building networks, but nurturing a community that thrives on shared experiences, successes, and challenges. It's the pulse of the ad industry, a space to celebrate our collective creative journey.

​So, remember: when the calendar hits the first Wednesday, it's time to head to Mason Jar. Experience an evening of industry camaraderie, brilliant insights, and fun-filled memories.

​We'll see you there at our next First Wednesday – your monthly ad industry tradition!

Oh, and Len Bilello will be there too.

event_name: AI Agents UI + Eval + Scale | AI Show and Tell
event_summary: Join fellow AI enthusiasts at GitHub HQ on July 1st for an evening of talks on building, evaluating, and scaling AI agents.  Experts from Baseten, Tambo.co, and Arize will share insights and demos on generative UI, infrastructure, and agent evaluation.  This in-person event is perfect for AI professionals, enthusiasts, and anyone interested in the latest advancements.
full_address: GitHub, 88 Colin P Kelly Jr St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
event_description:
​​Join us on July 1 for our AI Show & Tell monthly event at the GitHub HQ. We'll have several fantastic talks, snacks & drinks, in a beautiful venue. Can't wait to see you there!

​This event is part of Global AI Community, please register there https://globalai.community/chapters/san-francisco/events/ai-show-and-tell-july-1st/

​Agenda

​6 PM: Doors open

​6 - 6:30 PM: Networking, light bites and refreshments

​6:30 - 7:45 PM: Program

​5 min: Intro - Pamela Fox MC, Principal Cloud Advocate @ Microsoft

​15 min: Talk - Michael N Magán @ Tambo.co on building AI powered apps

​15 min: Talk - SallyAnn DeLucia @ Arize on evaluation

​15 min: Talk - Philip Kiely @ Baseten on Inference and training

​25 min: Panel + Q&A - Moderated by Pamela Fox

​7:45 - 8:30 PM: Networking part II

​8:30 PM: Event concludes

​​​🎟 Limited spots available – secure your seat now!

​​AI Show & Tell is a monthly series designed to bring together enthusiasts, professionals, and experts in the field of AI. Each event features engaging presentations, interactive demos, and networking opportunities, providing a place for attendees to learn about the latest advancements in AI technology and connect with like-minded individuals.

​

​Talks

​Philip Kiely @ Baseten - Five things to know about AI infrastructure as you scale

​In 2025, AI-native startups are scaling to 8 figures of annual revenue in months. How do you build infrastructure that keeps up with this explosive growth? This talk provides five sometimes-surprising solutions selected from the hardest challenges we’ve faced while working on scaling fast-growing AI startups.

​Michael N Magan @ Tambo.co - Generative UI in Practice: From Intent to Interface

​Generative UI lets AI assistants surface real UI such as charts, forms, and complete workflows exactly when users need them. This talk shows how it works by treating components as tools: mapping user intent to the right component, binding data, and rendering on the fly. A demo of how we use it internally. I'll close with the main opportunities, and the chief challenges. Attendees leave knowing what generative UI is, why it matters, and how to ship it.

​SallyAnn DeLucia @ Arize - Evaluating Agents in the Wild with Arize

​This talk will demo how Arize supports agent evaluation with a focus on strategy and visibility. I’ll walk through our new Agent View, which aggregates traces, tool use, and reasoning steps into a structured, searchable format—making it easier to debug failures, track performance, and iterate on agent design.

​By registering for this in person event you are agreeing to have your e-mail shared with building security for building access. Your privacy is important to us. This privacy statement explains the personal data Microsoft processes, how Microsoft processes it, and for what purposes. You can view our full privacy statement here: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/privacy/privacystatement

event_name: Thought Leadership Dinner "The Convergence of Privacy, Data Security and AI Governance"
event_summary: A private dinner for 16 senior tech executives explored the crucial intersection of AI, data security, and privacy governance.  The event focused on building trustworthy AI systems, navigating global compliance, and fostering innovation without compromising security.  Ideal for Heads of ML, CISOs, and technology leaders seeking strategic solutions.
full_address: San Francisco, California
event_description:
​Join Us for an Exclusive Evening: Unusual Ventures Thought Leadership Dinner

​We’re excited to invite you to a private gathering of senior engineering and technology executives at the Unusual Ventures Thought Leadership Dinner. This exclusive event is designed to catalyze strategic conversations at the intersection of AI, privacy, and data security—where emerging risks meet transformative opportunities.

​You’ll be joining a select group of 16 technology leaders, including:

​John Vrionis, Managing Partner, Unusual Ventures
Niamh O'Donnell, Director of Programs, Unusual Ventures
Abhi Sharma, CEO and Co-Founder, Relyance AI

​Additional guests include top engineering and security minds from leading AI-forward organizations.

​Venue details will be shared directly with registered attendees.

​Topic: The Convergence of Privacy, Data Security, and AI Governance

​As generative and agentic AI systems increasingly influence core business operations, enterprises face a critical challenge: balancing innovation with accountability. The convergence of privacy, data security, and AI governance is no longer a theoretical discussion—it’s a boardroom mandate.

​Next-generation AI architectures require more than technical sophistication; they demand trust, transparency, and resilience. Privacy-preserving machine learning, secure model training, and real-time risk detection are rapidly becoming table stakes. Simultaneously, regulatory expectations around explainability, consent, and data lineage are reshaping how engineering leaders must design and deploy AI systems.

​For Heads of ML, CISOs, and technology executives, this moment calls for intentional leadership:

​How do we build systems that are not only intelligent, but inherently trustworthy?

​How do we future-proof our data and AI pipelines for a fragmented global compliance landscape?

​And how can we embed governance into AI development without slowing down innovation?

​This executive roundtable will unpack these strategic imperatives:

​What architectural principles drive AI systems that are secure, private by design, and auditable at scale?

​How can companies align AI governance with data strategy to create sustainable competitive advantage?

​What best practices are emerging across high-stakes industries—and what lessons can we learn from early adopters?

​Join us for a candid, high-impact discussion on operationalizing trustworthy AI at scale—where security, privacy, and governance are not afterthoughts, but foundational design pillars.

event_name: Turn your Codex agents into a production-grade coding team with a cloud backend
event_summary: This workshop teaches developers how to deploy and manage open-source Codex coding agents as a production-ready team using a cloud backend (xpander.ai) and observability tools (AgentOps.ai).  Participants will build and deploy cloud-based, event-triggered agent workflows in a hands-on session, eliminating the need for brittle local scripts.  Ideal for developers, AI engineers, and enthusiasts seeking to scale their AI agent projects.
full_address: AWS Builder Loft, 525 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
event_description:
​Open-source coding agents are ready for production - if you give them the runtime they deserve.

​​If you’ve already tried Codex, you know it’s powerful - but turning it into a reliable developer sidekick requires significant effort. You’ll need to manage sessions, handle long-running tasks, secure sandbox and terminal access, integrate with third-party services like GitHub and deal with A2A to allow multi-agents deployments so you can build a team of coding agents.

​​This workshop is for developers and AI agent builders who want to run open-source coding agents in the cloud, as part of a team, with the right infrastructure behind them.

​​We’ll walk through how to take local coding agents and run them with a proper backend: secure runtimes, persistent memory, triggers via MCP right from your IDE, and multi-agent orchestration using A2A (Agent-to-Agent). No more running brittle scripts on your laptop. No more glue code. Just real infrastructure, ready to scale your agents from toy to teammate.

​​We’ll use xpander.ai, backend-as-a-service for agents, to set up, deploy, and orchestrate coding agents that can interact, share state, and get real work done even when you're offline. We’ll use AgentOps for observability, to monitor, debug, and understand our AI agents' behavior with time-travel session replays, prompt-level insights, and detailed traces of tool calls, errors, and token usage.

​​In under three hours, you’ll go from zero to running agent workflows that are cloud-deployed, event-triggered, and fully observable.

​​Agenda:

​​5:00–5:30 PM | Gathering, snacks, networking
5:30–5:50 PM | Tech talk 1: The three most important things you need for running coding agents in the cloud
5:50–6:10 PM | Demo 1: xpander.ai
6:10–6:30 PM | Demo 2: AgentOps.ai
6:30–8:00 PM | Hands-on workshop - build it on your own
7:00 | Pizza is served 🍕
8:00–8:30 PM | Progress check-in and wrap-up

​​Who Should Attend:

​​Developers that are actively building AI Agents

​​Developers and DevEx engineers that want to accelerate dev processes

​​AI Platform engineers and AI Squad members

​​AI Agent Enthusiasts and hobbyists

​​Prerequisites

​​​⌚ Please come with laptops and Cursor/Windsurf/VSCode MCP Extension pre-installed

​​All guests must present a valid and physical government-issued ID - this is mandated by the venue provider.

event_name: Open Lab: July 2nd, 2025
event_summary: Explore the semantic interpretation of dance through movement experiments & AI analysis at this Open Lab (July 2nd, 2025).  Combine contact improvisation with tennis balls and data collection to understand meaning encoded in dance sequences. Limited to 15 participants—register now!
full_address: 3175 17th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
event_description:
​Can dance have semantic interpretations? That’s exactly what we’ve been exploring in our Open Labs.

​Last week, we ran a small experiment—using a camera and AI to capture motion data—then ran some very preliminary analysis, pose by pose. You can check out the results in this blog post:

​👉 Semantic Interpretation of Dance Sequences (Part 1)

​It visualizes how a movement sequence maps into a simple two-dimensional semantic space.

​This Wednesday, we’ll design a few new experiments and collect more data to better understand the meaning encoded in movement. Instead of analyzing individual poses, we’ll look at 0.5-second chunks to see if short motion phrases carry more useful information.

​You may ask, why do this? One reason is to explore how a system could observe a dance, learn its patterns, and eventually predict what comes next—just like we do when we watch someone move.

​Meanwhile, we’ll keep rolling (literally) with our contact improvisation with tennis balls as a third partner. Think movement, play, and maybe a bit of massage, too.

​Come move, explore, and play with us!

​🧠✨ We have space for only 15 participants, so please make sure to register in advance.

​Come play, connect, and experiment with us!

​Follow us on Instagram: @kinetecharts

​Join our Slack community

​Photo from last lab

​Email us at info@kinetecharts.org with any questions or ideas!

event_name: Survival of the Smartest: Evolutionary AI for Social Good
event_summary: A sold-out event explored evolutionary AI's application to real-world problems, featuring a data scientist who uses these principles for social good, particularly with the UN.  The talk covered the biological basis of evolution and its application in AI, from gaming to climate policy.  This event was geared toward those interested in AI, science, and social impact, requiring attendees to be 21+.
full_address: Wave, 663 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
event_description:
​We're sold out! 🎉 Check out the resources below to learn more about us and stay updated on future events!

​​​​​JOIN OUR EMAIL LIST - https://forms.gle/eESV3EAJicPfC2oP6

​​​​​FOLLOW OUR INSTAGRAM - https://www.instagram.com/bigbrainsf/

​​​---------------------------------------------------------------

​🧬 What happens when Darwinism meets artificial intelligence?

​Join us at Wave for a deep dive into the science of evolution—and how it’s inspiring a new generation of AI to solve real-world problems.

​This talk will unpack the biological principles behind evolution and how they naturally create stronger populations over time. Then, you’ll see how these principles are recreated in AI algorithms, allowing machines to evolve smarter solutions fast. From mastering games like Flappy Bird to advising climate change policy, these evolving AI systems are tackling complex decision-making challenges that affect us all.

​The talk is led by Daniel Young, a data scientist and incoming Ph.D. student at the University of Texas at Austin. Daniel collaborates with the United Nations to apply automatic decision-making and AI for social good—putting nature’ logic to work on the world's toughest problems. 🤖🌍✨

​❓FAQs❓
​​​What should I expect?

​​​7:00-7:40 --> arrival & chats

​​​7:40-8:20 --> lecture

​​​8:20-9:00 --> q&a and more chatting

​​​Who's invited?

​​​Anyone with an interest in learning new things, meeting new people, and doing fun things on weeknights! Lots of people came solo to our last event, so don't be afraid to do the same—you’ll meet some awesome people!

​​​What about parking?

​​​There's no parking on-site, so we recommend street parking or using public transportation.

​Do I have to be 21+?

​Yes! This event is hosted at a bar, so you must be 21 or older to attend and purchase drinks. Stay tuned for future events in spaces that don't have an age requirement!

​​​What about refunds?

​You can refund your ticket up to 24 hours before the event starts. Since this is a limited-space event, we encourage you to update your RSVP if you can’t make it—this helps us keep spots open for others.

​​​I can't make it to this event. How do I stay updated for future events?

​​Join our email list! https://forms.gle/GQdDjd2UTV48F5Z17

​​​Follow our Instagram! https://www.instagram.com/bigbrainsf/

​​​How do I become a speaker?

​​​Email bigbrainsanfrancisco@gmail.com with your name, a brief description of who you are, and what you're passionate about / researching.

​What about the ticket structure? 💸

​Every ticket sold goes directly back into the business. However, we want to make our events accessible to everyone. If cost is a barrier, please reach out for financial assistance by emailing bigbrainsanfrancisco@gmail.com.​

​Thanks for supporting our growing mission!

​​*For any other questions or special accommodations, please email bigbrainsanfrancisco@gmail.com.

event_name: 🧠 The AI Collective | Beer Garden Bonanza 🇺🇸
