event_name: Agara Walks & Filter Kaapi - Sus-Walk + Thindi-Hop | A Sustainable Food Journey through HSR
event_summary: Join Agara Walks & Filter Kaapi's sustainable food journey through HSR, combining a 5km walk around Agara Lake with a "Thindi-Hop" featuring sustainable food.  This event, a pre-SusCrunch 2025 initiative, targets founders, professionals, and investors seeking networking and climate-conscious engagement.  Registration via Luma is required.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​Hey there,

​Join us for this special edition of Agara Walks & Filter Kaapi: Sus-Walk & Thindi-Hop in the run-up to SusCrunch 2025, a Sustainability & Climate Confluence by SusMaafia.

​Super excited to partner with SusMafia and Social Alpha to put together this walk.

​About SusCrunch

​SusCrunch is India's boldest climate collaboration summit - where climate founders, investors, and corporates gather to forge partnerships and scale climate solutions — with the spirit of a festival.

​About The Sustainability Mafia

​The Sustainability Mafia (SusMafia) is a founder-led nonprofit catalyzing India’s climate innovation ecosystem. They work across startups, universities, corporates, and capital providers to accelerate meaningful climate action — through programs like SusVentures, Mafioso, Climate Ninja, and our flagship convening, SusCrunch.

​What's New This Time?

​Post our usual walk at Agara Lake, we'll go on a Sustainability Food Trail in HSR and help ourselves with some yummy food made from sustainable ingredients.

​Registration on Luma is mandatory to join. I would highly recommend you to fill in all the details. It takes less than 60 seconds! This will help the right folks to reachout to you.

​Also we'll share the details you fill in the form: your Organization, Role & Introduction one-liner with other participants to optimise networking.

Walk & Coffee Timings:

​Reporting & Quick Intros: 7:30AM

​Start Walk at Agara Lake: 7:45AM

​End Walk: 9:00AM

​Coffee @ Aarogya Aahar: 9:00AM to 9:30AM

​Post that disperse or hang out in smaller groups.

​Walk Distance & Format:

​We start our walk at Gate 1, Agara Lake, HSR Layout, Near BDA Complex Flyover, Bangalore

​The shorter circle of Agara is 2.5kms. We'll cover 2 rounds of Agara.

​We can have one round of quick intros in the beginning based on who all show up on time. Then we split into smaller groups of 5-7 and walk. We can of course switch groups etc. to maximise networking.

​
We'll meet the Agara Entrance next to BDA complex flyover, close to Aarogya Aahar. Exact Maps location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/kGL7im88AjVJrNDn6

​1st Sector, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560034

​
We also have a Event Whatsapp group to coordinate better. You'll receive the link to join once your sign-up.

If you want to reach me for any details, you can DM me on LinkedIn or X.

​What you should get?

​Comfortable clothing and walking shoes for the 5km walk

​A small bottle of water, if you prefer

​Loads of energy & curiosity

​About Agara Walks & Filter Kaapi

​Agara Walks & Filter Kaapi is a 1000+ member community that meets early morning over weekends in Bengaluru for a networking walk around Agara Lake, HSR bringing founders, professionals and investors together for meaningful conversations that continue over a cup of hot filter coffee post the walk. Read about Agara Walks here: https://yourstory.com/ys-life/agara-lake-bengalurus-newest-address-for-entrepreneurs-to-network

​-Srikanth

​You can connect with me on LinkedIn or X.

​
A few photos from the previous meetups:

event_name: CustomerConnect: The AI Agents Revolution in Support
event_summary: A 12-hour hackathon in Bengaluru challenges developers, designers, and AI enthusiasts to build AI-powered customer support agents using LLMs and frameworks like LangChain.  Teams compete for prizes by tackling real-world customer service problems, showcasing innovation and practical application.  This event offers hands-on learning, networking, and mentorship from experts.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
event_description:
​CustomerConnect: The AI Agents Revolution in Support

​Event Details:

​Date: Tuesday, July 15, 2025

​Time: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM IST (12-hour hackathon)

​Location: A major co-working space, tech hub, or university campus in Bengaluru (e.g., WeWork, NASSCOM Startup Warehouse, IIIT-B, RVCE Auditorium)

​Facilities: Strong Wi-Fi, power outlets, whiteboards

​Overview:

​One-day hackathon to design, build, and demo a functional AI agent for customer support

​Rapid iteration using pre-trained LLMs and AI agent frameworks

​Focused on solving real-world pain points in customer service

​Why Participate?

​Fast-paced innovation with rapid prototyping

​Hands-on learning with AI agent development

​Networking with developers, designers, and experts

​Real-world impact through practical solutions

​Improve problem-solving, teamwork, and presentation skills

​Who Can Participate?

​Developers (backend/frontend) familiar with Python, JavaScript, APIs

​AI/ML enthusiasts with LLM and NLP exposure

​UX/UI designers focused on intuitive design

​Customer service professionals with domain insights

​Students eager to apply knowledge and learn

​Anyone passionate about AI-driven problem solving

​Team Info:

​Team Size: 1–4 members

​Individuals can join or form teams during the event

​Payment Link

​https://payments.cashfree.com/forms/aiagenthackathon

​Challenge Focus Areas (Choose One):

​Smart FAQ & Intent Routing Agent:

​Answer FAQs from a knowledge base

​Route unanswered queries to relevant departments

​Input: Text/URL of FAQ document

​Metric: Accuracy in answering and routing

​Sentiment-Aware Escalation Agent:

​Detect negative sentiment in customer messages

​Trigger escalation or human intervention

​Input: Sample chat transcripts

​Metric: Sentiment detection accuracy and timely escalation

​Order Status & Tracking Agent:

​Answer questions like “Where is my order?”

​Input: Dummy order data (JSON/CSV)

​Metric: Correct retrieval of order info

​Complaint Categorization Agent:

​Categorize customer complaints into predefined categories

​Summarize key issue

​Input: Complaint texts/emails

​Metric: Categorization and summary accuracy

​Technology & Resources:

​Languages/Platforms: Python (preferred), JavaScript/Node.js

​AI Agent Frameworks: LangChain, AutoGen, Microsoft Semantic Kernel, CrewAI

​LLMs: GPT-3.5, GPT-4o, Google Gemini, Llama.cpp (for local setup)

​Development Tools: GitHub, VS Code, Jupyter

​Data Handling: SQLite, JSON, Pandas

​UI Options: Streamlit, Gradio, Flask, React, CLI

​Mentorship: On-site AI/ML engineers and customer service experts

​Pre-event Prep: Starter kit with docs, datasets, and code templates

​Schedule:

​9:00 AM – 9:30 AM: Registration & Welcome Coffee

​9:30 AM – 10:00 AM: Kick-off, challenge overview, Q&A, team formation

​10:00 AM – 10:30 AM: Ideation and planning

​10:30 AM – 6:30 PM: Hacking session (core build time)

​1:00 PM – 2:00 PM: Lunch break (provided)

​4:00 PM – 4:30 PM: Snacks and coffee

​4:30 PM – 6:30 PM: Finalize prototypes and demo prep

​6:30 PM – 7:30 PM: Rapid-fire team demos (3 min presentation + 2 min Q&A)

​7:30 PM – 9:00 PM: Judging, networking, and winner announcement

​Judging Criteria:

​Functionality (40%) – Working solution, solves chosen problem

​Innovation & Approach (25%) – Creative, smart use of AI agents

​Impact (20%) – Value and real-world relevance

​Presentation & Demo (15%) – Clear communication and effective demo

​Prizes:

​1st Prize: INR 10,000 + Certificates + Recognition

​2nd Prize: INR 5,000 + Certificates

​3rd Prize: INR 2,500 + Certificates

​Audience Favorite: Swag/prize (voted by participants)

event_summary: AMD's Bengaluru AI Sprint is a 2-day hackathon and workshop series for experienced AI developers (1+ year LLM experience) featuring AMD MI300X GPUs and expert instruction from AMD, Hugging Face, and Meta.  Participants compete for ₹5 Lakh in prizes by building AI agents in two tracks: an adversarial question-answering game and an intelligent scheduling assistant.  This event is NOT for beginners.
full_address: Indian Institute of Science (Bengaluru), CV Raman Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560012, India
presented_by_name: AMD AI Sprint Hackathon & Workshop Series
event_description:
​Please Read before Registering:
​This hackathon is not beginner-friendly. We are specifically looking for developers with experience and a proven track record in the following areas:

​Proficiency in Python and expertise with ML libraries such as PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, or LangChain.

​Prior experience (minimum 1 year) with training, fine-tuning, or prompting LLMs (e.g., Qwen, LLaMA, Mistral, or GPT-based models).

​Familiarity with agentic workflows, prompt engineering, or RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)pipelines.

​Ability to work with Linux-based remote GPU instances or cloud environments.

​IMPORTANT NOTE:

​Please do not contact the event hosts for approval updates. All application approvals will be communicated only via Luma.

​We are currently reviewing a high volume of applications. Thank you for your patience!

​AMD is NOT responsible for sponsoring travel or accommodation. If your application is approved, it will be your responsibility to make your own travel and stay arrangements.

​Please do NOT contact IISc, Bengaluru about event approval.

​Why Attend?

​​Join India’s leading AI engineers, researchers, and enthusiasts in Mumbai for a 2-day hands-on workshops and hackathons powered by AMD’s MI300X GPUs. Whether you're a student, AI expert, or just starting your journey in machine learning, this is your chance to:

​Build AI agents using models like Qwen and Llama through a browser-based workflow – no prior experience needed

​Fine-tune pre-trained models with tools like torchtune and Unsloth to specialize them for real-world tasks

​Work directly on AMD’s cutting-edge MI300X GPUs with guidance from AMD experts

​Learn from engineers at AMD, Hugging Face, Meta & more

​Win exciting prizes in the hackathons

​Seats are limited – register early to secure your spot in Bengaluru!

​Agenda:

​​Day 1:

​​9:30 AM – Doors Open

​​10:00 AM – Opening Talk by AMD on "What’s New with AMD’s Developer Initiatives?"

​​10:15 AM – Hackathon/Competition Introduction

​​10:30 AM – Workshop 1: Developing MCP Agents with AMD GPUs.

​​11:15 AM - 11:30 AM Break– Workshop 2: Finetuning AI models using Torchtune and other libraries.

​​12:15 PM – Lunch + Networking + Hackathon/ Competition Team Formation if not done already

​​1:00 PM – Hackathon/Competition Kickoff+ Overview on Rules, Resources & Support

​​6:00 PM – Dinner & Networking

​​Day 2

​​8:00 AM – Doors Open + Breakfast Networking

​​8:45 AM – Partner Talk: Hugging Face- {Details Coming soon}

​​9:00 AM – 2:00 PM – Hackathon/Competition Continue

​​12:00 PM – 1:00 PM – Lunch

​2:00 PM - Submission Deadline

​​2:00 PM – 4:00 PM - Evaluation

​3:00 PM - Research Talk: Prof. Prathosh AP, IISc Bangalore

​​4:00 PM – 5:00 PM – Optional Top Team Presentations (5 min each)

​​5:30 PM – 8:00 PM – Awards + Happy Hour

​Workshop Details:
​Building AI Agents on AMD GPUs

​This hands-on workshop teaches you how to set up AI models and build intelligent agents (like chatbots or task-automation tools) using AMD MI300X GPUs. You’ll learn from AMD experts on how open-source models like Qwen and Llama through a browser-based workflow. No prior experience needed!

​ Fine-Tuning AI Models

​This second beginner-level workshop focuses on fine-tuning pre-trained AI models to make them smarter or more specific to a task (like better in answering questions or generating images). You’ll use AMD GPUs, torchtune, and other open-source tools like Unsloth, with guidance from AMD engineers.

​Hackathon / Competition Details

​A total of 5 Lakh in Prize money.

​Track 1: AMD AI Premier League (AAIPL)

​A head-to-head AI competition where teams of up to 3 developers build two intelligent language model based agents:

​Q-agent: Generates valid, challenging multiple choice questions belonging to a given domain.

​A-agent: Attempts to answer questions posed by the opposing team’s Q-agent.

​Goal: Create a question generator that can pose the most difficult yet correct questions while ensuring your answerer can accurately answer as many of them.

​Format:

​Matches are played between pairs of teams where one team's Q-agent generates a set of questions to which A-agent of the opposing team responds and vice-versa.

​Winning teams advance to the next stage.

​Resources Provided:

​1 MI300 GPU for 24 hours

​Sample code for prompt tuning, reinforcement learning, and fine-tuning

​Deliverables:

​Final working solution

​PowerPoint summarizing techniques used

​Track 2: Agentic AI Scheduling Assistant

​Problem: Scheduling meetings across time zones is inefficient and requires multiple back-and-forth messages. Existing tools lack intelligent conflict resolution.

​Goal: Build an AI-powered scheduling assistant using Agentic AI that automates meeting coordination by

​Scanning participant calendars to find optimal meeting slots

​Negotiating conflicts with other participant agents

​Sending polite reschedule requests

​Instantly confirming meetings or proposing alternative times

​Expectation: A seamless, intelligent assistant that minimizes manual effort in scheduling.

​Resources Provided:

​1 MI300 GPU for 24 hours

​Example application and dummy calendar events

event_name: BYOR: Bring Your Own Research
event_summary: BYOR is a 48-hour intensive research sprint for AI researchers, engineers, and students to pursue their own research questions without pressure, fostering collaboration and independent exploration.  Participants present initial ideas and then dedicate the weekend to focused work, ideally sparking new insights and connections.  This event is ideal for those seeking focused research time outside traditional academic settings.
full_address: Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
event_description:
​Hello,

​Welcome to a weekend of focused research.

​No prizes, no pressure. Just 48 hours to pursue a research question in AI that matters to you, in the company of 20 others doing the same. Whether you're stress-testing a hypothesis, exploring a promising line of inquiry, or prototyping a new method, this is time carved out to push your thinking forward.

​

​Who Is This For?

​AI Researchers, engineers, and students who:

​• Have a well-formed question or direction they’re eager to explore

​• Want to treat research as an active process by not just reading, but doing

​• Are comfortable working outside rigid institutional structures

​• Might be looking for collaborators who value both ambition and intellectual honesty

​

​What’s the Format?

​• Submit with 1–2 research papers, tweets, or blog posts that sparked your current line of thought

​• Form teams before the weekend if interests align, or work independently

​• Kick off with 3-minute thesis introductions from each team or solo researcher

​• Then, sprint: 48 hours of focused, self-driven research

​No fixed themes. Just this: What could you uncover if you gave one research question your full attention for a weekend?

​

​For any further questions, write to us at community@exceptionraised.com

​Warm regards,

​Exception Raised

​Twitter: @except_raised

event_name: Agentic Afterparty: Protocol Remix - Rerunn
event_summary: This "Agentic Afterparty" event explores Agentic AI and Application-to-Application (A2A) integration, showcasing how these technologies revolutionize enterprise automation through multi-agent collaboration.  Key highlights include live demos, hands-on labs with A2A protocols (Python/JS), and real-world case studies; ideal for AI engineers, integration architects, and DevOps specialists.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​Join us for a deep dive into Agentic AI and Application-to-Application (A2A) integration, exploring how these technologies are redefining enterprise automation and multi-agent collaboration. This two-session event combines technical insights, real-world use cases, and hands-on demos to empower developers and AI practitioners.

​Session 1: Agentic AI – Autonomous Systems in Action

​Discover how Agentic AI enables systems to reason, plan, and act independently. Learn about:

​Architecture: How agents leverage LLMs, dynamic reasoning, and orchestration.

​Multi-agent collaboration: Case studies of agents working together to solve complex tasks.

​Enterprise applications: From supply chain optimization to real-time decision-making.

​Session 2: MCP & A2A – The Backbone of Connected AI

​Dive into the protocols powering seamless integration:

​Model Context Protocol (MCP):

​A universal interface for AI agents to access tools, APIs, and data dynamically.

​Enables plug-and-play connectivity, eliminating custom integration work.

​A2A Integration:

​Traditional A2A: SAP’s approach to automating data exchange between internal systems (CRM, ERP) using middleware like Integration Builder.

​Modern A2A: Google’s open-source Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol, enabling cross-framework agent communication via tasks, messages, and streaming.

​Why Attend?

​Live Demos: See A2A in action.

​Enterprise Use Cases: Learn how companies automate inventory management, procurement, and customer interactions using A2A.

​Hands-On Labs: Experiment with A2A protocol implementations (Python/JS) and MCP-based agent servers.

​Who Should Join:AI engineers, integration architects, DevOps specialists, and anyone building scalable, interconnected AI systems.

​Hosted by: AI Converge

​RSVP Now to secure your spot in shaping the future of intelligent automation!

event_description:
​Ctrl+Vibe 3.0 : Hackathon for Founders, Builders & AI-Curious Minds

​Location: Bangalore (IRL only)

​After two high-energy editions that brought together 90+ builders, mentors from CRED, Google, and Adobe, and coverage in Deccan Herald, Ctrl+Vibe 3.0 returns for its biggest and boldest chapter yet -

​Hosting 200+ builders under one roof with immaculate vibes.

​This time, we're going deeper — across three curated tracks designed to fuel product thinking, AI-native experimentation, and real outcomes like funding, visibility, and community.

​Track 1 - Founding Teams

​For early-stage startup teams (max 4 each) seeking mentorship, validation, and access to capital. Startups showcase demos and pitch to top VC funds and incubators. Focus Sectors - Deep Tech, Climate Tech, AI, Health Tech, Consumer Tech and Enterprise SaaS

​Registration Fee: Rs. 500 (per participant)
Judging Criteria: Problem Statement, Use Case, Business Model
Outcome: Rolling demos to investors, access to grants and pre-seed interest

​Track 2 - Tech Builders

​For tech-native hackers with a track record of building and shipping (max 3 participants each team). Submit your idea and team names during application - we screen, shortlist, and let you build.

​Registration Fee: Rs. 200 (per participant)
Judging Criteria: Technical Depth, Functionality, Go-live Readiness
Outcome: Rs. 30,000 cash prize + exclusive merch and bragging rights

​Track 3 - AI Curious

​For solo creators with curiosity and taste. We pair individuals into teams of 3 based on skillsets (design, content, code), introduce you in advance, and kick things off with a hands-on AI workshop.

​Registration Fee: Rs. 100 (per participant)
Judging Criteria: Tastefulness, Originality, Team Synergy
Outcome: Rs. 20,000 cash prize + exclusive merch and vibe rep

​Event Format

​Day 1 — Saturday

event_name: AI-Powered Design: Friend or Foe?
event_summary: Explore the ethical and creative implications of AI in design at "AI-Powered Design: Friend or Foe?" on August 2nd in Bengaluru.  This in-person talk examines AI's role as collaborator or tool, addressing authorship, bias, and the future of design.  Perfect for designers, creatives, and anyone interested in the intersection of AI and art.
full_address: Lollypop - UI/UX Design Studio Bangalore, No. 69, Besides DHL Express, KMJ Atelier, Hosur Rd, Muneswara Nagar, Roopena Agrahara, Bommanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560068, India
presented_by_name: Unwrapped - A meetup series by Designathon
event_description:
​Topic: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
​AI-POWERED DESIGN: Friend or Foe? 

​Let’s face it—AI is everywhere. It drafts, iterates, critiques… But can it feel?

​Now is the time to ask the big questions: Who’s really designing, and for whom? This talk unwraps the power and pitfalls of AI-assisted creativity, from eroded authorship to amplified bias. Is AI a true collaborator or just a clever mirror? Let’s go beyond the tool and interrogate the intent and what happens when machines start designing with us.

​Event Details:

​Date: 02nd Aug 2025
Time: 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM
Location: Lollypop Design Studio, Bengaluru
Type: In-person Event
Total Attendees: 80

​Registration Fee:

​From 4th-10th July, Early bird registration @ Rs. 399
From 11th onwards, Regular registration @ Rs. 499

​FIRST COME-FIRST SERVE BASIS, REGISTER RIGHT AWAY!!

event_summary: The AI Robotics India Summit 2025 (October 4th) is India's premier AI and robotics conference, uniting industry leaders, policymakers, and innovators to accelerate India's position as a global AI powerhouse.  Key highlights include networking opportunities, deep-tech showcases, policy discussions, and insights into generative AI, autonomous mobility, and responsible AI development.  This event is ideal for AI/robotics startups, researchers, government officials, investors, and engineers.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​Driving the Future of Intelligence & Automation in India
​India's Premier AI & Robotics Conference — 4 Oct 2025

​

​India’s premier conference on Artificial Intelligence & Robotics, bringing together the brightest minds, leading companies, policymakers, and builders from across the nation and beyond.

​This one-day summit aims to position India as a global innovation powerhouse in AI-augmented robotics.

​Join us for the AI Robotics India Summit 2025, where innovators, researchers, and industry leaders come together to shape the future of automation and AI-driven robotics.

​

​Why Attend?

​National-level AI + Robotics collaboration

​High-level networking with decision-makers

​Policy-driven insights into India’s AI future

​Deeptech startup showcases & pilot launchpads

​Exposure to global media & investors

​

​Key Themes

​Generative AI in Robotics

​AI for Defense & Autonomous Mobility

​Robotics in Smart Manufacturing

​Responsible & Ethical AI

​LLMs x Hardware Integration

​Policy & Governance for AI Systems

​

​Who Will Be There

​Robotics Startups & AI Founders

​Government Tech Policy Makers

​VCs, Corporate Innovation Teams

​Research Labs & Universities

​Product Engineers & Builders

​

​Unlock Big Opportunities for You

​Speaker Opportunities

​Apply to be a speaker at the forefront of AI & robotics innovation.
Speaker Form

​Sponsorship Opportunities - We are looking for event sponsors and venue sponsors to partner with us on our AI series. Get in touch with us.

​Showcase your brand, launch products, or hire AI talent at the summit.
Sponsor Form

​

​Why You Should Join Us

​The AI Robotics India Summit 2025 is not just another tech event — it’s a high-impact gathering designed to spark innovation, collaboration, and transformative change. Here’s why you can’t afford to miss it:

​Network with Visionaries: Connect with global AI and robotics leaders, entrepreneurs, engineers, investors, and decision-makers shaping the future of technology.

​Real-World Insights: Learn from experts solving real problems across healthcare, fintech, education, infrastructure, defense, and beyond.

​Exclusive Access: Get firsthand exposure to frontier technologies, cutting-edge product demos, and live AI experiments.

​Career and Business Growth: Whether you're a startup founder, tech leader, researcher, or student — this summit opens new doors for growth, funding, partnerships, and talent discovery.

​Policy & Ethics Dialogue: Join key discussions around the future of AI governance, regulation, and responsible development in India and globally.

​Be Part of History: Play a role in shaping India’s AI and robotics revolution. Your presence contributes to building an ecosystem that impacts millions.

​

​What to Expect

​At the AI Robotics India Summit 2025, expect more than just talks. Expect transformation. Here's what's waiting for you:

​Keynote Sessions by global AI & robotics pioneers, policy leaders, and tech CEOs

​Networking Lounges to connect with investors, startups, corporates & researchers

​Live Demos & Product Showcases of the latest in robotics, AGI, computer vision, and generative AI

​Workshops & Masterclasses led by top minds in AI/ML, robotics, deep learning, ethics, and regulation

​Startup Spotlights featuring India’s most promising AI & robotics ventures

​Tech Collage Wall with video clips, art, and visual stories from the frontier of innovation

​Hiring Zone & Collaboration Hubs for talent discovery and project partnerships

​Global Participation from innovators in Silicon Valley, Tokyo, Bengaluru, London, and beyond

​

​

​We are honoured to present full-fledged sessions from our distinguished speakers at the AI Robotics India Summit 2025.

​

​

​​Join Us in Shaping Tomorrow

​​🎟️ Tickets & Pricing

​​Early Bird: INR 3000

​​Limited seats available. Secure your spot early for the best value.

​​Our deliberately limited capacity ensures genuine conversations and meaningful relationships. This is not just another tech event—it is a carefully curated community of minds shaping our collective future.

​​Secure your place today - before someone else claims your seat at the table of tomorrow.

​

​​Note : Approved attendees are required to present QR codes at the entrance, only approved guests will be allowed to enter through the building check in system.

​

event_name: Databricks DevConnect | Bengaluru, IN
event_summary: Databricks DevConnect Bengaluru (Oct 16th) offers data engineers an immersive evening of technical sessions on Databricks' latest advancements in data engineering, AI, and analytics, including Unity Catalog and Databricks Assistant.  Attendees will learn from experts, network with peers, and receive exclusive content & swag.  Ideal for data engineers of all levels seeking to enhance their skills and explore the Databricks platform.
full_address: Databricks India Pvt Ltd, XPP3+VFV, Ashraya Layout, Garudachar Palya, Mahadevapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560048, India
event_description:
​🔊🌟 Calling all data engineers🌟🔊
​​Join us for Databricks DevConnect on Thursday, October 16 from 5:00pm - 9:00pm IST at the Databricks Bengaluru office!

​Databricks DevConnect is a technical meetup designed for data engineers to experience an immersive evening of insights, collaborative learning, and community – hosted by the Databricks Developer Relations team. Bringing together data enthusiasts and innovators, we’ll explore the latest advancements in Databricks data engineering, AI, and analytics. You’ll have the chance to dive deep into technical discussions, share real-world experiences, and discover new ways to leverage Databricks’s technologies. Whether you’re a seasoned data engineer or just starting your journey, this event is designed to spark creativity and foster growth in our community. Let’s connect, learn, and push the boundaries of what’s possible with data – together!

​​Why You Can't Miss This Event:

​​🔓 Unlock the Power of Databricks: Discover how our unified platform can power your data engineering and AI initiatives.

​​🧠 Learn from Experts:  Gain actionable insights from Databricks Engineers, Product Managers, DevRel, and MVPs.

​​💻 Engaging Technical Sessions: Deepen technical expertise through interactive demos of the Databricks platform, and tools.

​​🤝 Network with the Community: Connect and build relationships with peers, MVPs, Databricks product managers, developer advocates, and engineers.

​👕 Access to exclusive content and goodies: Swag will be raffled off throughout the event and attendees will get access to hands-on training and guided labs through Databricks Academy Labs post event!

​​AGENDA

​​5:00 PM: Registration & Mingling 

​6:00 PM: Welcome Remarks by:

​​Holly Smith, Staff Developer Advocate

​​6:15 PM ➡️ Session #1: The Unified Lakehouse: Format Interoperability and transparent Governance with Unity Catalog

​​6:45 PM ➡️ Session #2: End-to-End Development with Databricks Assistant: From Data Discovery to Production

​7:15 PM ➡️ Session #3: Turning the Tables on Tuning your Tables

​​7:55 PM: Closing Remarks by:

​​8:00 PM: Networking Reception

​​9:00 PM: Good night

​​SESSION DESCRIPTIONS

​​The Unified Lakehouse: Format Interoperability and transparent Governance with Unity Catalog: This technical session demonstrates how Databricks' Unity Catalog simplifies data integration and governance across the lakehouse, regardless of data format. Learn how Unity Catalog enables seamless connectivity to diverse data sources, providing full format interoperability, while empowering data engineers to implement robust governance and security measures. We will delve into leveraging open standards for data management, implementing fine-grained access controls, utilizing advanced lineage tracking, and establishing secure collaboration workflows. Discover how to manage data assets effectively, ensure compliance with data regulations, and architect a well-governed, secure lakehouse that fosters innovation and maintains data integrity.

​​End-to-End Development with Databricks Assistant: From Data Discovery to Production: In this technical deep dive, we’ll explore how developers can leverage the Databricks Assistant to streamline workflows across the entire development lifecycle—from data discovery to production deployment. Learn how AI-powered features like Catalog Explorer integration simplify schema exploration and metadata retrieval, while SQL optimization tools help refine query performance. We’ll also showcase new capabilities for diagnosing job errors and troubleshooting DLT pipelines, enabling faster debugging and issue resolution in Python-based workflows. Whether you're authoring SQL queries, troubleshooting Python scripts, or debugging production workflows, discover how the Databricks Assistant accelerates development and enhances operational efficiency.

​Turning the Tables on Tuning your Tables: Traditionally, data engineers spend a lot of time on tuning their tables together with their workloads. Picking partition keys. Choosing whether to use ZORDER or partitioning. Scheduling OPTIMIZE and VACUUM. Planning your schedules carefully to avoid concurrent writes and OPTIMIZES... This talk is about how the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform takes all of those worries out of your hands, so that you can focus on your real job. You'll learn about a number of innovations that combine to make your life easier, including Liquid Clustering, Row-Level Concurrency, and Predictive Optimization. Using these features, you can forget about all that manual tuning and get back to the business at hand!

​​SPEAKERS

​​Holly Smith, Staff Developer Advocate​

event_name: Think Like Water
event_summary: "Think Like Water" is a playful, collaborative workshop prototyping a board game to raise water-positivity awareness, a pre-event to SusCrunch 2025.  Ideal for sustainability enthusiasts, game lovers, and those seeking collaborative climate action, it blends creative brainstorming with impactful community building.
event_description:
​Join us for Think Like Water—a hands-on, minds-open gathering where we explore the intersections of water, community, and climate action through the unexpected power of play.

​Together, we’ll play games and co-create the early prototype of a water-positivity board game designed to spark real-world awareness and conversation.

​Expect a warm, welcoming space for creative brainstorming, meaningful dialogue, and of course, snacks to keep the ideas flowing.

​If you care about sustainability, collaboration, or just love a good game night—this one’s for you.

​Let’s play like the planet depends on it. Because in many ways, it does.

​This is a side event hosted by FluxGen Sustainable Technologies leading up to SusCrunch 2025 held by The Sustainability Mafia.

​The Sustainability Mafia is India’s premier founder-led climate community, bringing together entrepreneurs, investors, corporates, and ecosystem builders to turn climate ambition into scalable impact. Through high-trust introductions, actionable insights, and collaborative celebrations—no panels, no posturing—we unite doers to tackle the nation’s toughest sustainability challenges.

​SusCrunch 2025 is The Sustainability Mafia’s one-day flagship summit (July 19, 2025 | Bengaluru) designed to break through the noise and unblock climate action. From high-energy networking and problem–solving “Builder Rooms” to the SusVentures Pitch Finale and sector-specific zones, SusCrunch brings 400+ curated founders, investors, corporate leaders, and enablers together for connection, collaboration, and celebration—so that ideas become pilots, pilots become scale, and scale becomes real impact.

event_name: 🌍 Where Climate Meets Deep Tech — And You Fit Right In 🚀
event_summary: This invite-only event connects senior business professionals with India's booming climate-deep tech startups.  Attendees will network with founders and leaders, learning about career pathways and impact opportunities in sectors like biotech and renewable energy.  Ideal for sales, marketing, and operations leaders seeking high-growth roles in mission-driven companies.
event_description:
​About

​India's climate and deep-tech sectors are booming, but they need seasoned business leaders to drive growth. This event is for senior professionals in sales, commercial, and operator roles who are ready to make a real-world impact.

​Join us for an evening of casual conversations with founders and leaders who have successfully made the leap. Learn how your skills are directly transferable to high-growth areas like biotech, alternative foods, energy, mobility, etc. 

​SPEAKERS TO BE REVEALED SOON! :)

​Why attend?

​Discover the real career pathways at the climate–deep tech nexus

​Learn from operators who've made the leap into climate and impact-driven startups

​Meet mission-driven founders in need of your skills & scale experience

​Curated for

​Business professionals (Sales, Marketing, GTM) keen to know more about climate-tech

​Seasoned leaders from industrial backgrounds and with an itch to build from scratch

​Founders seeking operator-allies for rapid growth

​Agenda

​6-6:30pm : Anchor speakers sharing their stories

​6:30-7pm : Rapid fire introductions of all participants

​7-8pm: Casual networking over snacks and drinks

​This is an invite-only event with limited seats. Please register to share your interest.

​🎤 Our Hosts

​​​Beyond Next Ventures is an early-stage deep-tech venture capital firm with presence in Japan and India. We are driven by our mission to enable exceptional entrepreneurs solving global challenges for healthier populace and a happier planet. Founded in 2014, we made over 80 investments across both countries. ​​With a portfolio of 16 companies in India, we typically lead investments in seed and pre-series A stage deep-tech startups. Our primary focus areas include healthcare, sustainability, and digital infrastructure.

​Euforbia is a boutique search firm building for Climate in India. We specialize in hiring leadership teams for post PMF firms, helping accelerate our Planet’s transition to net zero.

​The Sustainability Mafia (SusMafia) is a founder-led nonprofit catalyzing India’s climate innovation ecosystem. They work across startups, universities, corporates, and capital providers to accelerate meaningful climate action — through programs like SusVentures, Mafioso, Climate Ninja, and our flagship convening, SusCrunch.

​This is a side event for SusCrunch 2025.

​SusCrunch is India's boldest climate collaboration summit - where climate founders, investors, and corporates gather to forge partnerships and scale climate solutions — with the spirit of a festival.

​LIFE CENTRIC DESIGN

​Designing not for "users," but for humans.

​This session dives into what it really means to design for real lives: messy, vibrant, unpredictable lives rooted by culture, context, and daily needs, especially in emerging markets. ​​​​Previously, I’ve also worked full-time with brands like JioSaavn and Impresario Entertainment & Hospitality.

​​​​I’m super excited for this.

​​​​See you soon. ;)

event_name: Mastering Agent Memory with Checkpointers — Workshop
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Master Agent Memory with Checkpointers" is a 2-hour hands-on workshop where you'll learn to build a reliable "brain" for your LangGraph agent, enabling it to remember and learn from past interactions. Led by expert Anil Dukkipatty, you'll gain practical patterns to fix the "forgetting" problem and leave with a starter repo to integrate into your workflow. Ideal for Lang
full_address: BHIVE Premium HSR Campus, BHIVE Workspace - No.112, AKR Tech Park, "A" and "B" Block, 7th Mile Hosur Rd, Kudlu Gate, Krishna Reddy Industrial Area, Hosapalaya, Muneshwara Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560068, India
event_description:
​2-Hour Build: AI Agent Memory

​We’re hacking on agent memory this week.

​LangGraph is powerful, but agents forget everything between runs unless you wire up memory. In this session, we’ll give your agent a reliable “brain” that survives restarts, rolls back mistakes, and branches into parallel strategies. All built live, in the same room.

​→ Who’s this for?

​Anyone building with LangGraph (or planning to) who’s run into the “why does my agent forget?” problem and wants hands-on patterns to fix it.

​In these 2 hours, you will:

​Understand the core memory patterns behind stateful LangGraph agents.

​Learn by building: we’ll wire up a checkpointer, branch three what-ifs, and merge results.

​Leave with a clean starter repo you can drop into your own workflow.

​→ What we’ll hack on (together)

​Persist – plug in a checkpointer and make memory stick.

​Rewind & diff – trace an agent’s reasoning, tweak, and replay.

​Branch & merge – test multiple paths, keep the best one.

​Hot-migrate – evolve schemas without downtime.

​Compact – keep storage tidy and costs low.

​→ What to bring

​Your laptop. This is hands-on. We’ll demo with Convo SDK as the checkpointer, but the concepts are tool-agnostic.

​→ Host

​Anil Dukkipatty: Has worked with 800+ developers on agent memory and LangGraph workflows.

​→ Venue Partner

​
B-Hive - powering conversations that build the future of AI.

​→ Built by Builders, Backed by the Best

​​We’ve hosted engineers, founders, and researchers from some of the world’s most forward-thinking companies. Here’s a look at who’s been in the room.

event_name: Applied AI Bootcamp: Architecting Production Ready Systems
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join the Applied AI Bootcamp, an exclusive in-person event where industry experts share lessons learned from building and deploying production-ready AI systems. Discover how to choose the right tools and techniques that scale, and the importance of evaluations in ensuring reliability and performance. This free event is ideal for CXOs, Principal Engineers, and others involved in building AI-powered systems.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​Sessions

​9.00 AM - 10 AM - Introductions and Snacks

​10 AM - 11:30 AM - Autogen - Lessons from building AI agent that acts as your personal data scientist.

​11:45 AM - 1:30 PM - DSPy - Stop raw prompting, operate at a higher abstraction. How DSPy helped build a reliable AI software that extracted insights from real estate call centre audio calls.

​1:30 PM - 2.30 PM - Lunch

​2:30 PM to 3:30 PM - Evals - Why and How?.

​3:30 PM to 4.00 PM - Lessons from building RAGs - What not to do?.

​4:00 PM to 4:30 PM - Networking and Chit Chat.

​The idea for this in-person event took root within a close-knit group of CXOs and Principal Engineers—peers who have worked together or crossed paths while building AI-powered systems. What brought them together? A shared realization: building AI prototypes is relatively easy, but delivering high-accuracy, reliable AI systems in production is a whole different challenge—and one that often takes far more time than it should.

​Through their collective experience, two themes consistently emerged:

​Choosing the right tools, frameworks, and techniques that actually scale in real-world environments.

​The critical role of evaluations (Evals)—not just basic testing, but deep, extensive, and ongoing evaluation to ensure reliability and performance.

​This in-person event is an opportunity to learn directly from individuals who’ve done the hard part—putting AI applications into production. There are just 15 open seats, and it's completely free to attend. Event organiser reserve the right to decide on the invitation.

Welcome to the Aya AI Hackathon, your opportunity to develop tools and MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers for AI agents, enabling them to create & bundle transactions and interact with DeFi tools on any blockchain or any other applications, such as booking a flight on booking.com. Whether coding solo or teaming up with others, this hackathon is about pushing the boundaries of crypto, AI, and decentralized finance.

​Context :

​Aya is the first crypto mobile wallet with an integrated AI agent, relying on various tools and APIs to assist users with their crypto day-to-day needs. The Aya Hackathon series opens the door for programmers to create tools that will be accessible to the entire Aya user base, enabling teams to develop products and, ultimately, startups that will be promoted within the open Aya ecosystem.

​What You’ll Work On :

​MCPs + DeFi Automation: Develop Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools and AI services that perform DeFi operations across various blockchains.

​What You’ll Get :

​Free AI Compute: Aethir and Comput3 provide free AI computing power to supercharge your projects.

​Multiple Cash Prizes: Aya, Aethir, and other partner protocols/chains will offer dedicated prize pools. Follow our channels for announcements of our Partners starting next week!

​Integration Rewards: If your project is accepted for integration into Aya AI-powered wallet, you’ll receive a $1,000 prize in tokens (up to 20 projects!).

​VC Exposure: A panel of VCs will be there to meet you, and you’ll get the chance to pitch your solution for potential seed funding. You’ll also be introduced to the VCs’ portfolio companies. Follow our channels for announcements of our VC partners starting next week!

​Jobs & Internships: Partners and other companies will be looking for talent and attending the hackathon in hopes of finding top engineers.

​Cool Merchandise: Grab some unique hackathon merch to show off your hard work.

​Stay Connected :

Vibe-coded Website: https://hackathon.aya.cash

​Join our Telegram channel: https://t.me/+2I9XHv4ODYM0Mzdi

​We look forward to seeing what you create. Let’s build the next generation of AI-driven crypto solutions together—and maybe even launch your startup in the process!

​If you've ever caught yourself saying "I wish someone had built this already" — this is your moment to stop waiting and start building.

​This event is for anyone who’s ever felt the itch to solve a real problem — one from your daily life, your workflow, or your wishlist. Whether you’re a Python dev, a Zapier tinkerer, or just someone curious about what’s possible with AI today, you’ll leave this event having built something real.

​We’re moving beyond toy demos and chatbot tricks. This sprint is about building full AI-powered workflows, tools, and agents — the kind that actually make life easier, faster, or more efficient.

​You don’t need to be a technical expert. You just need an idea and the willingness to build. We’ll help you connect the dots.

​🧠 What To Expect

​This isn’t another talk or panel. It’s a hands-on build-a-thon.

​Come with a problem you care about. Leave with a working prototype.

​Learn the tools: We'll walk you through powerful no-code/low-code platforms like Lovable, and how to go from scratch to AI agent in minutes.

​Get expert help: Mentors from NTT Data AI and experienced AI automation pros will be there to guide you and unblock you.

​Build fast: You'll have access to free API credits through our partnership with AI Grants India.

​Demo your work: Share what you built, see what others did, and get inspired.

​We don't believe in FOMO. If this sounds like fun to you, drop by!

​See you there 👀

​Agenda (3:00 PM - 6:00 PM)

​2:30 PM: Doors Open & Networking

​3:00 PM: Kick-off: The Challenge & Tool Deep Dive

​3:20 PM: Build Sprint Begins! (Hacking, Building, Creating)

​5:20 PM: Demos & Presentations: Show Us What You Built!

​5:50 PM: Wrap-up and Networking Spill-over!

​Location: Leap Scholars Corporate Office; HSR Layout | https://maps.app.goo.gl/9YNgdL9v6KKcck2YA?g_st=ipc

​Additionally, we are looking for sponsors to help us fuel our amazing builders and support the community. Please send sponsorship inquiries to samridhijain019@gmail.com

​Please be advised: Unfortunately, space is very limited at these community events and we cannot always accept everyone we would like to. If you are not accepted to this event, please keep applying! We appreciate your application tremendously and we are looking forward to seeing you at a future event very soon!

​The AI Collective is a global non-profit community uniting 70,000+ pioneers – founders, researchers, operators, and investors – exploring the frontier of AI in major tech hubs worldwide. Through events, workshops, and community-led research, we empower the AI ecosystem to collaboratively steer AI’s future toward trust, openness, and human flourishing.

​All attendees and organizers at events affiliated with The AI Collective are subject to our Code of Conduct.

event_name: From Imitation to Intelligence: Lessons from Autonomous Driving to Humanoids
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join Srikanth Vidapanakal, Founder & CEO of xSpecies AI, as he shares insights on how autonomous driving breakthroughs can inform the development of whole-body intelligent humanoids. Learn about the evolution of learning algorithms, from imitation to reinforcement, and how they can be applied to robots with arms and legs. This event is ideal for those interested in AI, robotics, and autonomous systems.
full_address: Together Fund, XJFV+F4V, 3rd Cross Rd, HAL 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India
event_description:
​What does it take to move from teaching cars to drive themselves to enabling robots that can walk, manipulate objects and reason about the world?

Join Srikanth Vidapanakal — Founder & CEO, xSpecies AI & ex‑Director of AI, Ola Electric for a deep‑dive into the algorithms, architectures and hard‑won lessons that connect today’s autonomous‑driving breakthroughs with tomorrow’s whole‑body intelligent humanoids.

🔍 What we’ll cover

​Evolution of Learning: why imitation, self‑supervision and reinforcement each matter at different stages of capability building.

​Part I – Autonomous Driving

​See how self‑driving moved from separate modules to one big “camera‑to‑steering” neural network, using bird’s‑eye‑view transformers and attention tricks for perception and control.

​We’ll also cover easy‑to‑grasp reinforcement‑learning tweaks that make cars drive safely in messy real‑world traffic.

​Part II – Humanoids & Whole‑Body Intelligence

​We’ll apply those learning ideas to robots with arms and legs, treating walking, grabbing and navigating as one combined problem.

​You’ll hear how imitation learning plus smart reward rules (like “stay balanced” and “repeat steps”) train robots to move smoothly and work with humans.

​👤 About the speaker

​Srikanth Vidapanakal is a seasoned technologist with 24+ years of experience & he most recently served as Director of AI at Ola Electric before founding xSpecies AI, a Bangalore‑based startup building a full‑stack platform for general‑purpose humanoids.

event_name: LAN-33: Growing Brands on Instagram (For Marketers)
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join LAN-33, a meetup for serious marketers, to dive into growing brands on Instagram through real use cases, open conversations, and sharp tactics. Discuss key topics like brand growth, content strategy, and optimization with peers who are actively working on Instagram brand growth. This event is ideal for marketers with 2+ years of experience, in-house or building their own brand, looking to share, dissect, and
event_description:
​In the 33rd Meetup of LAN, we’re diving into a platform that every marketer has both loved and cursed at some point — Instagram.

​This isn’t about hacks, reels for the sake of reels, or hashtag voodoo.

​This is where serious marketers who are genuinely growing brands on Instagram come together to share what’s working, what’s changed, and what still drives attention, affinity, and action.

​And like every LAN meetup — no fluff, no stage preaching, just real use cases, open conversations, and sharp tactics.

​What’s the Scene?

​📌 Key Topics in Discussion Groups:

​How are you growing your brand on Instagram in 2025?

​What’s actually converting — reels, carousels, memes, or something else?

​Is Instagram still relevant for B2B? If yes, how are you making it work?

​Are you optimizing for followers, engagement, or conversions — and what’s the tradeoff?

​How do you balance trend-chasing vs. brand voice?

​Tools and workflows that are saving time (and sanity)

​What’s not working anymore?

​You’ll also tell us in advance what you want to deep dive into — and we’ll organize the group discussions accordingly.

​First Half

​We’ll break into smaller sub-groups to dissect what it takes to grow a brand on Instagram — consistently, creatively, and strategically.

​This part is:

​🔍 Discussion-heavy
🤝 Peer-led
📊 Strategy-rich

​Second Half

​Show & Tell: Some of you will walk us through your content strategy, post performance, creative workflows, or campaign results (only if you opt in).
Free-flow Networking: Connect with others who obsess over audience building, creators, growth loops, or social storytelling.

​Format

​Real-time breakout discussions

​Peer-led breakdowns and strategy swaps

​No-stage, no-sales networking

​Who is this for?

​You must be a marketer actively working on Instagram brand growth, either:

​In-house at a brand (B2C, D2C, or B2B)

​Or building your own brand or content-led project

​With 2+ years of marketing experience

​This is not for:

​Folks just exploring Instagram without active work

​Paid media-only roles who don’t touch content

​Anyone looking for Insta-101 tips - this is for operators, not observers

​You should be excited to share, dissect, and collaborate.

​Why are we doing this?

​Because growing a brand on Instagram has changed dramatically — and continues to.
And in that chaos, the best answers don’t live in a YouTube tutorial or Twitter thread.

​They live with the people doing it, testing it, and iterating on it - just like you.

​📚 Learning from each other > learning alone
🎯 Execution beats theory
🤝 When smart people collide, momentum follows

​Big thanks to our Coworking Partner - BHIVE

​For making these meetups possible.

​What’s LAN?

​Local Area Network (LAN) is one of the most active, high-signal communities of experienced marketers in Bangalore.

​👥 1000+ members | 7 years avg. experience
📍 Based in HSR, Indiranagar, Koramangala
💬 90%+ queries in the community get solved
📬 80% read rate | 0.5% attrition | 20%+ referral rate

​Join LAN

​Previous Meetups

​AI in SEO & SEO in AI — Covered LLM overviews, AI content, and SEO tools with 40+ SEOs

​LAN Combat — Tactical marketing games, first-of-its-kind

​LAN x Smadex — App marketing roundtable at The Ritz Carlton

​LAN-30 — Deep dive into n8n, Make, Zapier & MarTech Automation

​What’s Your Channel? (LAN-32) — Unpacked B2B SaaS acquisition strategies across 10+ real channels

​​​“I have only three groups unmuted out of 100s. My family, my company, and LAN.”
— Sachin Jain (EY, 15+ years in marketing)

​​​“Six months into LAN and I already have 25+ marketers in my phonebook from here.”
— Himanshu Mehta, Ex-Head of Marketing, Beepkart

​See you at LAN-33?

​Let’s break down the Instagram beast — together.

event_name: Neurotech Futures Roundtable
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the Neurotech Futures Roundtable event:

The Neurotech Futures Roundtable is an in-person gathering that explores the complexities of building in the neurotech space, where mind, machine, and identity intersect. This event brings together experts from various fields to discuss the challenges and frontiers of neurotech, including BCIs, ethics, and productization, and to identify priority areas for growth. Targeted at neurotech founders, researchers
full_address: Nexstem, 4th floor, 19, KHB Colony, Koramangala 8th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560030, India
event_description:
​The Neurotech Community presents Neurotech Futures, a roundtable exploring what it means to build in a space where the lines between mind, machine, and identity are constantly being redrawn, and why neurotechnology isn’t just another industry.

​This in-person gathering is designed to create space for focused dialogue around what makes neurotech uniquely complex to build, from decoding thoughts and emotions to navigating regulatory grey zones and public trust. Whether you’re working on BCIs, biosignal systems, or embodied computing, the conversation blends philosophical provocations with real-world challenges in funding, productization, and ethical deployment.

Discussion Themes

​From Control to Identity: What happens when tech moves from "what you do" to "who you are"? Exploring the ethical, emotional, and existential edge of BCIs.

​Where Disciplines Collide: Neurotech sits at the intersection of neuroscience, engineering, AI, and ethics, how do we build when progress depends on advancing all at once?

​​Who Should Attend:
BCI & neurotech founders, Researchers in neuroscience, cognition, or HCI, Deeptech investors and product strategists, Policy thinkers, and ethics researchers

​Goals

​Unpack what’s uniquely hard and worth building in neurotech: From decoding cognition to redefining agency, explore the real challenges and frontiers in this domain.

​Enable deeper alignment across science, product, and philosophy: Bridge perspectives across research, engineering, and long-term societal implications.

​Identify priority areas for neurotech’s growth, connecting current technical work with its ethical, commercial, and human implications.

​📍 When & Where

​​📅 Date: 21st August, 2025

​​⏰ Time: 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM

​​📍 Venue: Nexstem HQ, 4th Floor, 19, KHB Colony, Koramangala 8th Block, Bengaluru

​​Register Now!

event_name: LLMs with a Worldview - Bring Your Own Agents!
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Join Attention After-Hours: Episode 2 to explore the future of Large Language Models (LLMs) with a worldview, where context is king. Learn from experts how to build AI that understands real-world signals, spatial context, and production challenges in image generation. Bring your own AI agent project to showcase and share your innovations with the community."
full_address: NR Trident Tech Park, 125, Hosur Rd, Muneswara Nagar, Sector 6, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560068, India
event_description:
​Attention After-Hours: Episode 2
​LLMs with a Worldview: When Context is King

​Welcome to Episode 2 of Attention After-Hours by Evam Labs. The last time around, we explored how you can build your own Agents.

​
This time, we explore how they understand—deeply, spatially, and in context.
From real-world signals to real production challenges in image generation, this one’s about building AI that gets it.

​Session 1

​Unlocking Real-World Intelligence: How We Built an LLM-Powered Search Engine That Understands Place

​Speakers: Vishaal, Mithul

​Most LLMs are stuck in the abstract…
But when you plug in real-world signals—mobility flows, satellite imagery, demographics, built environments—you get a model that doesn’t just generate text, it understands place, people, and movement.

​This session is your behind-the-scenes tour of Digital Atlas Search, our AI-native search engine that lets users explore the world by similarity. Search any city or neighborhood, and instantly discover places that feel just like it, based on the patterns that actually matter: how people move, how spaces are built, and who lives there.

​We’ll share how we trained geospatial embeddings using transformers, wired them into a global vector index, and built a responsive frontend that makes discovery intuitive.

​Session 2

​Pushing the limits of Image Generation - Learnings and Best Practices.

​Speakers: Akshit, Anand

​AI image models are getting better every month.
But can they deliver brand-safe, high-quality content at scale?

​Spoiler: not without a lot of trial, error, and GPU pain.

​This session is a no-BS download of what we’ve learned from building image generation pipelines across models and use cases. We’ll share which models actually deliver, when to fine-tune, how to debug hallucinations, and what to do when “high-res” turns into why-res.

​Session 3

​BYOA – Bring Your Own Agents

​Got something cool cooking with agents?
Built a demo that deserves the limelight?

​We're keeping 2 open slots for anyone brave (and brilliant) enough to showcase their AI side project.

​
Fill out the form. Show us what you've got.
If you make the cut, the mic is yours.

event_name: -1 To Ather Energy With Tarun Mehta
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join South Park Commons India for an exclusive chat with Tarun Mehta, co-founder and CEO of Ather Energy, as he shares his journey of building India's first smart electric scooter company from scratch. Learn about Ather's product innovations, infrastructure strategies, and cultural decisions that have driven its growth. This event is a must-attend for entrepreneurs, innovators, and anyone interested in India's EV revolution
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​South Park Commons India is excited to host Tarun Mehta as part of our -1 to Now series!

​Event Details
5:00 PM: Doors Open
5:30–6:30 PM: Chat with Tarun Mehta
6:30–7:00 PM: Networking

​Tarun Mehta is the co-founder and CEO of Ather Energy — the company behind India’s first truly smart electric scooter. What began as a battery R&D project at IIT Madras has grown into one of the country’s most ambitious EV companies, with a deep focus on in-house product design, localized manufacturing, and charging infrastructure.

​From the early days of building hardware in a hostel room to scaling nationwide with the Ather 450X and launching one of India’s largest two-wheeler charging networks, Tarun’s journey is a masterclass in first-principles thinking, long-term execution, and building for category creation.

​In this -1 to Now session at South Park Commons, Tarun will walk us through the big product bets, infrastructure plays, and cultural decisions that have powered Ather’s growth — and what it takes to build a hardware company in India.

​Registration and approval are required, and space is limited — please RSVP soon!

event_name: The Morning Finance Stroll Ep.3
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join "The Morning Finance Stroll" in Cubbon Park, Bengaluru, for a unique networking experience that combines high-value conversations, authentic connections, and wellness in a refreshing outdoor setting. Meet Bengaluru's top finance professionals, including investors, fintech builders, and market analysts, in a curated and casual environment. Ditch the boardroom and start your Sunday with a dose of inspiration and community.
full_address: Cubbon Park Metro Entrance (Park Side), XHJW+9QR, Cubbon Rd, Ambedkar Veedhi, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India
event_description:
​Tired of stuffy networking events and Zoom fatigue? Ready to connect with top finance professionals in a setting that actually inspires you?

​Welcome to The Morning Finance Stroll, the acclaimed "anti-conference" experience set against the beautiful green backdrop of Cubbon Park. We believe the best ideas and most valuable connections aren't made in a boardroom—they're discovered on a walk. This is your chance to ditch the terminals for the trees and start your Sunday with a dose of wellness, community, and high-signal conversation.

​What to Expect:

​🧠 High-Value Conversations: This is not a lecture. Engage in dynamic discussions on everything from investment theses and market trends to the future of fintech.

​🤝 Authentic Networking: We facilitate genuine connections that last. It's a curated crowd in a casual setting.

​☀️ A Refreshing Sunday Morning: Breathe the fresh air, get your steps in, and recharge your mind before the week begins. The walk lasts for approximately 3.5 hours.

​😎 Zero-Pressure Vibe: No name tags. No presentations. No awkward silences.

​Who You'll Meet: Join a curated group of Bengaluru's brightest investors, fintech builders, venture capitalists, sharp-witted CAs, and market analysts.

​

​Our Stroll Protocol (The T&Cs)

​

​This section can be part of your main description to showcase your event's personality.

​⚖️ Practice Good Governance: Be open, be ethical, be respectful. We have a zero-tolerance policy for bad assets (or bad attitudes).

​📊 Don't Break the Index: We walk as a balanced fund, not individual stocks. Mingle and chat, but try to stick loosely with the main group.

​♻️ Leave No Liabilities: The only thing we're leaving behind are outdated market theories, not trash.

​🎒 Asset Allocation: Your core assets are comfortable shoes. Your liquidity is a water bottle. A flask of coffee is your optional speculative play.

​Don't miss this tranche. We look forward to seeing you there! 🚀

event_name: Lakehouse Days: Bengaluru
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join e6data's Lakehouse Days in Bengaluru, a hands-on meetup for data infrastructure enthusiasts, featuring expert talks on building high-performance data systems. Learn about AI-powered text-to-SQL agents, vector databases, and optimized query techniques from industry leaders Bharath Harish and Harsh Sharma. Gain insights into large-scale recommendation systems and conversational data workflows.
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​Calling all lakehouse geeks! e6data is hosting a hands-on meetup in Bengaluru for folks who live and breathe data infrastructure. Our topic this time? Agents!!

​What’s on the menu?

​Strategies for handling large, messy schemas using semantic understanding, knowledge graph-driven relationship discovery, and SQL engine-like planning to avoid errors and hallucinations.

​Performance optimizations such as partition key usage, optimized CTEs, early predicate pushdowns, and efficient indexing/retrieval strategies.

​Transition from basic query-and-result to a conversational, context-aware workflow enriched with visualizations, summaries, and smart follow-up questions.

​Rationale for choosing a vector database (Milvus) over traditional methods, and its integration into the system.

​Benchmarks, challenges, and lessons learned from deploying large-scale, high-performance recommendation systems in e-commerce.

​Speakers:

Bharath Harish, Head of Product, e6data

Topic: How We Built Text-to-SQL AI Agents to 95%+ Accuracy for Enterprise Scale

Summary:
The talk will be on how to tackle large, messy schemas using semantic understanding without requiring perfect catalogs. Bharath will explain how knowledge graph-driven relationship discovery avoids join errors common in NL2SQL and how a SQL engine-like process reduces hallucinations through planning, data profiling, and accurate SQL generation. Bharath will also cover performance-aware techniques such as partition key usage, optimized CTEs, and early predicate pushdowns, and demonstrate how we move from simple query-and-result to a conversational, context-aware data-to-insight workflow with visualizations, summaries, and smart follow-up questions. 

Time: 10:00 - 11:15 AM IST

​Harsh Sharma, Software Engineer, Flipkart FCC

Topic: Building a recommendation system using Milvus, an open-source vector database

Summary:
The talk will cover why he chose a vector database over traditional approaches, how his team integrated Milvus into their system, and the indexing and retrieval strategies used for fast and accurate recommendations. Harsh will also share performance benchmarks, practical challenges, and lessons learned from deploying this system at scale for e-commerce use cases.

Time: 11:30 - 12:30 PM IST

event_name: Beyond Algorithms: Building Responsible AI
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Ideal for professionals seeking to integrate ethical and user-focused thinking
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
event_description:
​The Indian LegalTech Network (ILTN), in collaboration with August, presents an invite-only knowledge exchange - a carefully curated forum designed to spark meaningful, high-trust conversations on emerging technologies and their real-world impact.

​We’re bringing a thought-provoking session on the evolving landscape of Artificial Intelligence – exploring its growing influence on law, governance, innovation, and society at large. From cutting-edge use cases to the ethical questions they raise, we’ll look at the broader picture of AI today – with Responsible AI as a key lens, but not the only one.

​Join us for an in-person session featuring a deep-dive exploration of the ethical, legal, and social dimensions of Artificial Intelligence - followed by an open Ask Me Anything (AMA) with Deepak Paramanand, a seasoned expert with over two decades of experience across India, the UK, and the US. Deepak has been at the forefront of building AI-driven solutions, delivering innovation at the intersection of data, ethics, and impact.

​Expect a candid, technically grounded, and highly interactive conversation on:

​🧠 The broader shifts in AI and what they mean for law, regulation, and innovation
🧭 What “Responsible AI” looks like in practice - not just in principle
⚠️ The risks of uncritical adoption and unchecked deployment
📌 How to integrate ethical, legal, and user-focused thinking - regardless of your scale

This exclusive event features a fireside chat on AI in SaaS sales, live demos of disruptive AI tools, and networking opportunities with Bengaluru's top SaaS minds. Ideal for SaaS sales pros, founders, and AI enthusiasts looking to stay ahead of
full_address: Housr HSR 1, 1600, 20th Main Rd, Agara Village, 1st Sector, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102, India
event_description:
​Bengaluru- it’s your turn!

Kick SaaS LIVE – Bengaluru Edition
6th September 2025 | 1 PM – 5 PM | HSR Layout

​An afternoon designed for SaaS sales pros, founders, and AI enthusiasts to connect, learn, and share.

​Fireside Chat: AI in SaaS Sales- Real insights from industry leaders.

​SaaS in the Spot: Live demos of 2 disruptive AI tools you need to know.

​Networking Over Drinks: Meet the right people, swap ideas, and build connections that last.

​Secure your spot now.

Let’s Kick SaaS in Bengaluru.

event_name: AgentsNexus India 2025
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the AgentsNexus India 2025 event:

Join India's flagship conference on Agentic AI in Bengaluru this September, where developers, researchers, and tech leaders will gather to explore the future of autonomous software. Experience live demos, interactive showcases, and keynote sessions on agentic applications, orchestration frameworks, and AI-powered tools. Builders, engineers, researchers, and students in AI/ML are invited to connect, learn
full_address: Bengaluru, Karnataka
event_description:
​Step into the future of software at India’s flagship conference on Agentic AI, right in the heart of Bengaluru!

​This September, join a vibrant gathering of developers, researchers, and technology leaders for an immersive experience dedicated to the next wave of AI-powered, autonomous systems. AgentsNexus India 2025 is your gateway to the forefront of agentic applications, orchestration frameworks, and the tools redefining intelligent software 🤖

​Why Attend?

​Discover: Dive deep into the frameworks, tools, and workflows that are making software truly intelligent. From multi-agent orchestration to real-world deployment stories, see how theory becomes reality.


​Experience: Watch autonomous systems in action. Live demos, interactive showcases, and case-studies that put the power of agentic AI right at your fingertips.


​Connect: This is where India's AI agent community comes together. Meet the founders building the tools you'll use tomorrow, the researchers pushing boundaries today, and the developers solving problems you didn't even know existed.

​Who Should Join?

​Builders of agentic applications and orchestration frameworks

​AI/ML engineers, researchers, founders, and students

​Anyone curious about the transformative power of AI agents

​What Awaits You?

​Keynote Sessions: Visionary talks from global and Indian AI leaders

​Networking: Dedicated spaces and events to foster meaningful connections

​Showcase: Demos of innovative projects and tools pushing the boundaries of what’s possible

​Let’s shape the future of autonomous software—together.

​Stay tuned: Full agenda and speaker lineup will be announced soon!

event_name: Building Revenue Engines: AI GTM Masterclass
event_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the event:

Join Arjun Pillai, a seasoned entrepreneur with multiple exits, for an intimate, founder-only roundtable in Bengaluru to discuss building scalable go-to-market engines in the age of AI. Expect tactical insights, war stories, and proven frameworks to overcome GTM challenges, with a unique opportunity to learn from fellow founders. Limited to 15 participants, this interactive conversation is ideal for founders looking to take their GTM strategy to the next
event_description:
​How do you design a go-to-market engine that not only scales, but keeps scaling in the age of AI?

​Join Arjun Pillai, Co-founder & CEO of Docket, for a candid, founder-only roundtable in Bengaluru. Arjun has built and exited two companies - a Sales Intelligence platform with 110,000+ users (acquired by FullContact) and Insent.ai in Conversational Marketing & Sales (acquired by ZoomInfo) - and has served as Chief Data Officer & EVP of Products at ZoomInfo. Now, with a $15M Series A for Docket, he’s building his third venture.

​This isn’t a keynote or a panel - it’s an interactive conversation where you can bring your toughest GTM challenges. Expect tactical insights, war stories, and proven frameworks you can apply immediately, plus the chance to learn from fellow founders in the room.

​📅 Date: Thursday, August 21, 2025
🕔 Time: 5:00 PM – 7:30 PM
📍 Location: Bengaluru
🔒 Max: 15 participants

​If you’re building the next stage of your GTM engine, this is the room you’ll want to be in.

event_name: THE STARTUP STORIES BY BENGALURU ENTREPRENEURS
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

Join "Startup Stories by Bengaluru Entrepreneurs" for an inspiring evening of real startup journeys, interactive discussions, and meaningful connections. Hear stories of hustle, challenges, and breakthroughs from passionate entrepreneurs, and explore opportunities to collaborate and grow with like-minded individuals. Ideal for startup enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, and innovators looking to learn, connect, and get inspired.
full_address: MIDAS School of Entrepreneurship Bengaluru, 10, Seshadripuram Main Rd, Jai Bheema Nagar, Seshadripuram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560020, India
event_description:
​Get ready for an exciting evening with Startup Stories by Bengaluru Entrepreneurs. An event where ideas, inspiration, and meaningful connections come together in a supportive community

​​This isn’t just another gathering. It’s a space where passionate minds come together to share real startup journeys stories of hustle, challenges, and breakthroughs. Each story is packed with insights and experiences that can spark fresh ideas and new ways of thinking.

​​But it’s more than just listening. This event is all about interaction! Meet people who share your energy and drive, exchange ideas, and explore opportunities to collaborate. Whether you’re here to learn, connect, or simply get inspired, you’ll walk away with something valuable.

​​Discover what makes startups tick, hear about the highs and lows, and connect with a network of individuals who are shaping Bengaluru’s startup ecosystem. It’s an evening of stories that will leave you motivated, energized, and ready to take your ideas to the next level.

​​Let’s connect, explore, network and grow together in a supportive and dynamic community.

​​​​If you have any queries regarding the event, please feel free to reach out to us.

​​​​Akash Akku - 7259894114 / 6362850039

​​​For more info & updates about Bengaluru Events & Meetups, join our Community Group 👇

event_name: THE STARTUP FOUNDRY BY CEDAT & IKP EDEN
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"The Startup Foundry" is an interactive meetup where entrepreneurs and innovators come together to shape and grow their ideas through meaningful connections and collaborations. This event offers a unique opportunity to connect with mentors, investors, and experts, and is open to anyone with an open mind, regardless of business plan or idea stage.
full_address: IKP EDEN, Bhuvanappa Layout, 16, Tavarekere Main Rd, Tavarekere, Kaveri Layout, S.G. Palya, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560029, India
event_description:
​The Startup Foundry is where ideas don’t just get shared — they get shaped.

​It’s a place where ideas grow through real conversations, meaningful connections, and new collaborations. In this event, you’ll meet new people, hear real stories, and connect with others who believe in building something valuable.

​We believe great ideas don’t need a stage — they need the right people around them. That’s why this event is about sitting together, talking openly, and helping each other move forward. You don’t need a big idea or a business plan — just come with an open mind.

​This meetup also gives you the chance to connect with mentors, investors, and experts who can support your journey. When people come together, great things happen — ideas grow, teams are formed, and startups move ahead.

event_name: STARTUP WORLD CUP - 2025
event_summary:
Here is a concise 2-3 line summary of the event:

"Join the Startup World Cup 2025 in Bengaluru, a global pitch competition offering a $1 million investment prize at the Silicon Valley Grand Finale. This iconic event connects startups with investors, VCs, and ecosystem enablers, providing a platform for early-stage founders and scaling ventures to shine. Apply by August 10, 2025, to take your startup to the world stage!"
full_address: Bangalore Institute of Technology, Krishna Rajendra Rd, Parvathipuram, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004, India
event_description:
​🚀 What if your next pitch takes you from Bengaluru to Silicon Valley? 🛫 From local hustle to global impact — Startup World Cup lands in Bengaluru!

​The world’s biggest startup competition – Startup World Cup, organized by Pegasus Tech Ventures, is coming to Bengaluru. In collaboration with CEDAT.

​This iconic global platform is your chance to launch your startup to the world stage and compete for a $1 million investment prize at the Grand Finale in Silicon Valley! 💸✨

​This is more than a pitch competition – it’s a gateway to global investors, VCs, and ecosystem enablers. Whether you’re an early-stage founder or scaling your venture – if you believe your startup has what it takes, this is YOUR moment to shine.

​🗓️ Key Dates to Remember:

​📌 Submission Deadline – 10 August 2025

​📌 Top 10 Startup Announcement – 13 August 2025

​📌 Pitch Day in Bengaluru – 23 August 2025

​📢 Apply here to pitch - https://www.startupworldcup.io/bangalore-regional

​If your idea can change the world, here’s your chance to prove it. where bold ideas break borders.

​📞 For more details contact ➡ ️Akash Akku – +91-6362850039 / 7259894114

​Let’s put Indian innovation on the global map.
